Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for a relaxing trip”
Reviews.Author: ksher21
Reviews.Content: The Inn at Key West is a beautiful hotel. Upon entering the lobby, you immediately feel like you're somewhere tropical. The rooms are small, but nice and clean. We ate lunch at the outdoor restaurant, which was good and convienent. The pool is definitely the selling point of this hotel. We hung out at the pool, enjoying cocktails and the steel drum music all day. Staff was courteous, and free parking is a plus. The ONLY downside is the location. It is on a main highway, and while mapquest says only a couple miles to Duval, cabs are expensive. The hotel always called a cab for us which, was nice, but we would have preferred to be near Duval. If you just plan to relax at the hotel, and not much traveling back and forth to Duval, this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Very little you get for the money you pay”
Reviews.Author: Natala
Reviews.Content: Well..i should start with the rate we paid. Was it a seasonal issue, any other reason - no ideas. Anyway for 350 usd a night for a standard room I wold expect a lot more. THE GOOD They do have a large pool, free parking area, breakfast is available at their restaurant, actually they do have everything you need - a shelter (room), meal, pool. THE BAD The place is situated faraway from the attraction sites and you won't be able to get there by feet. More than 3 miles, part of the way with no sidewalk while being on the main way - traffic is heavy. You do not want to walk there in the evening. We had a car and went to the main city walking area and parked there easy. As already noted by somebody it is really hard to drive out even if you turn right. My main concern was it was noisy there. In the night. Early morning they star to pick up the garbage or whatever - wake up call, Sir! Although you did not request it. The chicken.. OH, the chicken...They do have chicken everywhere. Especially at your window at the time the sunrise is to come. And they work hard. I mean they do sound good. Noway you miss your early breakfast. Part of the roms face the ocean - mean it the main road, the rest face the pool area and the back yard. We stayed on the back. The room is so small you hardly walk along the bed to reach the bathroom. The building is a 2-floor one with visible aging signs. No wireless internet available in the rooms (is it XXI century?). No meal available in the evening. Breakfast excluded from the price. The reception staff did not appear really nice and accomodating although gave short reply to my every question. Still I felt like disturbing them from talking to each other. So all in all I was not comfortable there and still wonder why did I choose to stay there and what did I pay for? Definitely not worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Quite far from the centre but we enjoyed that anyways!”
Reviews.Author: Ferginka
Reviews.Content: We didn't like a room orinted to the street so we asked for a different one, which was oriented to the pool area and that we liked. The whole hotel benefits from the pool area. Nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good, Bad & Ugly at the Inn of Key West”
Reviews.Author: panielsen Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Our room here was very nice and the beds real comfortable. Most of the rooms are situated in back so you don't have the traffic sounds and it is nicely secluded with many palms! The pool area was outstanding as was the outdoor bar with wonderful drinks! The employees were very helpful and considerate. The air-conditioner was rather loud and a service tech came within minutes of our call to clean it out and add another filter, really didn't help lower the sound however. Our in-room coffee pot didn't work and was immediately replaced along with extra coffee. We were fine with the location being 3 miles from Duval St. as we had rented a car and had known this. The concern I would have is that the Inn is positioned on a curve and was very hard to get out to the main street. There was a roll-over accident coming back one evening, much caution needs to be used. We did investigate the road in back of the Inn and it took us to one of the main intersection with lights....a definite plus. The hotel personnel should mention this! Room cleaning service does need improvement only in the area of it happening sooner. We stayed 4 nights and 3 of those they came around 4:00 when we were coming back and wanting to get ready for the evening. Now for the UGLY.....we didn't realize "Spring Break" started in the beginning of March. There was some pounding on the Inn's doors and yelling when some of the kids returned from the bars at 4:15 in the morning. We did report this and a security person came immediately. This, I'm sure, happened at many other places as well. All in all, we were pleased with this place for the value and beauty of the pool area and our room.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonably Priced For Key West”
Reviews.Author: hengie
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights here in February. It was a nice hotel - not new - but clean and good size rooms. The lobby is nice and has a small business center/computer area. We had a two-bed unit on the second floor, unfortunately away from the pool. The hotel is on a busy road, and the sidewalk is across the street. The pool was great, better than the pictures show. Very tropical, plenty of pool side chairs, a cabana area, and a tiki bar. Tim, the bartender, was really friendly and gave us lots of Key West tips. We made sure to stop back the following evening when we knew Tim was working again. There was a small workout room in the hotel, which I had practically to myself both days. The poolside restaurant had good breakfast food. First day our food came quickly; the second day, not so much. Too bad the breakfast wasn't included in the overnight stay. What the others mentioned about the resident parking lot rooster is true--he starts out early in the morning, until everyone is out of bed. The hotel is about 1 1/2 miles from Duval Street. We took a taxi downtown both evenings for less than $15 each way. Both times the taxi picked us up within 5 minutes. Downtown parking is spotty and the parking meters run 24/7and aren't cheap, so we felt the taxi was well worth it. Overall, we wish we'd have stayed at least one extra night.

Reviews.Title: “24 hours of a well needed Key West getaway!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Twenz01
Reviews.Content: Wow!! We were really impressed when entering the hotel & was greeted very nicely by the front desk ...had a quick check-in...walked into our room & was pleasantly surprised on how nice the room was. Clean & slept like a log...huge flat screen tv, frig, couch & great shower. Great place & will return for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Had a nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Sjsakv
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights as we got married in Key West. The rooms are nice, we had a ground floor room with patio facing the pool (very private). Our A/C leaked water and the carpet got soaked, maintenance came quickly to fix. It was completely cleaned up that day. Thanks to Tim the bar manager, he not only suggested a great restaurant for our wedding night, he actually got on the phone and made the reservations for us. It was fabulous and we received great service from him throughout our stay. The pool area is an absolute oasis. Service for breakfast was friendly but slow...but if you are on vacation, what's the big hurry. If you are on a schedule, maybe head elsewhere for breakfast. Downfall is the distance from Duval where the majority of the restaurants, touristy stuff is, I would rent a scooter if I were doing it over again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Glenn M
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very nice. The rooms are very nice, very modern showers. The pool is fantastic, even nicer then it looks in the pictures. Large, warm, nice Tikki Bar, nice area to eat outside. Plenty of places to sit by the pool both in and out of the sun. The one issue I see people complain about is the fact that it is three miles from Duval street. While true, I believe the pool and proximity to shopping, and plazas kore then make up for that. We purchased a one week pass for the local bus system, for $8 a piece. Go online and get the schedules, they come every 20 minutes or so. Perfect for taking down to Duval when you want to go. The buses stop relatively early, so grab a cab home. Costs $15 with tip. The $15 a night will seem like nothing when lying by that pool.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place...poor visit”
Reviews.Author: Balticrambler
Reviews.Content: The hotel was further away from the Old Key West than we planned. Fortunately, we used Parrothead Porters to shlep our bags and our Old Town Trolley Tours provided a shuttle service in the evening (Cabs are $20 one way) and morning as part of the tour ticket. Since the kitchen closed by 6pm, we had to walk along a Roosevelt Blvd on a dirt path in the dark (sidewalk/bike path was on the other side of a very busy highway) about a mile to a Shopping Center. There was a stoplight and we were able cross to Stone Crab Restaurant for a pricey meal. We were routed out of bead by a fire engine at 1 a.m. responding to a short circuit in the fire alarm system. There was no announcement to reassure the guests... it seemed a bit chaotic.

Reviews.Title: “Pool restaurant is poorly managed”
Reviews.Author: Thethomasrector
Reviews.Content: We showed up at 9 am for breakfast and had to wait while there were dirty tables not being bused. Our server was slow to take our order then 30 min of waiting we were then informed our order was lost

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - bad location”
Reviews.Author: SarahMikus
Reviews.Content: The staff was friendly and the hotel accommodations were nice, but the hotel is not in a good location if you want to spend your time downtown. It is a $15 cab ride to Duval Street and a 30 min bike ride to downtown, so we found it very inconveniently located. There is no shuttle service either. The rooms are nice, but don't pay extra for a balcony. They are TINY, we could hardly sit on it b/c it was so narrow and small. Our balcony looked out on the parking lot and was about 3 ft from the cars. To make matters worse, a rooster crowed beginning every afternoon at around 3pm and woke us up every morning. He loves the Inn's parking lot apparently! The bayside is horrible, it is located right on the road. The bathroom vanity are entirely too small, you can hardly fit any toiletries, etc on it, especially when you have 2 people in the room. I stayed at the Westin last time and will stay there again. It would have been the same price with the extra money spent on cab fares and bike rentals.

Reviews.Title: “A Bad Deal”
Reviews.Author: gwh_muc
Reviews.Content: I never before had a room like that: De Luxe Double Room - the only window of the room is beside the door, to enter from a roofed connecting passage. So you had to hold closed the curtains continously. At the room's end in an alcoven are the washbowls and in an adjacent cave room shower and toilet bowl. To point out is, that there was no ventilation!! Only under the window an air conditioner (very loud). After using the shower or toilet you have to leave the room. Misfortune, that at this time no other room was available. Very nice pool area. No WLAN. This was the poorest room in 4 weeks Florida and New England States.

Reviews.Title: “The Inn At Keywest-Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: vsndhr
Reviews.Content: A comfortable room, good poolside and Jacuzzi facilities and a short drive away from the Duval street...what else can you ask for when you are visiting Keywest. There is a small beach nearby and eating joints like Pizza Hut and iHop make it all the more convenient. Would certainly recommend this.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful pool; small rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Lulupink2
Reviews.Content: The pool area is just gorgeous. The rooms are tiny, the bathroom is cramped. The mini fridge is miniscule. The matresses are not great. The location is great if you are happy to be far away from Duval Street; i was. Breakfast is not included and there are no afternoon snacks so I would not call this place "good value." The restaurant is good, expensive. Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Krismccarty
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for the weekend and it was very nice. Room was great size, pool was awesome and drinks were very yummy! Price was a little high but other than that would recommend it. It is located towards the top of the island so you are a few miles from the hot spots (beaches and what not).

Reviews.Title: “Really liked the Inn at Key West”
Reviews.Author: daytrippers01
Reviews.Content: It was a very comfortable and fun place to be at the end of an active day/evening in town. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. We especially enjoyed the outside restaurant at breakfast and thought the lavish poolside landscaping was beautiful. Also enjoyed the live entertainment at the tiki bar. This was our second visit to Key West and we much preferred staying at The Inn at Key West instead of staying in town.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of promises...”
Reviews.Author: World T
Reviews.Content: Booked this after much searching during high season, 2 -3 weeks before our visit. We reserved a "Premier Queen Room, (2 queens in the main building), and requested the pool side on the second floor as we were wary of highway noise on the other side. (We originally considered this side for the Ocean View, until we realized that THE main road in Key West, HWY 1, is right there! On the day of our arrival, we called about halfway down the keys to confirm our reservation and request. We were told that there was one "Premier Queen" room available on the poolside, second floor, but they didn't "reserve rooms". When we arrived the only available rooms were on the Highway side. He said they had three available on the second floor, so not knowing anything about the rooms, I asked him to choose the one he thought was best. When we went up to the room we realized that there was NO VIEW, because of large palm trees directly in front of the balcony! So we got all the highway noise and none of the view. Not happy, I went back down to see about changing to one of the others. The first guy was busy with someone else and the other guys initial response was "we don't guarantee a view". He finally gave me a different room, but it to had the same problem! The third room, available when we first checked in was taken by someone else while we were going back and forth, and it had a view! So, I asked the desk clerks opinion and paid for it!! We were told we could check into switching the next day as we were staying two nights. We did that first thing the next morning and were told that are things would be moved for us during the day while were out. When we returned that night, after being gone all day seeing Key West for the first time, we discovered that NOTHING had happened. When I asked about it, another new person at the desk professed to know nothing about it, and said they had nothing available. We stayed again in the same room. I was very disappointed and frustrated, (didn't throw a fit though), and sensing that she called up to us a half hour later and said she had adjusted our bill down to compensate. I appreciated that, but would have rather stayed on the other side for the original price. She is the ONLY front desk person that did anything positive for us. (I don't consider an unfulfilled promise, positive). In short, the poolside is worth the price in the main building, but I the highway side is definitely NOT, in my opinion. If and when, I'll look elsewhere next time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ZeeZ0o
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel Pros: the pool is nice, service is excellent, rooms are cute cons: far from duval street and city center

Reviews.Title: “Inn at Key West”
Reviews.Author: DDDina
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Inn at Key West was very pleasant. The Cafe and pool are are beautiful done with palm trees and feels very tropical. The pool is absolutely beautiful and very clean as is the hotel. This is an old two story motel that was renovated in an "Inn". There is no elevator, which was not a problem and has the old fashioned air conditioner in the room. For some, that might be a downside. The rooms are adequate with an extremely small refrigerator, so it was difficult to put much in there. The food at the cafe is excellently prepared and a really nice setting to eat in. You have to drive into town or use cab service. Parking in town is a problem and very expensive at Mallory (which we got a ticket for being 30 minutes over), so be wary of that. If you don't want to bother with driving back and forth, then consider staying closer in, but that's more expensive. Overall, our stay was lovely, but the weather was not! Very cloudy and rainy. Also, be sure to visit the beaches and Ft. Zachary Taylor park by the naval base. Nice place to spend a day.

Reviews.Title: “Love this Inn!!!”
Reviews.Author: nicky053
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to the Inn of Key West. The first time was two years ago Christmas week. My husband and I adore this Inn. The rooms are lovely and well appointed. The staff is very helpful and friendly. The location is just a few minutes from town, just perfect. The pool area is the best that Key West has to offer including all the 5 star hotels on the island. In our opinion, you can't find a better Inn on the whole entire island and look forward to many more visits in the future.

Reviews.Title: “One nice experience”
Reviews.Author: Bill A
Reviews.Content: All of the hotel staff were great. Helpful and friendly. Our room was great! Very clean, well appointed and comfortable. The pool area was very nice and relaxing. We had a good meal delivered to our room later at night from a local Chinese restaurant the hotel recommended. The breakfast at the hotel was very good and reasonably priced. All in all a very pleasant, relaxing well accommodated hotel away from the crowds and hubbub of downtown. Would highly recommend and would definitely stay here again! I loved coffee on the lanai in the am watching the ibis playing in the parking lot.

Reviews.Title: “Housekeeping workers yelling at 8am”
Reviews.Author: sirgorpster
Reviews.Content: We found overpriced rooms with what looks like black mold on the ceiling and walls plus the walls were so thin we heard the radio from the outdoor cafe area. Then, in the morning the thin walls were not helped by the traffic of people marching back and forth. When the vioces turned to yelling I look out the door to see who could be so rude to find only the mango red shirts of the hotel staff! The pool was the best feature. The hotel location South side of N. Roosevelt is on an inside turn making the left turn towards old Key West area a nearly blind turn onto the always busy traffic. Also near IHOP which might make breakfast easy for some.

Reviews.Title: “5 star stay in Key West”
Reviews.Author: triple007
Reviews.Content: Would suggest getting a bike to go to town, its about 25 min bike ride. We didnt care for trolly, only took to town once in am and back once at 5ish. Taxi should be 13.00 fare, negotiate. If you get more people, you can share costs. The food was wonderful at hotel The fruit plate was very generous. Get the french toast! Staff always friendly and helpful. Top of the line service and hotel. The pool and hot tub were the best. Truly a great place

Reviews.Title: “The Inn at Key West”
Reviews.Author: donna c
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic hotel. The staff is very friendly and responds quickly to requests. The pool was absolutely fantastic...after a long day walking around Key West....it was wonderful to sit by the pool and relax .. The room was beautiful, beds very comfortable. I liked the location even though we had to drive to Duvall street and other areas, it was very easy to navigate and find parking downtown...so the 5 minute drive didn't bother me at all. I enjoyed leaving the crowds behind and having my own quiet sanctuary to return to.

Reviews.Title: “Great oasis on the north end of town”
Reviews.Author: LeeHopkins
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. The grounds were beautiful and the staff very friendly. We noticed there were lots of international guests. The pool bar and cafe offered good food and drinks. We only had breakfast there. There is an iHop immediately next door which offers a wider menu but the food on site was excellent and I think similarly priced. The only downside to this hotel is that it is about 3 miles from the heart of Key West. We rented bicycles which the concierge can arrange to have delivered (we walked down to the visitor center for rentals) and also walked all the way into town and back. Parking in town was easy to find and cabs appear to be easily obtained. The room was spotless and the linens top notch. We loved the roosters that roam free all over key west. Our only complaint was our maid failed to restock our coffee supplies during our 4 night stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wish I could have stayed longer.”
Reviews.Author: JPat40
Reviews.Content: I was hesitant that my room was all they way in back. I was silly. Te room was beautiful, the bed was extremely comfortable. Coffee on the patio was so pleasant. The bar was very relaxing and the Barmaid was so friendly. Wish I had stayed longer, the pool area looked beautiful. Everything was great.

Reviews.Title: “Nice pool area to relax.”
Reviews.Author: Al_baker1
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel with an awesome pool area to relax at. There was a tiki bar with food and drinks to have by the pool. The room was nice and right across from the pool. All the staff was extremely nice and helpful. If I had to say one negative it would be the location. We had to drive to Duvall street and other places to eat, shop, etc. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “this is an average hotel with some problems”
Reviews.Author: dnpinva
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not bad but I would note recommend staying here. Instead, I would recommend staying at the parrot key or doubletree for a little more money. The photos on the internet are gorgeous. While they are accurate, they can be a bit deceiving with gorgeous camera angles and shots of the best rooms. The pool is impressive during the day and gorgeous at night when lit up. The hotel is right on top of a major thoroughfare and has not grounds to speak of. The rooms are small and do not smell clean. The bathrooms are tiny. Most of the rooms do not have balconies, as the hotel indicates in its website. The TV was impressive. The room was mostly okay, but there were some cleanliness concerns. The bedspread had blood stains, including streaks of blood on it. I left a note for housecleaning, but it was still not changed. I had to call down and request a replacement. I didn't see any indications of bed bugs, but the streaks of blood were disconcerting. The TV was broken when we got to the room, but the staff promptly fixed it. The toilet broke, but the staff promptly fixed it (kudos to a young Latin gentleman who singlehandedly took apart the toilet and brought it back to working order in a matter or minutes). The staff was as helpful as they could, but the property could use some work to bring up to 3.5 star quality that would merit paying $200/night. It is in New Town Key West, a short drive from old town.

Reviews.Title: “5 star pool”
Reviews.Author: healsea
Reviews.Content: I guess I echo most of the reviews here. The pool and pool area are fantastic. The bartenders do a great job and the drink prices are reasonable. I was aware of the location from Duval street before I booked it, so no surprise there, it's a short cab or bike ride to the action. PROS - pool and tropical setting - friendly and experienced bartenders - good food at cafe and reasonable prices - value compared to other key west hotels - generous king room is very large, comfortable bed and bathroom - staff overall is friendly, they seemed a bit overworked - free parking - concierge service - the interior decoration of the hotel is superb, all with a tiki theme throughout and nice furniture in the rooms CONS - fountain wasn't working in the pool - rooms overlooking hwy 1 are too noisy to have balcony door open - check in was delayed over an hour due to systems malfunction, though they did give us 2 drink 2 tix to tiki bar - cleaning staff was sub par, there was a large pile of sand in our hallway for 3 full days before they vacuumed it up..other times the cleaning carts were left right in front of our door. Overall i would recommend as a nice place to stay in key west if you don't mind being away from walking distance to Duval and want a nice place to relax.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for the Money- Little Far from Duval”
Reviews.Author: BirdsMom
Reviews.Content: This property is very clean and serene! The decor was updated and nice. We loved how quiet it was at the pool. Normally we stay on Duval or near Mallory Square, but decided to try this. Only complaint would be the distance from Duval.A shuttle should be offered (like they do at the Marriott down the street). We went to Duval daily - but the cab rides were in the $40 roundtrip (w/ tip). IHop is next door and has great breakfast. There is a Publix and Outback Steakhouse within close walking distance too!

Reviews.Title: “Lots of choices Key West and this is an average one.”
Reviews.Author: Lawflake
Reviews.Content: We picked this off Expedia. It is an adequate choice. Not really close enough to walk anywhere interesting. Our room had burned out lights, broken flusher and warm refrigerator but all problems were fixed quickly. The pool is very nice and the poolside musician was really good. Inn cafe is decent with pokey service but good enough food.

Reviews.Title: “Its all good”
Reviews.Author: Cheryl G
Reviews.Content: Loved this place!!! Will definetly return. Beautiful pool area, lovely rooms. Not one complaint. We liked that we could take the shuttle to Duval Street and then return to the luxury of this hotel. The bar was fun and the bartender Tim...what can I say...he made the trip over the top fun! We had entertainment on Saturday..Tim Charron played the guitar and sang and entertained us all.

Reviews.Title: “best 25th anniversary”
Reviews.Author: koalatea
Reviews.Content: spent 4 wonderful days down in the key west for our 25th, it was great. The hotel was purfect! The atmosphere made you feel like you were in your own tropical paradise> Thanks, thats exactly what I wanted for this special time away with my hubby. The room was beautiful! The food was great! Have the breakfast were they put the eggs and cheese over a potato (forgot the name Sorry) it is fabulous!. Best vacation ever thanks

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to return”
Reviews.Author: Racinewisconsin
Reviews.Content: Returned last night from an amazing week at this hotel. Staff could not have been more accommodating in any way.Room size was great, had a king, bathroom amazing with rain shower. Pool amazing resort like feel. Tiki pool bar a great way to meet people and service right to your lawn chair. Tim the bartender made out trip so fun. Two girls traveling alone, he watched out for us! Restaurant on sight was unbelievable! You usually don't find that quality of food at hotel restaurant. We had a car and would if staying there again, too far from all the action to walk to anything. Cab ride $15 each way to Duval. Only negative would be the maid service, most days room not made up till 3 or 4 in the afternoon just when wanting to shower and clean up for evening. We definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Really pretty hotel”
Reviews.Author: bikegirl17
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well-decorated and really beautifully landscaped--you would never know that you are in a busy commercial location. The pool and cafe areas are filled with a luxurious amount of tropical foliage. The food was very good and the service outstanding from everyone we encountered. Maria at the front desk printed our boarding passes for us, and we were able to check-in early at 1pm. The location was good for us because we were looking for a quiet, relaxing hotel. There is also free parking, a great bonus. Our room was very comfortable. However, do not accept a room from 130-134--the housekeeping staff congregates in the walkway in front of and next to the last room, 134, and they are very loud. We were awakened multiple times in the morning by their loud voices. There was also a maintenance person working with tools on a cart right outside our room that created excess noise. A few points that could use attention: Workers congregating in the walkways and waking up guests! And the pool was not warm, even though it is supposed to be heated. Also, although the food, drinks and service were excellent, the coffee was terrible!

Reviews.Title: “Not the best location”
Reviews.Author: becsbuz
Reviews.Content: Room was great, pool heated and well maintained, staff helpful. The facility itself was well maintained and very nice. The whole problem was the location. You could see the water from the front door. However, it was across a very busy 5 lane road with no traffic lights in the near vacinity. Also, if you could safely cross the street, there was no access to the water. The nearest trolley stop was about 1/2 mile down the road-no sidewalks-over uneven pavement, past car dealerships, etc. Each taxi ride to town, the harbor, beaches was $13-$16. There was no courtesy shuttle. You could get bikes delivered to the hotel. So, I would not stay here again as I would like to do more that lay by the pool and found we were adding approximately $40-$50 per day in transportation costs.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, with some strange conditions”
Reviews.Author: vick2121
Reviews.Content: We got a super rate ($109) for a Garden Terrace King with reservations made 1 year in advance (oil spill scare still there? Haven't seen this rate again), and based on all the great reviews here, we were super excited. And based on the price alone, we should have given 5 stars. But little things. The pool was freezing (and we're from up north!), there was no hotel packet in the room so we had to go to the front counter to ask for any information we needed (to the point we felt we were being annoying), the window between the bathroom and the room meant the room got lit up when someone used the bathroom at night, and the toilet (despite having plenty of room to place it elsewhere) was so close to the wall you had to turn a little sideways to sit down. No shuttle, and $17 for two smallish watered down drinks seemed excessive. Rooms are nicely done, heard no outside or inside noises, super nice staff, beautiful grounds. If I ever went back to Key West (which I won't), I wouldn't hesitate to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Very happy with it”
Reviews.Author: Yehua O
Reviews.Content: This hotel is much better than what we expected! The location is great, only 10 minutes from the airport. IHOP is right next door, where we had a great breakfast. The scenery is very beautiful both outside and inside the hotel! The room is big. The two queen beds are very clean and comfortable! The pool is awesome!

Reviews.Title: “overall great place for $$”
Reviews.Author: heather t
Reviews.Content: Nice place, right next to a couple breakfast places which was really nice. Great pool, whirlpool was on, but jets weren't working. Tiki bar was great!! Rooms were small, but nice. Location is a $13 cab ride to downtown. I didn't have an issue with it due to the great rate we got, but not super convienent if u want to be close to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Good place”
Reviews.Author: Vidusrri
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was a good place. The pool area was amazing, It had one the most amazing pool with a tiki bar. The Wi-Fi was provided only in the common area which was a good thing.. so we dont get to use it in the room . The rooms do have the wired internet access available .. :) . The whole key west is a small area so no matter where you stay you can drive/ cycle to any place.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ben2774
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great value for money overall. The rooms were clean and tidy although on the small side and the beds were comfortable. The hotel was just under a 10 minute drive from the main area of key west. The staff were friendly and overall was a nice experience.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Bartender”
Reviews.Author: Jill M
Reviews.Content: Our Christmas stay at The Inn at Key West was everything we hoped it would be! Ironically, before leaving on our trip, we discussed how a great bartender would make for a great vacation. Luckily, that is what we got. Tim, our bartender, made our trip memorable. We arrived at a busy time and slipped into our suits while our room was being prepared. Tim not only made us some great cocktails and entertained us during the wait, but he continued to check on the status of our room. He was professional in manner but very approachable and affable. His knowledge of the area attractions and restaurants made planning our outings effortless. He even had menus faxed right to the bar! We spent a lot of our time around the pool and Tim anticipated our needs, never making us wait for service nor acting like our needs were putting him out. The poolside menu was delicious and we enjoyed the food. He was a model employee. We found all the staff to be helpful, especially the concierge staffers. We had a slight problem in getting housekeeping established at the start of our stay, but any request we made for towels or linens was responded to pretty quickly. We definitely plan to return next Christmas. Thanks for a great vacation experience.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and tidy. Quiet with a good pool”
Reviews.Author: Icarus1981
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights and were given an upgrade to a bigger room with a view over the pool. The pool is really nice and relaxing but it is a good drive into town or a $12 taxi ride each way. The staff were ok but not overly friendly and although our bed was made each day etc it wasn't really tidied as I would have expected. Worth staying if you want to chill (note there is no restaurant for evening meals)

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay in Key West”
Reviews.Author: RWG48
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stay here twice over the last two years prior to taking a 10 day cruise. The staff is friendly and the rooms are nice plus they have a beautiful pool. It located away from the hustle and bustle of Duval Street, but only a short drive to downtown Key West. They have an onsite concierge that is very helpful in providing restaurant suggestions, tours and etc. Only thing I wish the hotel provided was a free continental breakfast. All in all it's a great place to stay in Key West at a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Have to say I was disappointed....”
Reviews.Author: pnmbn
Reviews.Content: For our one night in Key West we were really looking for a bit of paradise. Upon check-in our room was dark and dingy. I went back to the desk to see if something else was available (I have NEVER done this in my life). I was told we could upgrade from a standard room to a deluxe room for $30. We did so. The room was lovely. We swam for a bit. I have to say the pool WAS exceptional, however the jacuzzi was not working the day we were there. We explored Key West. That night when we came back to the hotel, I was horrified to find 2 of the biggest roaches I've ever seen in my life in the bathroom. My husband killed them but my visit was ruined. I talked to the front desk person the next morning (Mark?), and was pretty much told roaches were to be expected in every Florida hotel. I have travelled Florida extensively and NEVER seen a roach in a hotel before. I didn't ask for a refund, I just wanted the $30 upgrade refunded and he refused. We won't be staying at this place any time again soon. Furthermore, it is quite a distance from everything that is Key West. For the price, there are nicer properties to be found.

Reviews.Title: “Third stay not the charm”
Reviews.Author: Shamoson
Reviews.Content: This is our third time staying here and I think we will try a new hotel on our next visit to Key West. The hotel is very nice...that is why had been there before. This trip, I requested the same type room I had in the past. We arrived at 1:30 and were told the room was not ready and check in was 3:00. This was not a problem, we went down town, walked around, had lunch and returned a little after 4:30. There was a different person at the desk, who seemed a bit agitated. I told him I wanted to pick up my keys and he checked to see if it was ready. He first said it was, which I did not think would be an issue at that time, but he then looked concerned and started typing on the computer a lot...which made think the room was not ready...or the one I was to have wasn't ready. He said it was not...It was now 4:45...but could give me the one next door. I went up to the room opened the door, and the room was a mess. I thought someone was staying there. I went back to reception and was given room this time next door. The room it self was nice, but had a very small bathroom with the closet in the bathroom, which was really a problem when sharing the room. Also this room has the smallest balcony I have ever seen. You had to move the chairs to open the door. Also, the problem I had in the past with the hotel was the AC. The units are not large enough to cool the rooms. I had been there I the past in the summer, but thought would not be an issue since I was going in Dec. it was again a problem and it was only about 80 degrees out side, but the room as not very cool at all and it was hard to sleep Again, I have liked the property in the past, the pool is great...nice tiki bar, lovely rooms....this was a let down room wise. I think I will try a new spot next time I am in town.

Reviews.Title: “Our Wonderful Two Day Stay”
Reviews.Author: Dakota-boy1
Reviews.Content: Rooms were better than we had expected-- Soon as you walk into the room your reaction will be like mine "WOW" Swimming pool and Tiki bar area was BEAUTIFUL.. All the employees were very nice and helpful.. You can't go wrong if you stay at this wonderful motel.

Reviews.Title: “NICE HOTEL FOR THE MONEY”
Reviews.Author: giselaramirez
Reviews.Content: Clean, Excelent Decoration and very nice vegetation, nice pool, clean bathroom, the beds are very confortable , some rooms had a very nice view of the ocean, the restaurant is litle, but price are affordable, the tiki bar at the pool had very nice drinks..

Reviews.Title: “Hidden jewel of Key West”
Reviews.Author: PeterOdgaard
Reviews.Content: The hotel it self called their hotel the hidden jewel of Key West, and I agree in this. It is a really nice hotel, with a nice pool area, the rooms are very nice, and the hotel staff is friendly and service minded. The only drawback is the distance the to "downtown" Key West, but still only a few minutes away.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing stay in Paradise”
Reviews.Author: ChristinaConcierge
Reviews.Content: The Inn at Key West was a magnificent place to stay for our Key West Visit. The property is stunning! Great curb appeal, the front of the property and the lobby are both filled with a classic charm with just enough island style to be warm but not tacky! Our room was incredibly well appointed. We stayed in 225 a Generous King Room on the front side with views of the gulf and a large balcony. The street noise is inaudible with the door closed and the beautiful views from the balcony are well worth it. Large flat screen tv's and a lovely seating area were also great parts of the room. The pool is by far the most amazing feature of the property. Itâ€™s enormous and surrounded by beautiful landscaping and some of the best outdoor lighting I have ever seen. Be sure to swing down after dark to get the full experience. The pool is fresh water so itâ€™s not full of chemicals. There is a nice pool side bar for easy drinking and the onsite cafÃ© serves poolside. The front desk staff and concierge are both incredibly helpful and made all our interactions seamless. This property is up island not in the old town/ seaport area. We rented bicycles for the week and itâ€™s a beautiful ride along the edge of the island to the busy districts about 10-15 minutes. The cost savings of staying at the Inn verses a similar star rated property downtown paid for the bike rentals multiple times over. I would recommend this property to anyone! Iâ€™m happy to answer any questions about our 5 star experience.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: lovestulips
Reviews.Content: This was our third time staying here and it was very nice. The room was really nice and service was great. One of the best things about this hotel is that it is away from the noise of Duval St. it has a great pool and terrific Tiki bar! The bartenders are great - very informative and fun to sit and chat with while sipping on great drinks! The restaurant is under new ownership and it was way better than before - enjoyed breakfast and lunch by the pool.

Reviews.Title: “The Inn at Key West was a great place to stay on vacation”
Reviews.Author: DandHDirkse
Reviews.Content: This place far exceeded our expectations. The staff was friendly and helpful, rooms and all amenities were well kept and clean. the location was convenient for all activities on the island. I researched several places on line prior to selecting the Inn at Key West and found that all of the information and pictures on the site held true unlike other properties that we actually saw while on vacation. I would definitely recommend this property to my friends and family along with anyone else. Take advantage of the staff and concierges knowledge of the area to find some special places and deals typically only known to the locals

Reviews.Title: “Bugs!!! Cockroaches and Bed Bugs!”
Reviews.Author: Loren S
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel. What a nightmare. First I saw a small bug in the tub but didn't think much of it. That night as I was sleeping I felt something tickling my arm. I thought it was my hair but it kept happening so I got out of bed and turned on the light. Right on my pillow was a HUGE COCKROACH! I reported this to the front desk immediately. They said they would send someone to the room and to close up all of my bags. They said they use very safe and effective chemicals and that they would call an exterminator. I went out for the day and when I returned I saw the cap to a bottle of Raid in the bathroom. Then I went to inspect around the bed and saw a Bed Bug crawling up the headboard!!! I also saw another bug on the baseboard! Enough was enough and I got the heck out of there. BEWARE!!!

Reviews.Title: “Only place we stay when we visit!”
Reviews.Author: SuziQzie
Reviews.Content: I could not have stumbled upon a better place to stay in Key West! The staff is super friendly, the rooms are gorgeous, and the pool us amazing! We recently went down the end of Sept/beginning of Oct. A lot of places were closed because Fantasy Week was around the cornet but we made the best of it! The pool is gorgeous and conveniently there is a tiki bar that serves food as well as alcohol. My second favorite part of the Inn is the shower!! It is a spacious shower with 2 shower heads! One that is regular and another one that is on the ceiling and rains! Amazing! I wouldn't stay anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Good place very clean excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: kng85
Reviews.Content: Good things Room was clean Staff was friendly Pool was awesome Drinks were very reasonably priced The two bartenders were awesome. They made great drinks, very fun, rmembered our names and had a great stash of menus so we could order food in at night cuz we wwere so tired. The front desk staff gave us great dining recommendations and also very friendly Considerations for your stay No shuttle, far away from town The bar and pool close at 10 at nite. Too early. The hot tub jets didn,t work but it was clean and warm so not a bad thing. I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful pools area, lush green foliage at nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: CheerySkiGirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Inn at Key West for three days in November 2011. Hotels in Key West are generally small, rather pricey and not fancy like a big city but for Key West this hotel was nice. Beautiful lobby area, excellent food and the pretty pool area is a huge plus. Rooms are rather large for Key West and decor is okay, balcony is very small and our room was rather dark - most likely because of all trees and foliage which blocked our windows but that also gave us privacy. Locale of hotel not great and at first we thought we were in the wrong place as it's settled between an IHOP and something else not at all "tropical" nor what I consider "Key Westish". You have to drive or cab to Duval Street, we always found parking. I've been to Key West before and near Duval can be rather noisy, so being ten min away from this area was okay by me but then again my husband doesn't drink, so that is always a plus to have a DD! The food was really good, breakfast excellent. The male Concierge (Bill, Bob, ?) was so helpful! He arranged our cameraman and snorkel excursion but it got cancelled due to high winds, he immediately ensured we would not be charged. He also recommend my most favorite and romantic night out - dinner at the Hot Tin Roof, we loved it! Thanks to him for that wonderful recommendation as it was our favorite night on the town. Another plus: We loved the secluded little whirlpool off to the side surrounded with a sandy beach-like atmosphere, very secluded with big lush green foliage and flowers.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Timetraveller49
Reviews.Content: We stayed for the days at The Inn at Key West in late October and thoroughly enjoyed our time there. The hotel is situated some distance from Duval Street and other major attractions of Key West,which suited us fine; the lively atmosphere of that area is great to visit but it's nice to stay in a quieter part of town. Our room was spacious and comfortable and we had a lovely, small private patio where we could sit in the evenings. The pool at The Inn is famous for being the largest in Key West and it is also very picturesque, with palm trees and tropical planting all around. However the pool isn't very deep - so not really great for swimming, just for relaxing and cooling off, but it's a great location for an evening cocktail and the tiki bar is great. We've visited Key West a number of times over the years and The Inn at Key West is the best place we've stayed.

Reviews.Title: “hotel is good, but not the location”
Reviews.Author: ypwalter
Reviews.Content: This hotel have nice facilities. Old rooms but doesn't look old, indeed they looked classic and cultural! I like their swimming pool, nice light with beautiful southern feeling. The lights in my room was having some trouble, light on and off for awhile, but I was so tired that fell asleep and still felt this is a good hotel. The location is a little bit too far from main activities area, but I park in the parking garage near the national park yankee ship, and went to square for fun at night. If you have a car, there would be no problem going there.

Reviews.Title: “It was the best”
Reviews.Author: Larry L
Reviews.Content: We travel a lot and this was one of the best places we've stayed. People were very friendly. Beautiful pool and grounds, We were so pleased and impressed when we walked into our room--it was so warm and inviting, and everything has a tropical feel. The staff was so helpful suggesting things to do in the area. We had a great time in Key West and will definitely stay at the Inn at Key West when we come back..

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Jenn Z
Reviews.Content: The Inn at Key West is a fantastic hotel! The pool is dreamy and the rooms are very nice and spacious. Everything on the property is well kept and in working condition. It is a bit of a drive from the main downtown area, but nice to be away from all the bars at night. Taxi is about 12 bucks to Duval one way, which split between two to three people is more than reasonable. If I were to return to Key West, I would stay here again without a doubt!

Reviews.Title: “Nice surprise....”
Reviews.Author: MexicoLuvinHillbilly
Reviews.Content: This place ended up being a very nice surprise. A wonderful place for the money. We went down to West Key in June with some friends of ours who budget was limited. We got somes awesome rates here, so we took a gamble because of the pool. (We're pool people) Our room was a generous king, and was large and lovely. The room as a small, but private patio area. Very nice. The food and drinks were average at best. A little expensive compared to our room cost. The pool was awesome for a pool in Key West. Palm trees and garden were very nice. Largest pool in Key West I believe. It also had a man-made beach area along one side of the pool. The Jacuzzi was nice too, but got hot after 10 or 15 minutes. The only negative side to this place, it is on the north end of Key West. We had to drive into town everyday for activities, dinner and bars. All and all it was a nice time here and and a pleasant surprise.

Reviews.Title: “Our Wedding!”
Reviews.Author: Adamsgirl_1119
Reviews.Content: Our stay was outstanding! This was a great trip, the staff went out of their way to make our wedding reception and our stay special. My family came in from out of state, and the hotel took great care of all of our needs. The rooms were great, the lobby gorgeous, but the best location is the swimming pool. My new husband and I took a two hour nap on the lounge chairs, and woke to a big iguana sunning himself on the waterfall! The food is great, Robert, the food and beverage director, was outstanding!!! THANK YOU for a beautiful stay!! We are already talking about our trip back to celebrate our anniversary!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Stay”
Reviews.Author: Solekka
Reviews.Content: What a hotel. Couldn't do more to make sure you get the stay you expect! We landed late in the night but were greated as old friends. We weren't that please with having a ground floor room as we couldn't enjoy the room at all times. The view past the car park is the sea and with a ground floor room, you dont want to be lounging around with people looking in. Not a problem, we asked to move, we paked our things and when we returned from our snoop around town, our luggage was in our new room. Nothing was too much trouble, all the staff were superb, especially a young guy with blond hair on the front desk. I wish I could remember his name, but we stayed at so many places on this trip. If Key West was less of a boozy, naff place, we would come back here without any hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in KW”
Reviews.Author: millenniumbridge
Reviews.Content: We chose it based on TA reviews and because it was reasonably priced (for KW standards). Rooms are comfortable with a massive bathroom. The highlight is definitely the swimming pool! We were tired after the drive from Miami and we spent a couple of hours chilling out by the pool and in the hot tub. It is a short drive away from downtown (FYI - finding a parking spot downtown isn't difficult at all). In the morning we had a nice breakfast (not included in the room price but still affordable)

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous property & pool”
Reviews.Author: peanutsNewYork
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel with a gorgeous, huge, heated outdoor pool with "Tiki Bar" . The rooms are extremely clean and comfortable. The only downside to this hotel is that they do not provide a free shuttle into old town Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Want to chill at a pool on vacation?”
Reviews.Author: Parrothead1975
Reviews.Content: This is definately the place to do it! This hotel has a beautiful pool surrounded by palm trees and lush greenery. There were plenty of lounge chairs for everyone and fresh towels. Its very quite and there is a secluded hot tub for full relaxation. The drinks are a bit pricey. The rooms are very clean and quiet. I would do some research on scooters and bike rentals on your own instead of going through the hotel. We found a scooter rental place for $100 less than what the hotel 'found' for us. The only way the hotel could improve is to include a breakfast or at least coffee.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms!”
Reviews.Author: mylittlepony21
Reviews.Content: After a nightmare of a time staying at the Travelodge we stayed here our last night in town. The rooms were beautifully decorated. Everything in the room looked new and updated including a flat screen TV. The beds were very comfy. The only complaint I had was we were located right by the pool and it stayed fairly loud until 10pm. Overall we enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Deal...Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: robert8185
Reviews.Content: We got an amazing deal through Travel Zoo (I highly recommend signing up for their newsletter) for this hotel which in reality was the only reason we considered booking here as it was our first time. We stayed during the final week of Fantasy Fest. The lobby of the hotel is beautiful. It makes you feel like your at an upscale beach resort from the moment you walk through the door. The hotel staff at the front desk were very helpful and quick, probably took us all of 5 minutes to check in. The pool area is wonderful and has a very tropical feel to it. There are random roosters walking around the property which kinda gives it a personality. They were never obtrusive during out time there. Our room was wonderful. They were quite spacious and the beds were not stuck to the ground so you could move them more towards the walls if you needed to for whatever reason. The bathroom was very nice as well. Only thing I didn't like was the fact that the doors couldn't be locked but this really wasn't a problem for us. They had a huge LCD TV in the room to go along with a mini-fridge in terms of amenities. Ladies leave your hair dryers at home, the room comes equip with one and a good one at that, not those crappy stuck to the wall ones some hotels offer. We were given room 148 which seemed to be perfect at first. First floor allowed us to unpack everything from the car rather quickly and the vending machines/ice machine is literally around the corner. Now the reason I gave this hotel 4 stars instead of 5. This room was located RIGHT NEXT TO the hotel staff's laundry room. We didn't hear any noise from the laundry room itself rather every morning we were awaken to the noise of countless of Maid carts making their way to and from this room. It was quite annoying but nothing that made our stay horrible in any way. We didn't even complain about it. As stated earlier the staff was very helpful. When we needed extra towels they didn't hesitate. When we needed to call a cab, the front desk handled it. We couldn't of asked for more from their part. Location wise this hotel is towards the beginning of the island, a $10-15 cab ride from Duval street. ($4.50pp if more than 4 ppl in the cab). There was a Publix, Mcdonalds, and IHop (basically on the property) all really nearby. All in all we would not hesitate in returning to this hotel if the price is right. If your considering this property for your next stay, don't hesitate, you will enjoy it.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Beautiful!!!”
Reviews.Author: Lisa G
Reviews.Content: The Inn at Key West is located in the most perfect location for us. Besides the beautiful views of the water across the street and the awesome hotel that it is, it's a short drive from all the action, but far enough from there if you want to be away from it. There are marinas close by that make it very convenient to launch our boat, and If you do not have one, there is a concierge that can help you with any activities you may want to do while visiting. The hotel is also close to plenty of grocery stores, places to eat and anything else you need!! Our room was spotless and felt like we were in a tropical designer showroom. The hotel is tastefully decorated in tropical decor with beautiful furnishings and high end wall coverings. The pool and tiki bar area are just stunning and the very friendly staff made you feel at home. We love The Inn at Key West and will be staying here every time we come down!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Its all about the Pool”
Reviews.Author: JPGSunderland
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights. The pool was fantastic with a hot tub surrounded by palm trees. I would agree with the previous review that a safe in teh room would have been nice - however we were given a safe at reception. I knew that his hotel was approx 3 miles out of the town centre but it was a bit of a pain to constantly order cabs or catch the bus, We even walked one day which was a nice walk. One issue we had was the room wasnt cleaned fully on every day we stayed, the bin wasnt emptied etc. Other than this the hotel was fab.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel. Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: madamcholet
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel for a base in the Keys. It has a fantastic pool area and the staff (Front Desk) cannot do enough for you. The rooms are comfortable and clean with all amenities. Room safe is the only thing lacking in my opinion. It is great value for money and is not too far from Duval Street if you want to take a taxi down which I would recommend as you will find it very difficult to park there. An excellent choice of hotel with very friendly staff and we would definately stay there again

Reviews.Title: “FAR MORE THEN WE EXPECTED!”
Reviews.Author: julievanloan
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel with friendly staff , clean rooms, great drinks, wonderful swimming pool and just an overall pleasant experience.. We were a little wary booking on line .. but this hotel was exactly what it looked like online and more. Tim is a more then helpful bartender and full of useful information- We had a fantastic time! Julie& Celeste Brooklyn, NY

Reviews.Title: “Nice, friendly Motel”
Reviews.Author: Tooshtoosh
Reviews.Content: We got a nice clean room, everybody were nice to us, also really nice looking pool. We had a car rented so it wasn't a problem for us that it was far from duvet street, though we paid 15$ to park in the street.. though I think that if you look for a spot to park and willing to walk a bit it might not be a problem. we didn't tried it however we only been there for one night. But I really enjoyed Key West ,it's atmosphere and sunset.... one of the places I enjoyed most at the US....

Reviews.Title: “Would go back anyday!”
Reviews.Author: Shawna M
Reviews.Content: Exceeded our expectations ten fold. Clean, friendly, gorgeous, only draw back is the location but it was also nice to be away from the main strip.

Reviews.Title: “Cockroaches!!!”
Reviews.Author: matchsalva
Reviews.Content: I normally don't write a review but I have to it with this one, just returning the favor for other people to benefit from. We found around 10 cockroaches in the drawe and pillow smells moldy. Price was ok but I should have just trusted my instict to stick with the big hotel chain.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the stay.”
Reviews.Author: ellzebeth
Reviews.Content: Traveling with a group of 10, we selected the Inn at Key West for our 4 night stay. As the island is not that big, it's relatively close to just about everything, no more than a 10 minute car ride. The hotel rooms are nicely appointed with dark wood furnishings. The king rooms offer a little more space for stretching out and moving about the room leisurely than do the rooms with the two queen beds. The bathroom space is adequate, and the rooms are equipped with an in-room safe, mini fridge, and the usual amenities. The wireless internet was a miss, as we were not able to pick up the signal in our rooms. The pool area was a definite hit! There's ample chairs for lounging, the bar nearby, and even a sandy 'beach' area which the kids were delighted with. Within a very short walk you could get to a Publix Grocery Store, IHOP, and several other little shopping & eating spots. This was a great choice for our group, especially given the rates of some of the properties closer to Duval, which appear to have about the same amount of space and nothing extraordinary to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room & great staff!”
Reviews.Author: WorldTraveler55374
Reviews.Content: We had a great time this last week at The Inn at Key West. It is a nice resort and has a great pool. If you want to get tan at the pool I suggest getting there in the morning by 9am because there is a bunch of palm trees so much of the chairs are shaded. The service at this place was great. Everyone was very nice. Drinks are a little bit spendy but that was expected. We only had breakfast at the hotel and the omlets are the best I have had. We had 2 rooms booked and stayed 2 extra nights because we were having a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable bed...avoid the breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: drb8f8
Reviews.Content: Our room was as nice as the website depicted. Hotel upgraded us to a patio room, which was nice, because it overlooked the pool. It is a $15+ cab fare every time you want to go downtown or to Duval Street. Parking is really expensive downtown if you can even get to a garage, so you might as well take a taxi. Parking at the hotel is free. Pool was really clean and hot tub was wonderful. Breakfast is not included. Don't eat at the tiki buffet. We got one of the cheaper breakfast meals (2 eggs, toast, and a side of meat) and for 2 people it was over $30. There is an Ihop next door.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mark V
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here October 22nd and really enjoyed our stay. Our room was very nice, clean and comfortable. The only thing that could have made it better is a water view, but this was a last minute reservation, and they were booked up. The food was excellent, but a little pricey, like all Hotels. The staff was very friendly, and helpful. We would stay here again anytime.

Reviews.Title: “wonderfull hotel”
Reviews.Author: srfoster_lpn
Reviews.Content: wonderfull stay ,beautifull hotel, we had a situation with the door lock but the staff handled with style and grace :)

Reviews.Title: “Did not live up to the hype.”
Reviews.Author: trigger_andy
Reviews.Content: I have always wanted to visit Key West and when I told a fellow Parent at my Child's School that we where going she recommended The Inn at Key West and after reading the reviews on here I booked three nights without even looking at other Hotels. When we arrived I decided to jump into bed for a quick nap as we had been on the road for nearly s and I found the sheet over the mattress very damp and on further investigation the Mattress was soaked through and heavily stained. When I complained to the Reception and they sent in the cleaners all they wanted to do was flip the Mattress over and put on fresh sheets. This left me disgusted and I requested a room change which was offered along with a few free drinks and $20 off each night of my stay. The Mattress was so heavily stained that I thought it was being taken out of the room to be disposed off, but no, it was just taken out and given a quick rub down and put back in again. When we moved to the next room the Air Con Unit never worked but to give the Inn credit they replaced it with a new unit.On the whole the Inn at Key West is a ok place to stay but nothing as plush as it looks on the Website and the pool although claiming to be the biggest on Key West is mediocre at best. but after the initial experience here I knew I would not enjoy my stay at the Inn. I dared not look at the Mattress knowing how they 'clean them.' I will come back to Key West in the Future but I will be giving the Inn at Key West a wide berth and stay at the Marriott.

Reviews.Title: “It just keeps getting better!!!!”
Reviews.Author: kikipoo1951
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have been staying at the Inn at Key West since 1999, before it was actually call the Inn at Key West. It was decent back in the late 90's, the absolutely awesome pool and waterfalls were already there, but the rooms left a little to be desired. When we returned to Key West in 2000, we stayed at the Casa Marina, but although it is an outstanding hotel, I much preferred the pool and hospitality at the now Inn at Key West. We have come back each year since then to better and better rooms and furnishings, ours is always one of the Garden Terrace rooms with the rain shower and all Tommy Bahama furnishings. The lush tropical foilage is so beautiful to look at and the fact that the pool is surrounded by patio stones and sand just makes it so inviting. The hot tub is to die for in the evenings. We have been served by all of the bartenders at the Tiki bar, K T, Tim and all and they all do an excellent job of fixing what you want. The bed will spoil you and the staff will too. I need to give a big shout out to my favorite reservationist Sandy Black, she has always gone out of her way to help me out with what I am wanting for that particular year. We will keep coming back. This hotel is so perfectly situated for us. Far enough away from Duval St. to get away from the hustle and bustle and close enough to Duval to have as much fun as we want on that particular day. Check with the concierge for snorkeling trips and other exciting thing to do. Love, love, love this spot in Paradise. We will be there the first of November with all the other Parrotheads. Can't wait.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED LOVED LOVED IT!!!!”
Reviews.Author: S l
Reviews.Content: The only downside to our stay was that it was only for ONE NIGHT!!! We are trying to figure out when we can get back to the Inn at Key West! The bed was amazingly comfortable, the pool and poolside with both patio and sand was SO relaxing and the bartenders were attentive and super friendly! We really could not have asked for a better stay. Until next time!!!! (Oh yea, and the gym was great too-what a view!!)

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Stay”
Reviews.Author: borntraveler84
Reviews.Content: This hotel is absolutely stunning. We came for a bachelorette trip weekend and enjoyed every bit of our stay. The rooms were gorgeous with great amenities. The pool area made you feel like you were on a tropical island in the caribbean. The lush trees protected us from the tropical downpour that unfortunately occurred our entire trip. The hotel staff were extremely friendly. We missed our connecting flight and had to arrive a day late; they changed our reservation without a problem. They even moved us to rooms right by the pool/bar area. Speaking of the bar, the bartenders were great! Tim was so friendly and funny. Even the bar food was good. I honestly cannot say one bad thing about this hotel. The quality you get for the reasonable rate is unbeatable. The bride-to-be is even considering extending her Orlando honeymoon to come down to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Top of the list!!!!”
Reviews.Author: chessybear
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend this property. From the efficient and pleasant manner that the staff "James, Tammy", welcome you to the concierge who googled up the weather for us thankyou all for a wonderful stay. We were here only one night, but my husband loved it so much he wants to return again when we renew our marriage vowels. The room we were upgraded into was wonderful we felt like we were in our own little Key West haven and the hotel is reflective of the area it is. Top marks for ambience and appeal, you have got it all RIGHT with decor in the rooms the extra comfy beds and space in both the bathroom (they have twin shower heads) and bedrooms. They have one of the nicest pools in the Key West area nicely planted to make you feel you are somewhere very tropical like the "Caribbean". They have complimentary wifi in the lobby area but I suspect our room "and I won't give that away" was close enough that it picked it up in the bedroom. I accidentally lost my ring, the staff was very helpful with filling out a form etc for this. Luckily I found it when I returned to home and went through my luggage properly. The hotel is about 10mins from downtown which suited us just fine as we had a rental car so if you have transportation then I recommend otherwise they do have taxis.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful - Best hotel on the island!!!”
Reviews.Author: SARAH B
Reviews.Content: We came here on our honeymoon and they upgraded us to the best room for free due to low bookings at this time of year. The staff are so friendly and welcoming. Even though it rained pretty much the whole time we were here we had so much fun in the luxury pool and hot tub which stays open late. The thing we were most amazed with was that the website photos really are true to the hotel. Its exactly as you see it. The rooms are great. The beds are so comfortable! We saw some of the other hotels on the island that we had also considered booking and this hotel blows them away! It really is the best! It is located on the more luxurious and quieter side of the island. Great for romantic getaways. If you do want the hustle and bustle of the bars and bachelor parties then you are a $10-$15 taxi ride away from Duval St it's also a very nice bike ride. You can rent bikes for $10 for 9 hours and it's really great fun to tour the island. It's an easy ride. One thing we love about the hotel is that you feel like you are in a tropical rainforest with the amount of palm trees. They are so beautiful and frame the pool perfectly. Overall... this place is wonderful. On a side note, we did notice that one couple was so rude and displeased because of something so minor and the staff did everything they could to accommodate them but there is just no pleasing some people. So i would urge you to take any bad review with a pinch of salt.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Cindy P
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed Oct 10-14, 2011 and greatly enjoyed it. The grounds are hotel are beautiful. It's not that far from downtown but far enough away to avoid the drinkers of duval st. We highly recommend staying here!

Reviews.Title: “Great Time - Great Inn!”
Reviews.Author: dulie501
Reviews.Content: I planned a surprise 65th birthday week in Key West for my husband. Even though we own a home there, I wanted a tourist feel for this week since we hadn't been to Key West in several years. I also invited my sister since she had never been to Key West. I chose The Inn because of its location, swimming pool area, and pool bar. The rooms were nicely decorated and really had a roomy feel to them. The pool area was large, lush, and tropical. The pool bar was a little noisy at times, but that's vacation! The entire staff was helpful and informative. Between wifi and the two computers located near the front desk, your email and other online needs will be met. The outdoor restaurant featured delicious food and congenial staff. It was also very interesting to meet and speak with some of the international guests at The Inn. Our stay was relaxing and very enjoyable. We plan on returning.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel- exceeded our expectations”
Reviews.Author: dinake
Reviews.Content: I was a little concerned about staying here after reading a few of the reviews. I was pleasantly surprised by our entire experience. We had the basic double queen room and it looked just like the photos on their website. The AC was cold and ran perfectly. We had a little patio with two chair to enjoy lounging outside. Our room was in the very back of the hotel, which was quiet and more secluded than the rooms around the pool. The only negative thing was the bathtub clogged up but they came and fixed it right away. Ryan at the front desk was great and gave us a free drink coupon to enjoy while we were checking in. They have a concierge that will call a taxi for you. The pool was awesome. We went at night after all the kids left Some important tips we learned paradise porters will pick up your luggage at the hotel and hold on to it near the Marina until you leave for the day. The Inn at Key West is far away from all of the action on Duval street. Thus, I think it is great for families but we spent alot of money in cabs going back and forth. There is the Old Town Trolley that will pick you up at the hotel at 9 and 10AM. They will take you down town where you can ride the trolley all day and then be transported back to your hotel on the hotel shuttle from mallory square. (this saved us two cab rides).

Reviews.Title: “Nicely furnished rooms, motel feel to it.”
Reviews.Author: sidney7474
Reviews.Content: As you are walking to your room you feel like you are staying at a old holiday inn in from years past. You basically park outside of your room and you have to walk the stairs to your room dragging your suitcase along. Once you open the door to your room you have a much different feeling about the place. The room is nicely furnished with top quality furniture, granite and a large flatscreen tv. The beds were very comfortable, but the rooms are a little small and there is alot of furniture in them. The pool looked nice, but we didn't swim. I liked this place, but would definately recommend the parrot key over this one.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: cac1966
Reviews.Content: We stayed October 5-6 and had a balcony room with no view. We have a palm tree that blocked everything. Oh well the room was awesome and the service was great. The pool is beautiful and the landscape is very tropical. The only thing negative I can say is if you need an elevator at your hotel this one does not have one for some reason.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay”
Reviews.Author: J A
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful, and the rooms follow the colonial style. Really friendly staff and lovely clean rooms. The pool is fantastic, and I cannot recommend this hotel enough.

Reviews.Title: “What a great experience!”
Reviews.Author: sludwick
Reviews.Content: We had such a good time at the pool, the bartender Tim was great! We even set up a volleyball net at the pool and got other guests involved. The food was great, breakfast and lunch and the concierge was more than helpful! My only complaint would be the location but they got us cabs so quickly it never mattered. Rooms were very clean and cozy, GREAT showers and nice views of the ocean on the front and poolside on the back. Cant say enough about the Inn at Key West. We will definitely return on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “I can't get enough of the Inn at Key West!”
Reviews.Author: Diane G
Reviews.Content: We did some extensive research about Key West Florida hotels and decided on The Inn at Key West. We followed their facebook page and saw that their guests really liked the hotel. We booked online and saved 15%. When we arrived it was just as beautiful as the pictures! There were 4 couples that went on our vacation and we just thoroughly enjoyed everything about the hotel, staff, food, bar, and the gorgeous pool! We found ourselves at the pool all day long, drink in hand, thoroughly enjoying our time in Key West. We will be back and will definitely stay at the Inn and recommend it to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “get a way weekend”
Reviews.Author: Meryl B
Reviews.Content: This is the place to stay while in the Keys, when you first enter the lobbby you know your in a class act Inn. we stayed for three days, the rooms are beautiful, nicley decorated and comfortable. the staff was extremley courtious and very helpfull, just a great bunch of people, that will go out of there way to take care of their guests.The property itself is great,is like your in another world,great big pool and lots of chairs and lounges for you to be very comfortable with. Lust vegation surounds the pool and bar area,would highly recemend, making this your choice of hotels while staying in the keys, had a great time and you will to.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise within paradise”
Reviews.Author: Mrsmarra
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stay here at least twice a year. The Minuit you walk in it feels luxurious. The hotel is about a ten minuit drive to duval street so it's a tad out of the way. That being said I have to admit that's what I love about it. Our last stay which happens to be today (we are checking out in the morning) was nothing short of a perfect ending to a very tiring couple days. We decided to stay here foe the last day after spending a few days on duval for the yearly poker run. Which happens to be bike week. The inn at key west was just what we needed. We checked in 2 hours early and plunked down at the pool. The pool area is so beautiful and private, you truely feel disconnected from the rest of the world. We ordered drinks and lunch. I had the brie and bacon sandwich with herbed mayo!! It was delish!! The menu prices were reasonable, definitly not the normal inflated 'hotel' prices. The service is very good. The rooms modern with flat screen rv's. The beds are very comfortable, the pillows are awesome. You can't beat the prices for key west. It makes our bike trip back to palm beach more bearable!! We will be back!!

Reviews.Title: “Great spot when visiting Key West”
Reviews.Author: sdeforest
Reviews.Content: The rooms are kind of "motelish." but comfortable and with everything one would expect to be in a hotel room. The property has lush vegetation throughout...especially around the dining area and the pool. The pool is huge, and according to some locals who "pool jump", the best in Key West. The food was very good and priced fairly. Great poolside bar. You are not very close to the old historic district, but seeing the mob scene there, who would want to be. I rented a bicycle and used it as transportation to get around. The traffic on Key West is scary...too many vehicles. I was there in Feb. 2011 for 4 nights.

Reviews.Title: “The Inn is The Place to Stay on Key West”
Reviews.Author: Jean S
Reviews.Content: I usually do not like to book a place sight-unseen been unpleasantly surprised too many times. Not so with The Inn. The property is clean, updated, excellent condition and just as presented. Very easy to find and not at all that far from the attractions. In fact the free shuttle picks you up at the front door and takes you right down to Mallory Square and back - no hassle. One or two trips on the shuttle and you know your way around KW if you wish to drive your car after shuttle stops running. We arrived and our room wasn't ready so the Reservation person (Tammi) gave us a couple of chits for free drinks at the bar while we waited. She came out to get us and told us that they upgraded our room because we had to wait. When we saw the room we were very pleasantly surprised - it was beautiful - particularly the shower - walk-in, plate glass wall and door, stacked stone, rainfall shower head - gorgeous and big enough for two! The room was very well appointed, everything seemed new and was in perfect working condition. The pool was huge and open at night - nothing like coming in late and being able to take a dip before retiring. Enjoyed more than a few cold ones at the poolside bar - excellent service and very accommodating bar help. All in all - cannot say enough good things about the property - in fact we do not have any negative things at all - we will always stay there on our return trips to Key West.
