One thing that was on the downside - dinner at Alonzo's - food came out ice cold and they didn't apologize or offer to make amends - just "Sorry" "Want it reheated?" - we all know how that works. (Note: Alonzo's has nothing to do with The Inn - it is far removed) Avoid the place - too many other good places to eat. Get a burger and fries at Sloppy Joe's - best ever!! J Soffel

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful anniversary trip!!”
Reviews.Author: Beccahill
Reviews.Content: We absolutely love staying here! We had complimentary champagne delivered to our room and waiting on ice when we got there. It was a great way to spend our anniversary. The pool was wonderful and so clean! It was refreshing for such a hot day. Best place to stay in Key West!

Reviews.Title: “Great accommodation, pool, atmosphere and service.”
Reviews.Author: lindzcope
Reviews.Content: My husband and I came to spend our 1 year anniversary in the keys. We were looking for a place that allowed us to enjoy our down time relaxing by the pool. We also wanted to snorkel, scuba, kayak and experience duval street. We knew we would be approx 1.5 miles from ducal, so we rented scooters. It was perfect. The scooters allowed us to really get out and see the entire island without worrying about parking, or riding bikes were we would tire ourselves out. It is far from duval street though. So if you want walking distance to duval, this is not the place for you. A review I read before did say something about the hotel having a bad smell, and they were right. In the room, it wasn't pleasant. You get used to it though. We didn't spend much time in the room, so it was ok for us. We did get a balacony room, but not worth it because you cant. See anythinng from it. I would skip out on that. Not very many rooms overlooked the pool. The pool is what sells this hotel. Its gorgeous! We even saw a 3ft green iguana come out from the bushes next to us. It was very tropical, live music one evening was a bonus. There are kids playing in the pool, but we didn't mind. If your looking for a place with no children, this isn't for you. The pool bar drinks were good, but expensive, like everything else I suppose. The pics on the website are a perfect dipiction of what this hotel looks like. Overall, we really enjoyed our stay here. I would definitely rent scooters and bring air fresher!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful trip”
Reviews.Author: sfltraveler
Reviews.Content: My girlfriends and I loved our stay here. The pool area is awesome. You must try the Key Lime Martini! And the food is very good by the pool also. You do have to drive or take a taxi to Duval St, but parking wasn't that bad. It just took a couple minutes looking for a metered spot. The staff was very friendly at the front desk and the activities desk. My only complaint is the housekeeping staff. When they cleaned rooms they left the safety lock open to hold the door from locking behind them. Then they repeatedly would go in and out of the rooms slamming the doors against these locks. It started early in the morning and continued for hours. Sooooo.. if you want to sleep in, you may want to find another hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Worth a look”
Reviews.Author: 3frequenttrvler
Reviews.Content: Inn on key west-clean, nice bed and bedding. A bit far from town, and with rates appx the same as the westin, iâ€™d likely head downtown next time. Pool is large and the staff are all very friendly. Gym was nice and rooms well appointed. You park in front of your room though....i always feel more secure having a lobby. In my mind itâ€™s a 99 dollar place....

Reviews.Title: “It was great and are already planning a trip back”
Reviews.Author: Vanessa M
Reviews.Content: The hotel was beautiful and relaxing. Not only did my husband and I love it but my children also loved it.

Reviews.Title: “What a disappointment”
Reviews.Author: SanderHendriks
Reviews.Content: We reserves this hotel 6 months in advance and were really looking forward to our stay. We were disappointed however. At check-in when we ww. Ted to pat cash Rudy were suddenly very difficult and it toom them 5 minutes and 2 ppl to decide of they were going to accept 1 hundred dollar Bill. We got a smelly room way in the back behind the wash department. We had Ã  bad night's sleep because of The Noise from the airco and ppl walking by outside. At breakfast we had some 'fresh' fruit that turned out to be yesterday's and had turned sour. On THE positive side, THE pool was very nice and big. We had planned Ã  3 day stay but moved to THE Southernmost Hotel after THE fitst day. It is Ã  big improvement.

Reviews.Title: “Great Get Away spot”
Reviews.Author: justjoeyFtL
Reviews.Content: For a hotel with all the conveniences I was very pleasantly surprised. From check in to check out evrything was just great.

Reviews.Title: “What a beautiful hotel, we'll definitely stay there again!”
Reviews.Author: ABPFortLauderdale
Reviews.Content: We are Florida residents but had never stayed at this hotel before. Close friends of ours chose the hotel for their after wedding gathering. When we looked on the internet, the pictures showed a beautiful hotel. We were not disappointed. The rooms were exquisite and clean and we loved the decor including the unique bathroom. The staff was pleasant and responsive to our requests. We had breakfast at the restaurant - the food was great and the service was very good. The pool area was really pretty. Everything was kept up well and we were in a great location to see the rest of Key West. We will definitely stay there when we visit Key West again.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful hotel at reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: Heidi D
Reviews.Content: This is our family's second time in Key West. We are a family of four, with a 12 and 15 year old. We went summer of 2010. Didn't like the hotel we stayed in last summer and tried a different one this summer. It also was a chain hotel and quite run down. We drove around and stopped in at The Inn at Key West and asked to see a room, so the next time we came down we would know where to stay. The hotel is so beautiful and the rooms were also very nice. We asked if there was any way to stay there that night. They were so accommodating and had a cancellation later that morning and let us know that we could stay there that day. We promptly checked out of our old hotel and enjoyed a glorious day and a half at this hotel. The rooms are so nice and clean and newly renovated. The AC worked great and took the humidity out of the room. Spacious and clean. We stayed in the main building, which I would recommend. The pool is absolutely beautiful and the water was not disgustingly warm and cloudy like at some of the other hotels we stayed at. I will be happy to recommend this hotel to friends, and now we know where to stay the next time we are in Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, beware of weekends!”
Reviews.Author: Birotteau
Reviews.Content: Good location if you have a car (a requisite in southern Florida), nice hotel. CONS: My room overlooked a corridor (got to say hello to lots of people passing by!) and I enjoyed the visit of some smaller bugs (one of which decided to take a closer look at my cerals). The air conditioning, a huge artifact close to the floor, made a terrible noise upon checking in - was immediately replaced. The coffee maker was not working, and it took some work to get it fixed. Saturday and Sundays were very crowded, with a particular emphasis on younger kids. Loud live music, followed by loud re-mixed electronic music, filled the weekend afternoons. PROS: Relatively large room, large pool, nice chairs, reasonable breakfast ($13 for a good continental option), convenient parking. Earlier than anticipated check-in (around 10 am).

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: kathynbilly
Reviews.Content: Exactly how it looks in pictures! This hotel is wonderful! Extremely clean and well maintained. The rooms and bathrooms are very nicely modeled and the bed was comfortable. The pool area is beautiful and spacious so it felt like three pools in one, so you never felt crowded or slighted for space. We had lunch at the pool tiki bar everyday (along with a beverage or two). Food was very good (we loved the blackened shrimp wraps) and you got plenty of it. The only drawback was no shuttle so we had to take a taxi to downtown if we wanted to drink. $15 each way but it still beats a DUI, and we knew going in where the hotel was located. From check-in to check-out, at which they printed our boarding passes for our flight, it was one of my best experiences in Key West. We will definitely come back to this haven.

Reviews.Title: “A great base from which to explore the Keys!”
Reviews.Author: FJLION
Reviews.Content: Lovely tropical surroundings with very friendly staff. Great pool and bar area. The rooms are a bit small but comfortably slept the 4 of us. More storage space would have been useful but the decor of the room was of high standard and lovely. We had a great five days and would certainly recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Reviews correct. We loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: Jim N
Reviews.Content: Really beautiful place. Lobby/hallways/rooms tastefully decorated & comfy feel. Pool/tiki bar excellent. Lunch/light snacks by pool reasonable & good. Have Tim the bartender make you a banana-strawberry smoothie with some rum poured on top.... Had slight loud tick occasionally with our a/c, but not enough to hamper sleep. Staff very friendly & knowledgeable. They helped us with scooter rental-jet ski trip & even told us about terrific local bar/restaurant which was great.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Getaway”
Reviews.Author: jaycat
Reviews.Content: This hotel was one of the nicest ones I have stayed at in a long time. The amenities - pool - was wonderful. You could get sun, or shade. The employees were very friendly and helpful; from the Management to the room service attendants, and all in between. You have all the amenities right there. Tiki bar was fun & lively.

Reviews.Title: “I will be back!”
Reviews.Author: Huggabeans
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at a number of hotels in Key West--and this one was ONE of the best. The rooms were very clean and nice! The pool area was awesome. Parking was free--and the staff was wonderful. The room had more than enough space for me and my family--with a queen size pull out sofa! The staff also told us about the Florida Residents discount--our room was about $170 per night. Not a bad price for Key West!

Reviews.Title: “Another good stay...but need to keep the air on”
Reviews.Author: Shamoson
Reviews.Content: We returned for a second trip to the Inn at Key West. It is a great escape away from the crazy of Duval street. We stayed in a Deluxe King with a balcony over looking the pool and the room is very well appointed with lovely furniture and a nice bathroom. The only issue I can bring up is the air conditioning. We were there in August, and it is hot in the keys, We had to wait to check in to our room as it was being cleaned, so there was someone in prior so it is not like they turned the air off to conserve energy when the room was not being used. When we got into our room, the temp was set at 80 degrees and it was much warmer than that with the sun coming into the room. The rooms only have a small window type airconditioner you would see in a home, so it took over 1/2 our stay for the room to cool down. It was cooler with the door open to the hall way. It was hard to sleep the first night we were there. I am not sure if it is a directive by management to the cleaning staff to save energy or just a mistake, but need to make sure the temp is adjusted for guests checking in. Besides this, everything else was great...the pool is fabulous, they have a nice outdoor tikibar, that serves up great frozen drinks. We did not find the location an issue. We were there starting on a Sunday, so had not problem finding parking downtown. Also the free parking at the hotel was great. I would highly recommend

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Accommodations and Great Value!”
Reviews.Author: Lindsey L
Reviews.Content: We chose the Inn at Key West for a short family vacation and we are glad we did! The accommodations were comfortable, the pool was beautiful and huge, and the staff were extremely friendly. Located on the north end of the island, it was very family-friendly and away from the chaos of Duval St. Since the island is only 2mi by 4mi, it is still a convenient location to restaurants, shopping, and attractions. I'm not sure if we'll make it back to Key West, but would definitely stay here again if we do.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: aew02
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Inn for 7 days! It was the nicest hotel we've stayed at, the rooms were superior! The beds were extremely comfortable, bathroom was very clean as was the rest of the room. The tiki bar at the hotel was great as well. Tim was our favorite bar tender! Tim was more than outstanding with helping us get a taxi to the airport and offered to print our boarding passes to save time at the airport. The location is uptown Key West, but still only a few minutes from all the attractions. We highly reccomend this hotel to anyone traveling to Key West! If your looking for a place to get engaged(we did,) get married or honeymoon this would also be a great place for all of the above!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous place to stay in Key West!”
Reviews.Author: Reba212
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed my stay. The pool area is fabulous! Food and service in the restaurant was great. Loved that they had cold water available in the lobby all the time. The rooms were a good size. Some have balconies or porches. I found the bed incredibly comfortable. I would most assuredly stay there again if I were in Key West!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic time in Key West”
Reviews.Author: jjlandlmt
Reviews.Content: The Inn at Key West was a terrific place to stay. The pool area is fabulous. The breakfast provided by Robert is great. I would have been happy with the fruit and cereal, but the menu was out of this world. We went for a large celebration and had around 40 rooms. The staff could not have been more accomodating. Even though there were large swaths of guests coming and going at the same time, there was always a laid back Key West feel. The highlight of the weekend was hanging out in the perfect temperature pool with one of the exotic drinks and laughing and telling stories.

Reviews.Title: “You won't be sorry!”
Reviews.Author: Mwillinger
Reviews.Content: We stayed here and could not have been more pleased. Walking in we knew we had made the right choice. The location was great. The staff were friendly and accommodating. Our room overlooked the pool but the actual pool view was obstructed by lots of trees and plants. This provided a "sound barrier" from the pool noise and made us feel like we were in a tropical paradise. The pool itself was amazing! One day we scraped our daily plans and just "pooled it" for the day! One thing to keep in mind is that kids are allowed here and there were some around, but not many. This could be because we came in the off season. Don't let that detur you though! The pool was plenty big enough. The tiki bar made super drinks! No skimping on the pour here. We also had lunch at the pool and the food was really good. Our room was always clean and cool. The staff had lots of advice for things to do and places to eat that were off the beaten path. (something we love) We will be back for sure!!

Reviews.Title: “A treasure”
Reviews.Author: Pete189541
Reviews.Content: This is the closest you get to a bountyland hotel on mainland USA! The interior of the hotel is beautifully decorated, the atmosphere is great, the receptionists friendly and professional, the rooms clean, and the swimmingpool even has a small "beach". The hotel is located about 2 miles from the city center and a few yards from the waterfront which gives you the opportunity to see the sunset of your life.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and clean hotel. Beautiful pool and landscaping !”
Reviews.Author: cricrimax
Reviews.Content: Nice and clean hotel. Beautiful pool and landscaping !

Reviews.Title: “we loved the inn and we will be back very soon”
Reviews.Author: kenny1974
Reviews.Content: the inn is a great place to stay and we loved every minute of our trip.they have the biggest pool on the island the best poolside bar what more could you ask for and it doesnt stop there great bartenders polite and helpful housekeeping,a wonderful selection of food ( probably the best breakfast i have ever had).no hassle check in, everyone should give this place a chance its worth the trip.

Reviews.Title: “See ya next year”
Reviews.Author: mykidsinheritance
Reviews.Content: This was our third consecutive year that we have stayed at "The Inn". As always, the staff is friendly, rooms are beautiful and the location is convenient for our Lobster Diving Trip.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with a great pool area!”
Reviews.Author: drdfsdaz
Reviews.Content: On the main highway coming into Key West, about 1 1/2 miles from Old Town, and makes a nice place for families to visit Key West. Nice lobby with friendly desk people and an outdoor covered restuarant near the pool area (or an IHOP right next door). The room was nice and clean, with a big bath room, but the best part was the pool, which was extra large and had lots of chairs and lots of shade. Easy drive into Old Town to see all the sights and find a good place to eat. Nice hotel to take the kids.

Reviews.Title: “Unique Gardens, beautiful pool and a great night sleep”
Reviews.Author: JamesBBQ
Reviews.Content: This place is a perfect getaway. Excellent Beds. No moldy smell as with other hotels in the area. Tammy on the front desk makes you feel immediately at home, and at ease. The Beds........ wow. Super comfortable. The gardens surrounding the giant pool are manicured and mature. Got a few ideas for my own landscaping at home. As we sat on our little patio and looked over to the ocean I notice a beautiful green iguana. Couldn't see it at first because it was the same color as the leaves on the bougainvillea bush is was resting on. A truly tropical paradise. I think it's the best value in Key West.

Reviews.Title: “We did not want to leave...”
Reviews.Author: Lisetica15517
Reviews.Content: "The pictures on the website are real!", was my first thought when I walk into the lobby as I was a skeptic - I must admit. Tammy had taken my reservation over the phone and was just ask helpful when we were checking in as she had been on the phone. Walked in the room and yet again, the room was just as it looked on the website and just as we had hoped for. The Bathroom was spacious and comfortable. There was a small, private patio which was cool, but I wish it would have had a jacuzzi. Maybe they'll take this as a "hint". THE POOL - yes, all of the other reviews are true. It is amazing!! I think it's all of those trees surrounding it or its size - not sure. It was very clean too. We really wish we would have had more time to stay and enjoy the hotel overall some more. Oh and the gym was just what I needed. Equipped with cardio equipment, nice and clean. It is a little far from Duval St. but we did not mind staying away from the noise and darkness of that side of town at night.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and clean”
Reviews.Author: jrw0808
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not right in the heart of Key West but on the island. I was very impressed with the staff and how the properties are maintained. We had a room in the back and it had a private sitting area outside the room where countless numbers of wild chickens from adults to baby chicks walked by. The price was right and thats not easy to do in Key West. I would go again and recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back.”
Reviews.Author: Harvlom
Reviews.Content: We were very happy with our choice of the Inn at Key West. Location was perfect. Less than 3 miles from the heart of town. Room was not gigantic but very satisfactory and clean. Bathroom was huge. The pool was amazing as advertised and absolutely beautiful. The staff was very friendly and extremely helpful. I am looking forward to visiting Key West again soon. It is paradise and the Inn at Key West adds to the experience.

Reviews.Title: “a key west gem!!”
Reviews.Author: jackie34094
Reviews.Content: The room was updated and clean. The beds were comfortable. The pool area was very nice too!

Reviews.Title: “Really nice but sort reception!”
Reviews.Author: Harleyclarkey
Reviews.Content: Really good location right beside the water!. Yes, you are a bit away from "downtown" but this is not a big problem. What was a huge problem was trying to check in and be a guest. We booked by phone and agreed a rate. It was harder to check into this hotel than to enter the States through Homeland Security at the airport. I had AAA...OK the card (given to me 3 weeks earlier by the AA) was out of date. My AA/AAA card wasn't. "I'll see if this is acceptable to my manager" as she disappeared for the 2nd time to the office. She came back and in front of us started to examine in great detail my AA/AAA card. I ignored her. "right your rate is $xxx" No, I replied we agreed $xxx with your colleague. "Not possible. Who did you agree this with. What is her name, etc, etc.?". This rude, hostile and unacceptable interrogation continued. Eventually she actually stated "You won't get that rate till I see it in black and white!!!". What she actually was saying was "I don't believe you and you are trying to cheat me and the hotel". Unacceptable and more than unwelcome. This is not service...this is downright insulting. Later we spotted a new man on reception who was James, from France, and we told him our tale. Within seconds he changed the rate to that which was agreed on booking, offered his sincere apologies and 2 complimentary cocktails. This is real service...this is dealing with a problem and actually believing your guests. He is an asset to the Inn with the other a liability. The Inn? We liked it....only after our dealings with James. The reception area is large and impressive. Lots of parking right by your room. The room itself was very comfortable, modern and clean. The pool is about as good as you will get with a pool side bar. I would, despite the initial dreadful "welcome" , would stay again and recommend "The Inn".

Reviews.Title: “Great place...can't wait to return!”
Reviews.Author: Rachel330
Reviews.Content: After researching several hotels in Key West, we chose the Inn at Key West because it seemed to offer all we were looking for in a vacation hotel. We weren't disappointed!!! Our room was spacious with a large bathroom. The pool is exactly as advertised...large and scenic. While you have to drive to Duval Street and the beach, they are easy to get to. We rented a car, but there are also moped and bike rental places within walking distance. The staff at The Inn was very friendly and helpful. The Tiki Bar and restaurant were both very good and reasonably priced. Overall, a great place for the money!

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT!!!”
Reviews.Author: dvaldes22
Reviews.Content: Great hotel with very comfortable rooms and very clean. The pool is incredible, it is very large and the grounds are stunning. For being in Key West the hotel has amazing quality. We brought some extra people and had no issues, they provided us with two parking decals for no additional charge. I would love to stay here again because we only stayed one night and did not get to fully enjoy it. The staff is very nice and accomodating and the hotel location is perfect, only a few minutes away from all attractions in Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Suggested by Local Business and worth it.”
Reviews.Author: beef309
Reviews.Content: We were steered here by a local restaurant manager (Fogarty's) and it was a great choice. Nice clean rooms, attentive staff, Tiki Bar at the pool and very nice cafe for lunch and dinner. Moderately priced and very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and very beautiful.”
Reviews.Author: GwenP
Reviews.Content: My family stayed here for one night while visiting Key West. Though the hotel is a ten minute drive to the center of town, we found that to be a plus - though it would have been wonderful to have a hotel shuttle take us to town rather than having to find/pay for parking. The hotel is well run and managed. The rooms are quite large and very pretty. We got a second story room facing the road/ocean which disappointed us since we would have preferred one facing the pool, but it turned out fine. The pool is amazing and we all hated to get out of it. The kids LOVED the waterfalls and the size. They turn the falls off in the evening so it's not as noisy for the folks with rooms facing the pool. We would certainly recommend this hotel to others! Note: They do NOT have an elevator so you have to lug your stuff up the stairs if your room is on the second floor.

Reviews.Title: “we loved our stay”
Reviews.Author: gypsy_1207
Reviews.Content: very nice place to stay" The Inn at Key West" , staff was really awesome and rooms were very nicely managed.

Reviews.Title: “Why isn't this place more popular??”
Reviews.Author: anhellica1979
Reviews.Content: Wonderful stay, recommend this hotel highly. The pool area is an oasis and the beds are super comfy. The staff was wonderfully accomodating--anything you need to know about the area, ask the concierge!! The room was clean and all facilities close by. There are supermarkets, a movie theater, and lots of other amenities within walking distance. The food at the restaurant was delicious. The only thing I wish they had was a shuttle to the main drag. While it's great that we were away from the Duval crawl and the rowdy nighttime crowd, I found it a little inconvenient to have to find parking around town. You could rent a scooter or a bike to get around, we just didn't have time to do it this trip.

Reviews.Title: “Love the rooms!”
Reviews.Author: Strandsone
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel. Lovely rooms decorated with tropical style-I loved it!!! 42" LCD-TV. The bathroom is beautiful and clean. Garden/poolarea is nice too. The only negative is that the pool was quite dirty, even that it was'nt many people staying at the hotel. I read on other rewievs that the location was a problem, and that's true. You need a taxi when you want to go downtown. But I think you will enjoy the hotel anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded our expectations!”
Reviews.Author: Pennyjo85
Reviews.Content: Your online photos do not do justice to your hotel. Every aspect was wonderful, the furnishings, the gorgeous landscape, the Tiki Bar and pool, and the overall service we received at the Inn at Key West. We did not visit the cafe, but certainly will when we return. We felt very comfortable here and enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, not a convenient location”
Reviews.Author: lane_joshua
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were going to Miami for a vacation and decided to go to Key West for a couple days since we would be so close. We stayed at The Inn at Key West on a recommendation from a co-worker. The rooms were very clean, large and tastefully decorated. The staff was very friendly and helpful with any concerns. They even gave us a late checkout (4:00pm!) so we could come back and shower after a snorkeling trip! The only negative is the location. It is very easy to find when you get onto the island but it is not a place to stay if you are wanting to park your car and walk to see the island. Overall this is a great hotel at a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “dirty”
Reviews.Author: nothappy03
Reviews.Content: The check-in area is gorgeous. Rooms are outside rooms.... which I don't like. Room has nice marble countertop. Shower just a reguar shower, bed had stains on sheet and asked them to change sheets. They apologized; however, there were dirty handprints on walls, and ceiling. I made them aware of the handprints, and they said they would change rooms the next morning as they were booked that night. I never received any notification that next morning to change rrooms. Checked out 2 days later, and asked for compensation for the uncleanliness. The manager said since I booked with Expedia I wil need to contact them. Called Expedia 4 days later. Expedia refunded 10%. Expedia called them and they refused to compensate. Would never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Better then expected”
Reviews.Author: kruezers
Reviews.Content: I was a little nervous at first. I found the hotel through Trip Advisor to check the ratings which made me feel more comfortable with our choice. We stayed one night and I was pleasantly suprised at the cleanliness of the room and how accomadating the staff was. This was my first time in Key West and I thought if the hotel wasn't up near $300 it'd be a roach motel and this was not the case. If we were staying in Key west I would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good, We'd stay again”
Reviews.Author: Shay-DBiv
Reviews.Content: I was pretty impressed with the accomodations, I wasn't sure what to expect because with the amount of travelling we do for business and pleasure I've never been happy with the cleanliness of very many rooms. We paid $178 for one night, double queen beds, family of 4. The lobby was very nice as most are, they have some refreshments off to the side to welcome you which I thought was a nice idea. The Inn is close to a lot of shopping and places to eat. The culture of the area is very laid back and everyone seemed friendly enough. We ate at my fave Benihana's and the prices were more than twice what we pay at home but this is Key West, things were quite expensive. The room itsself was very clean as far as the linen, towels, and furniture go (I wipe down everything when we visit hotels for my own comfort). I was surprised because the outter door to the room was disgusting. It was painted white and it was now brown and black from dirt and scuff marks they desperately need to run a few magic erasers over it. The same goes for the walls there was visible dirt and scuff marks over all of the walls, at little more attention here would have made the room outstanding. The bathroom was clean only issue in there was the shower curtain, be careful not to let the shower head spray water directly on it as the one in our room wasn't a true shower liner. It was obviously very pourous and left the floor wet. There was a DVD player and flat screen tv, mini fridge. There wasn't a microwave unless we over looked it. The pool is really big and the water fall is a nice added feature. It wasn't over crowded either. I'm not sure how the tiki bar works but I observed several people being asked and brought drinks and we were out there for 3 hrs and were passed over many times. Quick fix to just get up and go over to bar though. There isn't a complimentary breakfast, and frankly I was disappointed with the selection--it was more of a grab n go breakfast and not continental like advertised. For 2 adults and 2 children continental breakfast was a whopping $32! I would have rather gone to IHOP next door and skipped the mosquitos feasting on us. Even so, I'd stay at the Inn again if we are ever in Key West.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: JES1049
Reviews.Content: Our whole family truly enjoyed our stay, especially our accommodations, not to mention the pool area. We felt like we were on some tropical island, away from everyone, but yet close enough to everything. We would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone looking for great room accommodations, service and a pleasant stay. We didn't find fault with anything. The check-in desk personal were very friendly and helpful. Look forward to our returning. The Smith Family Bound Brook, NJ

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful place - exceeded our expectations”
Reviews.Author: hatchan
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful week at the Inn at Key West! The pool was awesome and even my children were able to enjoy the bar (smoothies every day!) We definitely plan to go back. It's a little removed from Duval street, but we liked that because it was quiet.

Reviews.Title: “We loved the pool”
Reviews.Author: Pousadavilla
Reviews.Content: Comfortable rooms, clean, good location, a little bit far away from the center, but we had a car, so it was ok for us. Our son loved the pool. The only thing that I was concerned that the room doors open directly to the outside of the hotel, but everything run well about our staying.

Reviews.Title: “Worth It”
Reviews.Author: CanadianCapital
Reviews.Content: The good: Key West is expensvie. The Inn at Key West is no exception but, given the market, there is good value here. The pool is lovely and a nice area to unwinde and relax. Staff were all very nice. We were even greated with a complimentary bar drink when we arrived slightly earlier than check in but the room wasn't ready. Rooms would be comparable to a nicer Sheraton. They are comfortable and clean. The hotel itself is very nice, any negatives are outside the control of the property. The bad: Key West is expensive. The Inn at Key West is no exception. Given the market, there is good value here though I still feel over charged. The only other major negative is its distance from downtown Key West. While it could be walked, it would be a very long walk. You will likely have to drive or arrange other transportation. Bottom line: We were looking for nice accomodations in Key West at a decent price We found it at the Inn at Key West. When we eventually return to Key West we may try a different hotel but this one is worth it if you can obtain a rate that isn't too high.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: JohhnyTram
Reviews.Content: We were a little worried about this property, being it is between two lower end chain properties and on the main road entering Key West. What we got instead was the best value on our Keys Road Trip. The room was clean, and nicely appointed. Flat screen TV (not common place in the Keys) and a fabulous pool area. There are a few rooms that are part of the main lobby and do not have exterior entrances, these also have patios that over look the pool. If you can get one of those at a good rate they look wonderful. We stayed in a standard room. No patio is the only knock I have. As far as the pool goes, I have been to many high end resorts, Lowes, Hyatts, Marriots ect. I will put this pool and surrounding grounds against anything those high end resorts can offer. The management of this property puts a priority on maintaining their pool area and it shows. We also utilized the concierge service to arrange mopeds. Within 30 minutes, we had two mopeds delivered for our use. When we return to Key West, if we are not looking to spend big money and stay downtown, this will be our choice.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and will definitely be back!”
Reviews.Author: les11324
Reviews.Content: Check in was a breeze and front desk was very personable. The staff was very friendly and accommodating. We highly recommend staying at this property. Our room & bathroom was very clean and appropriately decorated. Pina Colada's were delicious while enjoying the beautiful tropical pool which was amazing and gave you the feeling you were definitely on a "Caribbean Island"!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Inn”
Reviews.Author: keysfanatic
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at the Inn at Key West. The room was beautiful and spacious. The patio gave us a view of the Gulf. Thks Inn is away from the hustle and bustle of the Duval St area . Access to taxi service was easy as the Inn took care of it for us. The pool is gorgeous and there were plenty of loungers to take advantage of the sun. We will stay here again when in Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise”
Reviews.Author: trojansarah
Reviews.Content: Hotel is not near Duval and the bar scene. We didn't want the noise that comes along with the night life. Hotel staff has been perfectly attentive. They upgraded us at check-in to a room with a small patio. Nice! I called the front staff that my room was missing a hair dryer and they apologized profulesly and one was delivered immediately. The pool is gorgeous (biggest in Key West) and we've never had a problem finding a chair even in peak sunning times. The hotel provides a few free floaties and also provides pool towels. There is also a bar located at the pool so you can enjoy the pool and a few adult or child-friendly drinks. You can also order 'poolside food service' at the bar as well if you get hungry. Our room is clean and nicely decorated with a LARGE flat screen TV and marble bathrooms. Our a/c is nice and cold and everything has been perfect. We are beyond thrilled with our experience here and will definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Decent, No Frills.”
Reviews.Author: elee67
Reviews.Content: This was an ok stay for us..myself, wife and 19 year old son. The location wasnt the best, but not bad. Why don't they provide a shuttle to Duval though? A taxi ran us 30.00...?? Maybe due to Memorial Day Weekend? The pool was great, live music, very clean and nice temp. The grounds are very well kept. The room was decent, very clean...fairly small, but big enough for us. The beds/bedding were very nice though...comfy mattresses, and nice fluffy down comforters and pillows. Some noise from the pool, but so what? It was Mem Day Weekend in KW afterall...it was fine with us. No complaints here...a shuttle would be nice though. Plenty of free parking.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: KyleA
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Inn for a week at the beginning of May, and after a long trip with delays and two flights this place made up for it all! The hotel itself is about a 5 minute drive from the downtown core but it was nice to be away from it all. After a night of being on Duval coming back to this quiet retreat was a nice experience and allowed for a great nights sleep. The pool area (like most people say) is quite beautiful with great bar staff and a nice water feature that adds to the tranquility of it all. The drinks are worth every penny and the breakfast is quite nice. Of course there are other restaurants I encourage you to try but if you're looking for a quick bite to start your day off it's perfect. The rooms were well appointed with a flat screen tv, clean, and recently updated with new furniture. A few people mentioned a bad view of looking at the back of an iHop but i'm not quite sure how this is possible. The property is surrounded by greenery so it covers up the somewhat close restaurant. The gym is nice and has updated equipment and great for a quick workout before heading to the pool for some sun and swim. The lobby has computers for internet use but we found bringing your own personal computer to the pool or lobby was great since you could use their wifi. Just be warned using wireless net in the rooms can be a bit challenging as they use concrete to hurricane proof the rooms so getting a signal can be tricky. My only complaint was seeing garbage on our stairs outside of our room for consecutive days in a row. It had looked like someone spilled candy down our steps and it remained there for close to 3 days. There was also a used plastic up outside of our room on the railing for a couple of days. Our room was cleaned but always seemed to get a little later each day, one day being close to 3:00PM for a clean room. If that's that only thing I could find to complain about than this place was a big hit and I would highly suggest this hotel for your next stay in the Keys. Friendly staff, great room, nice and relaxing pool, and a quiet location made this our goto place when in the Keys.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel with few exceptions”
Reviews.Author: crachel3
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fabulous, it was very clean and well kept. The rooms were beautiful and the bathrooms were clean. I felt like I was at a 5 star resort but didn't feel like I paid for one. The pitfalls of the hotel were: we were told there was a restaurant onsite and there was not. It apparently changed hands and was not ready to open while we were there. This created a pretty big inconvenience a few times. So we were told there would be a complimentary continental breakfast since there was no restaurant. The first morning we went down and it was there and consisted of some danish and fresh fruit, juice and coffee. Not quite what i've had for continental breakfasts in the past. That was the only day we found it. Upon checkout this morning we found out they had moved it to the outside part of what was to be the restaurant. No one told us so we ended up spending quite a bit of money downtown on breakfasts. Very disappointing since they advertised the $13.95 full breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel in paradise only minuets from anywhere you want to go!”
Reviews.Author: Jaymee1545
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights last weekend. The hotel looks exactly like it does in the pictures, but of course more beautiful! Rooms were clean and well kept. The grounds around the hotel are gorgeous with no shortage of palm trees and native plant life. The pool was big enough not to feel crowded even at it's busiest times. The concierge wad very helpful and booking excursions right from the hotel was a breeze. Duval street was 5 minuet/ $5 cab ride away. I will be sure to stay here again next time I visit Key West. You will not be disappointed!!

Reviews.Title: “BUGS BUGS BUGS”
Reviews.Author: momee111
Reviews.Content: I am not one to complain about hotels unless it is bad. My husband and our two kids spent ONE night here and that was one night too many. We drove into Key West to meet up with my brother and his family and all decided to stay at the Inn at Key West. The price was $264.00 a night for one room with two queen beds because it was in season- Spring Break. My brother and his family got a room on the left side of the hotel and we got a room on the right side of the hotel. From the outside, the hotel appears average and from the inside of the lobby it appears a little better than average, but there were bugs in the bathroms of both of our family's rooms. Not just one or two, but A LOT! At first we did not notice them or we wouldn't have stayed, but being that we did not get settled in our rooms until after 9pm, it wasn't until about an hour later when I went into the bathroom that I noticed movement around the sink. UGH! I immediately called over to my brother's room and had them check their bathroom out and they had the same bugs!!! My brother went down immediately to notify the front desk and the guy said that it wasn't a big deal and they were just a few water bugs... NO THEY WEREN'T! I live in South Florida on the water and these were not any water bugs I had ever seen! Needless to say, we checked out first thing in the morning and will NEVER return. DISGUSTING!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: witkowskiHebronIn
Reviews.Content: Stayed only one night at hotel. But left great impression. The pool is as nice as the pictures show. The room was clean and big. We drank that night at the pool bar, little pricey on drinks but otherwise I would say very nice place.

Reviews.Title: “Way overpriced motel”
Reviews.Author: Thomas_Ohio
Reviews.Content: It is as good as any motel you normally would pay $50 for per night. Free Internet is available in the lobby.... what a bad joke. We have he year 2011, even in Key West... We did had to drive around the motel to get to our room which was in decent shape but too close to the noisy parking lot (about 6 ft...). No breakfast included, no wifi, loud air condition. If it was somewhere else, I would have checked out and looked for a real hotel, not a cheap motel. Hey posted a sign with their prices at the door -- $635 per night (no, not a typo!).... I did not know hat smoking that stuff was legal here...

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended!”
Reviews.Author: Gracie0412
Reviews.Content: After hearing only good things about The Inn at Key West from our aunt and uncle who stayed there earlier this year, we decided to book a room there for our honeymoon during the week of May 23-May 27, and we were very glad we did! The hotel was very clean; our room was very inviting and comfortable; and the hotel staff very courteous and professional. We did have an issue with our coffee maker not working properly, and the problem was fixed within five minutes of our notifying the front desk. The pool is exceptional, and the location of the hotel was very convenient. The concierge, Millie, was very helpful when we asked to make reservations for the various attractions we hoped to see. She took her time with us, made the necessary phone calls, and gave us much-appreciated advice on things to do and see during our time in Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible hotel--worth every dollar”
Reviews.Author: Go_Bucks25
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Inn at Key West on a recent trip to Key West. The hotel was quite impressive from its West Indies/Bahamian decor to the incredible pool area, complete with palm trees and water cascading over rocks. The pool even had a bar and the chairs were nestled amongst the trees on sand. The hotel had a quaint outside garden restaurant. We only had breakfast there, but there were quite a few offerings from individual selections to continental and full breakfast buffets. The room was very clean, beautifully decorated and the bed enveloped you in comfort. One of the best nights of sleep. Only downside, was that the hotel was away from downtown Key West and did not offer a shuttle. Cab rides cost about $3-$4 per person to get to the action. But then again, it was away from the noise and craziness of downtown Key West. We only stayed one night and wished we could have stayed longer

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel! Not close to Duval, but that was fine with us.”
Reviews.Author: TRB42
Reviews.Content: The Inn at Key West is a beautiful hotel. The pool area is gorgeous and peaceful with a very-attentive wait staff. The service was outstanding. We were traveling with friends and reserved two rooms back in March. We had only one glitch upon check in...the rooms we were assigned were not the ones we requested (we requested second floor king balcony rooms) but were given first floor rooms. We checked out the first floor rooms before complaining and they were extremely smelly (musty) and moist, as if they had had a plumbing leak or a flood; there was even an industrial sized fan in the hallway. We went back to the front desk and told them that the rooms were unacceptable due to the smell (they offered to "refresh" the room but there was no way that would have helped!). The employee at the service desk was very apologetic but stated the hotel was full. We asked if there were other properties, and he was pretty quick to find us rooms. We ended up with one second floor poolside balcony room and one executive waterview suite, which were both very nice and very clean. Some people may find the chickens and roosters that wander around the neighborhood (NOT in the hotel, just the parking lot) annoying but it didn't bother us. The view of the gulf of Mexico is beautiful, but there is a two-lane road between the hotel and the water. It is about 3 miles from the Duval Street area but we had a rental car and found cheap parking lots around the Duval area. There is an IHOP, Publix, McDonald's, and Wendy's all within walking distance (5-10 minute walk). We thoroughly enjoyed our stay!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: CarmenD4
Reviews.Content: The pool area is fantastic, really cute, great sized pool and great Tiki Bar. The hotel is really a motel. I'd say 3 stars. But you're not in it that often. The pool area is great as mentioned but the room are very average and small. Yes there were cockroaches in the bathroom but tiny ones thank god! Still it wasn't pleasant. In fairness the staff were constantly spraying so they were doing their best. It was 5mins in a cab into the centre.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT PLACE TO RELAX”
Reviews.Author: jzarko
Reviews.Content: Pool was fantastic and lots of help in facility! great food and staff was extermely helpful with all questions. rooms were very well appointed and comfortable. Loved the place!!!!

Reviews.Title: “The devil is in the details”
Reviews.Author: SteveUrq
Reviews.Content: In the hospitality business, there are those so-called moments of truth that help to set the tone for your stay at a hotel. One occurs when you first drive up and get to see the property with your own eyes, not the retouched and pretty brochure photo version. The next occurs when you walk in to the lobby and get a sense of the hotel itself. The third is when you are greeted at the front desk (or not) and your room is ready upon your arrival (or not) ... Up to that point, things were good. And the front desk clerk did try to be helpful, although we now wish that we had just shown up later and gotten another room. Our room was at the back of the property, kind of a motel style with cars driving by, and we had the misfortune of being immediately next to the area where housekeeping staff and people using the laundry room take their breaks. This area stayed loud nearly all hours, day and night. Not to mention smoke coming into the room when the door was opened, and cigarette butts strewn everywhere. Very tacky. I suspect that the reason the air conditioning unit in the room is so loud (it sounds like a generator is running day and night) is to try to drown out the cackling and howling of the people on permanent break in the smoking area and noise in the parking lot. Unfortunately, it is just more noise that makes the notion of a quiet getaway an illusion. And of course, we were told at the front desk that they were sold out so we could not switch rooms. On our first full day in the room, we came back to the room in the mid-afternoon to rest up for an evening event, and housekeeping had not even touched the room. Eventually, around 4:30 pm or so someone came by to clean things up. With all the chairs at the pool taken up, and no towels available, it was slim pickings trying to enjoy the setting. To the credit of the hotel, it is a beautiful pool and overall the hotel has a nice, well-kept appearance. It is far away from anything and everything on Key West, with the exception of the IHOP which is next door. Speaking of doors, when we came back on Sunday evening the lock on our door (which looks like it has been forced open and is nearly off its hinges) was not working, apparently the result of a dead battery in the device. It took nearly an hour to get that sorted out, on a night that we needed to get to bed for an early trip back home. It wasn't anything that they hotel did wrong, it was just the icing on the cake. When we checked out, it was clear that the front desk clerk really could care less about our impressions of the property, or even whether we had a nice stay. It was the most perfunctory check out I can remember in a while, usually reserved for a Motel 6. The Inn has a lot of potential, but overall I was disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Seven days of Paradise!”
Reviews.Author: glapko
Reviews.Content: The Inn at Key West was fantastic. Their pool and it's tropical setting made you feel like you were on an island. The staff made us feel that we were very special guests. They were always helpful, aimed to please and very accommodating. Cocktails at the Tiki bar were reasonably priced as well as the food served in their cafe. Great selections for breakfast and lunch.Their gym provided several machines, mats, weights, cold water, towels and earplugs for the TV, not to mention as you exercise you are looking at the Gulf. This was our second year in a row to stay and have already booked to return again next year. The only negative comment I could make is the lack of shuttle service to Duval St. However, parking on the streets was not a problem, but would love to pay for a shuttle instead of meters.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel....,just off the beaten path a lil'”
Reviews.Author: chrisnjan425
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our first stay in Key West. When I booked our trip I had no idea how far the hotel is from all the action. It was a beautiful Hotel, very clean, pretty pool, and nice to have an open bar to order drinks and food. If only it was located closer to where the action was. It is located on a busy road, but that didn't bother me as much as when I had pull out of the driveway to get on the highway, it is located on a curve and with all that busy traffic it was sometime impossible to make a left.... The staff was pleasant, and the concierge was very helpful, and sweet... by booking us our sunset cruise on the nicest ship, (the western union) and also helping my husband book his deep sea fishing trip. Next trip we will stay a little closer and rent a scooter or electric car.. :)

Reviews.Title: “Close to Paradise”
Reviews.Author: marinaman2600
Reviews.Content: Beautifully landscaped and maintained, this hotel is a delight. The rooms are comfortable and the common areas nicely kept. The pool is outstanding as is the poolside service. They will even serve your beverage as you rest in the water. Great waterfall and poolside sand chairs. Only thing missing was a shuttle service to the downtown area.

Reviews.Title: “Unexpectedly boutiquey, charming, personal, friendly, well appointed and a fabulous pool!”
Reviews.Author: Louis_F_UK
Reviews.Content: We randomly booked this hotel as part of a family holiday and were delightfully surprised by how good the hotel was. Everyone was really helpful and friendly and there was a real familial atmosphere to the place. Rooms were generous in size, well appointed and kept exceptionally clean throughout the stay. The pool was fantastic - it was almost impossible to keep our 4-year-old son out of it! - the bar-food served for lunch was great, as were the frozen cocktails! The hotel is right on Highway 1 and located on the north-east side of Key West, so about a 15 minute cab journey from Duval Street where all the action takes place - to be honest this really wasn't a big deal. Great hotel (the best of the five we stayed in over our two-week trip), thoroughly enjoyable stay a highly recommended if you like boutique hotels with bags of charm.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!!”
Reviews.Author: pnl0511
Reviews.Content: This was our first time to Key West and it was great!! The weather was perfect!! The hotel was amazing and the staff was very friendly and helpful!! We spent a lot of time by the pool (amzaing) and tiki bar where the bartenders were awesome!! The food at the Inn was great and reasonable!! We had breakfast and lunch at the Inn every day!! Great place to stay!! Nice location!! Would recommend to anyone!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Place to Enjoy Key West”
Reviews.Author: Phil_R1
Reviews.Content: I travelled to Key West on a mini road trip with my girlfriend. We stayed in a deluxe king room and it was lovely, clean and quiet. The bed was large and comfy enabling a great nights sleep, the decor was in keeping with the island and the bathroom was good. The pool was beautiful and it had its own pseudo beach area with sun loungers and sand with palm trees all around giving it a nice, secluded and tropical feel to it. There was also a hot tub to relax in. We were so impressed with the place on the first night that we decided to stay for another night. Ethernet is available in your room and wifi is available around the pool and in hotel lobby. There is private parking near all the rooms. The reception staff were always helpful, willing to give advice on places on Key West to visit. The distance to Duval street, the main street on Key West, is really not an issue; its a short taxi ride. In summary, this is a beautiful place to stay and explore Key West from. Its tranquil, clean and has a fantastic pool to relax around.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, but ridiculously overpriced”
Reviews.Author: NAUgrad2005
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through their website directly using the AAA rate for a whopping $190 per night. We were given a room on the second floor and managed to haul our bags upstairs since there is not an elevator. The room had a decent bathroom and a small balcony on the back. Beds were average, certainly nothing special. For the most part, the room was clean. I did find some used towels underneath the bathroom vanity that the maid had apparently missed. After going to dinner, we returned to the hotel only to find that parking was scarce. The only spot we found was on the side of IHOP. For the price, breakfast should have been included with the room. They did have an Ethernet connection, but no WiFi. The location is decent, but it is several miles from Duval Street. I would compare this hotel to a Hampton Inn or something in the 2.5-3 star category.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre”
Reviews.Author: SharTom1
Reviews.Content: We were not overly impressed with the Inn. When we first arrived, the light, air and phone were not working in our room. Maintenance quickly fixed the first two but the phone never worked properly. The room itself was adequate but nothing special. The pool area was beautiful but towels were limited. The cafÃ© also looked pleasant but we found the one breakfast we ate there unappetizing. The balcony style walkway outside our room was attractive but as it was a public area it was not a place you could sit and enjoy the pool view and for privacy the big window pretty had to have its curtains closed most of the time which left the room very dark. The one saving grace of our stay was the staff â€“ they were all very friendly and service oriented they just did not have a lot to work with. Our last day there the railing outside our room was being painted white but they neglected to post any signs so I had a white hand as a parting gift.

Reviews.Title: “Sort of a Motel 6 with upgrades”
Reviews.Author: NJFamiyfun
Reviews.Content: First, I have to say that the pool area is great....very lush and tropical feeling. It is open late and we all enjoyed it. It is the best attribute of this hotel. The interiors of all the rooms are the same but we stayed in the back section and it felt a little like a cheesy motel. Most of the rooms are accessed by exterior hallways. Our room was in the back and felt kind of isolated. In fact, our room door looked like it had been pried open at some point - or at least it was an attempted break-in. I did not feel safe sending my tweens up to the room if they forgot something and even checked over my own shoulder when I went up to the room after dark alone. The hotel says they have security patrolling the motel - oops, sorry - the Inn - but it was not a place I would recommend - unless all you care about is the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great value, friendly helpful staff, terrific pool, no hassle parking.”
Reviews.Author: JennyBNashvilleTN
Reviews.Content: Ask for the King Supreme which has a balcony overlooking the pool area on one side and opens up onto the interior of hotel lobby on second floor. Since the island has only a few select man-made beaches, an "ocean front" and "beach view" like you would expect at other beach destinations doesn't exist here. Parking is free and plentiful. It's next door to an IHOP which is convenient. The hotel was very clean, comfortable and we slept great. I have only wonderful things to say about the hotel and its staff. However, the Keys in general left me lukewarm and I doubt I will return. Mostly it was the experience with the other locals and other people that vacation there which I have never encountered that far South. We had a hard time finding good food to eat. The two places we did eat I wish we'd known about from our first day there and we'd have had every meal there. Blue Heaven and Santiago's Bodega. Fantastic service, food and prices are in line with what was ordered.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to relax in Key West”
Reviews.Author: OIW0130
Reviews.Content: Pictures of the pool are accurate. It is large & beautiful. The bar at the pool offers meals, snacks as well as drinks. The employees were friendly and went out of their way to make us happy. We were tempted to spend all our time at the pool and skip the rest of Key West. In fact, all of the staff were very friendly and helpful. The rooms are clean & comfortable. The location is easy to find and is an easy drive to all the sites in Key West. In summary, this is a great place to stay in Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite!”
Reviews.Author: Beccahill
Reviews.Content: We came down for a quick trip to Key West. The hotel is always so clean, so inviting, and so professional. The staff always makes a point to greet us and make sure we are taken care of. The pool is amazing and provides for hours of entertainment for my children!

Reviews.Title: “Best pool on Key West”
Reviews.Author: watatrp
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at The Inn at Key West for three years straight. The rooms are clean, updated and tastefully decorated. The bathrooms are rich with marble. The pool is wonderful and very relaxing. I found the staff to be helpful and courteous. The location is away from all of the noise of the night life. I would recommend this hotel for those with children. I've stayed at several other places on Key West but don't think that I would stay anywhere else now. I'm almost ready to make reservations for next year. Don't forget a quick breakfast at the Old Town Bakery. The Roof Top Cafe is always a winner. The beach at Fort Zachery Taylor was wonderful. Smathers beach has free parking across the street. Sunsets on the pier at the end of White St. are nice and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful - Relaxing - Atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: Businessadvisor
Reviews.Content: Are you looking for a quiet place to stay well this is it. You do not have to go anywhere else. Tiki bar, pool, fitness center. Clean rooms friendly service This was second trip to Key West and decided to return to this place you can't beat it!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel with great amenities and easy access.”
Reviews.Author: BradleyPSmith1
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very clean and the service from everyone, concierge, desk staff, housekeeping and cafe were excellent. Everyone was very helpful and courteous. The hotel is several miles from downtown Key West and the action on Duval so transportation has to be by car, bus, trolley or close by scooter and golf cart rentals. It is a great place to relax at the end of a busy day on Duval Street. We definitely plan to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not a five star resort”
Reviews.Author: bltfla
Reviews.Content: This place has one of the nicest pools I have ever seen however the latenight desk staff were very rude and kicked about 12 guests out of the pool area at 11pm. Only the rooms on the north side have good views and the bar closes very early. O yeah did i mention that the bathroom lightswitchs were on the outside of the room? For the most part the resort is very nice its just definatlly not a five star resort the silver palm is a better choice.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: jdb1980
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 6 nights and were very happy with our choice. We were given an upgrade for my husbands b-day without asking. Very clean and really helpful service. Huge plus for breakfast, $13.95 for buffet with made to order omlets, pancakes & french toast. Not sure how people could complain dont understand what people expect sometimes.

Reviews.Title: “Want luxury accomodations in Key West without the luxury prices?”
Reviews.Author: KeyWestVacation
Reviews.Content: The Inn at Key West was luxury @ mid-range pricing! And such a laid-back atmosphere, without stuffy staff and snooty people like you get @ most high-end places. We loved the tropical up-scale decor throughout, and beautiful new rooms. If you want to be directly on the ocean, look into other places...BUT the beaches there are not worth paying the extra for. Spend your hard earned money on boating trips and watersports, and stay in luxury too! Go to happy hours at restaurants on the water and enjoy the sunssets that way! We strongly suggest Latitudes on Sunset Key (ferry from Westin), and Louie's Backyard! Enjoy! Key West has a lot to offer, and The Inn at Key West is hard to beat! Blacketor Family, Hinsdale, IL

Reviews.Title: “Pool is awesome, service last two days great today oh my!”
Reviews.Author: sdskyguy
Reviews.Content: Up till today this rating could not have said enough about this hotel unbelievable pool great service at poolside bar from Ed, Zack and Gracie. except for room not cleaned till 3:30 rave reviews great beds clean updated great experience......... Then today..still good service from Angela the bartender but ??? bar full of local kids/angela's friends?,drinking heavily, dropping the F bomb every couple of minutes and getting loud and obnoxiousthey took up whole side of bar and most of Angela's time and sounded like they frequent the pool often so my question to the mangaement is the bar and pool for the use of your guests or the local kids. Big mistake we are the ones that pay for the rooms maybe you want to reconsider the use of the pool/ bar as for guest use. So far this is the only glitch in a wonderful stay with courteous staff hopefully and anamoly. I would still highly recommend this Inn and its serene setting if some rules too the bartenders are made no drunken friends monopolizing the bar one incident doesn't warrant a bad report.

Reviews.Title: “Better than I could have ever hoped for !!!!!”
Reviews.Author: sheritol50
Reviews.Content: Many nice things - walking distance to McDonalds and IHOP-breakfast there for 13.95/free coffee for guests-great location - right across from Gulf-Staff extremely helpful-has trolley you can reserve spot on (on/off all day long) to see al of the well-known spots-my son did jet skiing and it was the same price as at home :) IF you live in florida ask for your Florida residence rate and that made it affordable for us - pool was beautiful -I would stay there again for sure!!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT STAY AT THE KEY WEST INN”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkSinjin
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time at this resort. The pool area was beautiful with a tiki bar. Room was very generous with a small patio. Checking in and out was a breeze. All of the staff was very friendly and helpful. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Place, but drawbacks with 6 Legs.....”
Reviews.Author: Doodygas
Reviews.Content: We Stayed at Tranquility Bay in Marathon Key for 4 nights before coming here. Tranquility Bay was probably the nicest and most beautiful resort I've ever stayed in, it was every bit of 5 Stars simply amazing. Then we went to Parrot Cay in Key West, it was nice, but maybe 4 stars, but after 3 Gigantic Cockroaches were running across the bathroom floor in our 2 bedroom unit -- during the 2 night stay we decided never to return. Nice place, but can never erase disgusting memories.

Reviews.Title: “Does not disappoint!”
Reviews.Author: mnec
Reviews.Content: From the moment we walked into the lobby we were impressed. The first impression of the lobby is that of casual elegance and that look continues in the hallways and rooms. The bed was comfortable with with a soft down comforter. The furniture was elegant and the bathroom was beautiful featuring a large shower with a cascading shower head. Last but not least the pool area is amazing! The pool is large and the landscaping is tropical and serene and the outdoor bar is convenient for those afternoon cocktails. The staff were always friendly and accommodating. It is about 3 miles from Duval St. but was only about a 5-7 minute scooter ride. We definitely plan on going back.

Reviews.Title: “Good rooms, not good service, terrific pool, away from the action”
Reviews.Author: CrabberWheels
Reviews.Content: The property is fairly high quality, but the service leaves a lot to be desired. It's also about a 10-minute drive away from "the action" downtown and on Duvall Street, which is probably a plus (away from the hustle and bustle, probably cheaper) and a minus (a lot of "commuting" time to get downtown). We had asked for a room with two queens, and I confirmed the night before we got in that we'd have two queens. At check-in, were told that they had switched us to a king room with a fold-out sofa because it had an ocean view, which was an upgrade. We reluctantly agreed to it. The ocean view is really a view across U.S. 1 at a not-terribly-picturesque part of the oceanfront. And the noise from U.S. 1 (the main drag around the island) was a problem, with noisy traffic all night long--earplugs are a must. We probably should have insisted on the two-queen room, even without a "view," but we stuck it out. On the plus side, the room that we received (Room 201) was about the largest room on the property, so it had PLENTY of room, and it was clean. The pool is terrific--the biggest on the island that we saw on any of the websites that we visited. Sometimes a bit tight on poolside chairs, but we were always able to get some for our family. The service at this place is not up to snuff. Not really rude, but "diffident" and "unconcerned" are probably the words to use, and we saw it from just about everyone--except for the staff at the cafe for breakfast, almost all of whom were quite nice. Nobody seems terribly interested in doing anything to help. An example: when my wife told the front desk that they were out of cups at the water dispenser in the lobby (5 feet from the front desk), the woman at the front desk told my wife where the plastic cups were located, rather than going to retrieve them. And when the cups weren't where they were supposed to be, the woman paged someone else at the hotel staff to go get them, rather than offering to find them herself. Not a huge sin, to be sure, but just an example of the kind of service that one should expect at a higher-class place like this.

Reviews.Title: “Spend a little more and stay closer to Old Town -- frosty reception here”
Reviews.Author: NJNan
Reviews.Content: Horrible experience with check in as the clerk couldn't find our reservation -- had our last name misspelled and didn't ask for any help from a more experienced person. This after keeping us waiting while she helped another customer on the phone who was trying to navigate the hotel's website -- when you've driven 5 hours straight through to arrive at the hotel you just want a smooth check in process. Nice room but everything is surface in this hotel: bed wasn't very comfortable, pillows were flat and of poor quality. Shower water pressure was nonexistent and the water didn't get hotter than tepid. Poor television reception that wasn't remedied after we brought it to the attention of the staff. Snippy and curt concierge person who should retire or be replaced by someone more pleasant -- we purchased trolley tickets from her but were offered nothing else in the way of assistance or suggestions. I even left the tickets on the desk by mistake -- and she didn't notice, simply put the map (that the tickets were in) back in the display. I spent thirty minutes frantically searching for the tickets before returning to her desk where she "discovered" them -- ugh!! Didn't eat breakfast here -- seemed expensive and there was an IHOP right next door. Did order, after searching around for someone to wait on us at the pool bar, an overpriced, underwhelming hot dog for lunch. Blah. Pool is beautiful, clean, comfortable, and large. Towels are skimpy and not plentiful. Many people had to search around for a towel and came up empty. Wait staff should be trained to offer menus and maybe a complimentary first soft drink -- too short staffed to offer any real meal service. Should take some tips from Hyatt, which does this poolside service very well. Hotel is too far from everything else on the island -- we had to drive and pay for parking anytime we wanted to go out to eat or see the sights. There was a trolley parked out front in the morning, but no one shared with us how to use it -- was it a shuttle? Was it free to guests? Photos of this property look wonderful -- it's a real disappointment. With the right management and properly trained staff, could have been much, much better!

Reviews.Title: “Great Pool”
Reviews.Author: mdldgl
Reviews.Content: My wife & I stayed at "The Inn" for 4 nights in Mid March, the Â beginning of spring break. We selected this hotel because of the pool and because ti was not down town, we were hoping to be away from the "spring breakers". The pool did not disappoint, it was excellent... we spent some time here each day enjoying the sun, water and lush vegetation surrounding the pool. Unfortunately, we did not escape the spring breakers - it was fine in our area of the hotel, but herd other complain about the late night noise. This is not the fault of of The Inn.. but a fact of life this time of year in Key West.. it was when we could get away and did not harm bother us. One suggestion for the hotel would be to install some garbage containers around the pool (even if just for spring break). One criticism is that there was not security during the day or early evening, so there was no-one to control the underage drinking with the breakers bringing in their own beer, and people not staying at the hotel could use the pool. The room were nicely appointed,but the bathroom and balcony were both a little on the small size.. however, in general the hotel exceeded our expectation and we would return.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: aroselle
Reviews.Content: Check-in was quick and easy. The room was clean and the staff was nice and welcoming. I'm very particular about hotel bathrooms and this one was very clean. The pool was clean, warm, and very relaxing. The poolside bar was nice to have. Our mini-fridge in the room didn't work and they replaced it immediately. Millie in guest services was friendly and helpful and helped us schedule all our activities and recommended some good restaurants. No complaints about this hotel except for the fact that it was spring break for college students and almost every night we were woken up around 3:30-4am when they were just coming in. Otherwise, awesome hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Still Waiting for Room to be Cleaned”
Reviews.Author: djprima80
Reviews.Content: Problems since check in. We checked in early afternoon and told only rooms available were first floor facing parking lot. We had reserved an upgraded suite. It's now 4:30 PM and the room has not been cleaned. We were gone all day. The phone doesn't work and needed to walk to the desk to request room cleaning. The room is dark, seems to be a half window because faces parking lot. This hotel is away from all the activity on Duvall Street. It has a very pretty pool area and the staff are pleasant and the buffet breakfast is worth the $15. Also free internet, (wired in room, wireless in lobby and pool) and free parking is nice!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the rate”
Reviews.Author: CSRach
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights. The pool is a great pool with a bar that's open until 10 PM. Our room was clean with nice amenities. We were originally put in room 101 which faces the street. The traffic noise was too loud for us to sleep. We moved to the other side of the hall for the rest of the stay and it was perfect. My major complaint is there is no Wi-fi in the room. You have to plug into an ethernet cable. There is Wi-fi at the pool area. I thought the breakfast buffet was mediocre at best and not worth the money. The omlette was good, but everything else was dry and bland. You have to have a car or scotter to get to the heart of the action since this hotel isn't in the heart of downtown. Overall, I think this was a good hotel for what we paid. I would stay there again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “An oasis on the edge of Key West”
Reviews.Author: jjamms
Reviews.Content: Stayed at The Inn for 3 nights in march. Lovely clean and quiet rooms, luxuriously appointed. Beautiful garden/pool oasis. Easy access in to Key West downtown activities.

Reviews.Title: “Great times are back !!!”
Reviews.Author: Carlitico
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel on Saturday 03/05/11 and checked out the following day. We had a blast at this hotel. The room was ok. Our major highlight on this trip was the pool with the bar, the Jacuzzi but overall the service and the friendly atmosphere within the hotel. The pool area looks like an oasis with a beautiful water fountain. The bartenders were very nice and always greeted us with a smile which is always good especially when you are on vacation. The pool guy Zach was very attentive and the Front Desk Tammy was very accommodating and helpful with us. She also went the extra-mile and offered me 3 free drinks at the pool bar. Everything at the hotel was if not perfect close to it. The only disadvantage was the location since I had to take a cab to get to the center of Key West (Duval Street) and cabs in Key West are very expensive. I highly recommend this hotel to anybody. Two Thumbs Up!!!

Reviews.Title: “The Best Pool In KeyWest!”
Reviews.Author: david0407
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel was excellent. Except for the location (You have to drive 10 mins to the strip), the service and amenities are well worth the price. They give you free internet, free access to computers in the lobby, an outstanding pool and good overall service. The concierge is very helpful as well for planning activities or for just finding a great place to eat. I would definitely stay here again on my next trip back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Beautiful Pool Area!”
Reviews.Author: Diand11
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel at the end of February and would definitely stay again. The hotel has all the great "feel" of a small hotel, but a pool area which felt like a large resort. We stayed in a superior king room with balcony (over- looking the pool), which was spotlessly clean and very nicely furnished. The pool bar was friendly and slightly more reasonably priced than many and served good, tasty snacks. The location of the hotel means that you have to get a cab into town, which costs about $17 with tip - but it also means that it is quiet and you can get a great nights sleep. The Conceierge was very helpful and arranged a great table for us at dinner at the "Hot Tin Roof", where we watched a fabulous sunset. We also took a sunset schooner cruise on the Adirondack, which was great (price did not include drinks, but they were $1 each) and my husband took a Jetski ride around the Island, which he thoroughly enjoyed. All in all, a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “My birthday getaway for years”
Reviews.Author: sunandpalmtrees12
Reviews.Content: It's the most comfortable bed around went with my sister and girlfriend for years to celebrate birthdays !! friendly staff great pillows great mattresses awesome pool area i recommend this hotel to everyone it may not be close to duval street but who cares pool area is the most tropical ive ever seen it just puts you in the island mindset. Im taking my new husband this june i cant wait to introduce him to one of my favorite spots in the world!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!Annie Lewis-bisesi

Reviews.Title: “The best part of our vacation!!”
Reviews.Author: pondgal
