Reviews.Content: This was our 3rd stay at the Inn At Key West. We love it and can't wait to return. This is as close to being in Hawaii that we have found. The pool is beautiful!! The poolside bar is very nice and convenient. The restaurant is so lovely under the palms and food is great as was the service. The rooms are beautifully appointed and our private patio gave us our own little bit of paradise.

Reviews.Title: “We loved our time at Key West & the Inn was just perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Beth30yearsinlove
Reviews.Content: This was our 30th year anniversary and we had a fabulous time. The staff was very friendly and helped us book some activities that fit in perfectly with our limited stay and interests. He pointed us to the best restaurant, a great beach and made everything simple. The hotel was clean, pretty and very Key Westy feeling! I had read something about bugs but I saw absolutely NOTHING and was totally comfortable and happy there. The pool is beautiful, the tiki bar adorable and the breakfast buffet the waiter said would be "emotional" and the crab cake egg dish was just that. It was amazing. I would love to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Did Not Meet Expectations”
Reviews.Author: olive235
Reviews.Content: Based on other reviews and the great website we were very excited about our stay at the Inn at Key West. However, the hotel failed to meet our expectations. We waited a long time to check into the hotel on our arrival, as the front desk person was on the phone. There was no apology offered by the staff member, which didn't bode well for our stay. The room was very clean, although slightly cluttered. The bathroom was small but clean. The bonus was a large screen TV. The worst thing about the room was the air-conditioning unit, which was very loud and without earplugs sleep would have been impossible. The hotel is located adjacent to a shopping complex containing a Publix supermarket, which can save you money. However, it is about 20 minutes drive to Duval St, and there is traffic to contend with. The swimming pool was good, a large size with lots of sun loungers. However we experienced a shortage of towels on one of our trips to the pool. We would not revisit this hotel due to the cost. It would be a good place to vacation with children, but is not a romantic getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, beautiful pool.”
Reviews.Author: alwayshavingfun11
Reviews.Content: The hotel rooms are clean and bright. The bed is very comfortable. The pool is beautiful and has a relaxing, cascading waterfall. It's convenient to have a tiki bar at the pool also. Free internet and parking is a plus!

Reviews.Title: “Away from the crowd but so close to everythig to see in Key West”
Reviews.Author: theinnatkeywest
Reviews.Content: A very pleasant stay in this well maintained hotel. Very enjoyable environment and attentioned staff. Fabulous pool!

Reviews.Title: “A short get-a-way”
Reviews.Author: Jim-Michelle-Travel
Reviews.Content: Our short stay at "The Inn at Key West" was delightful. Although we only stayed three days, we enjoyed our room, the people at the Inn, and our lunch near the pool. We both highly recommend this place for anyone looking for a secure, clean, and very hospitable place to stay in Key West. The Inn is located just outside downtown Old Key West, about two plus miles from the ever famous Duval St. but... you can rent these neat little open-air cars, motorcycles, bicycles, or scooters... you name it, they have everything or... you can just walk to town. We actually drove into town, having a vehicle, because we actually drove all the way down to Key West from Ohio. We parked on a back street "Free", two out of the three nights, and pretty much walked everywhere so... The Inn really isn't located far from everything that you would want to see while visiting... Key West. Te next time we come back to Key West, we are flying in and renting something to drive around... maybe one of those little cars. Oh and we plan on staying at The Inn at Key West. All-in-all, you can't beat this higher-end type of facility because it offers, based upon everything we look at, a very affordable price. Jim & Michelle February 2011

Reviews.Title: “An escape from the cold winter”
Reviews.Author: verlat
Reviews.Content: Paradise in Key West. What a wonderful introduction to Key West. The staff is so friendly and helpful, the rooms beautiful, spacious and elegant. Located half way between Old Town and the beach, perfect location for renting bikes and going in either direction. Or relax by the pool, where the drinks are delivered to you. :)

Reviews.Title: “Crawling with cockroaches in the bathroom...”
Reviews.Author: Jessy4Paws
Reviews.Content: While this place looks like a nice hotel and the rates can seem like a bargain for Key West, it is all wrecked by the small cockroaches which crawl all over the bathrooms (we were in room 218). We booked this hotel before the review on 26 January which also reports cochroaches in the bathrooms... or else we would not have booked it all. By the time we got there we had read the review and asked for a room with no cockroaches which we were assured that is what we were getting, but no - cockroaches galore. Needless to say we left early...

Reviews.Title: “A very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: nana444
Reviews.Content: We liked the hotel as it was well furnished for this price range. The pool area was very nice and the staff helpful. The only negative is you have to drive to the historic district and parking in Key West can be difficult.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and great amenities in an expensive destination!”
Reviews.Author: adventuretraveller40
Reviews.Content: We got a deal over the internet, so I'm not sure if this is a typical experience or not, but for under $200 a night (which sounds like a lot, but in Key West is a drop in the bucket) we had a fabulous place to stay. Key West is a really pricey town and when the budget hotels are more than $200 a night to stay in this was a real find. The pool is fabulous. We spent hours soaking up the sun and living it up in the pool. The rooms are well appointed and it certainly doesn't feel like a budget hotel at all! The beds were only ok (but I'm really picky about my bed!) hence the 4 out of 5. If the beds had been better this would have been a 5 star hotel for sure. Also no wireless internet...you needed an ethernet cord and in today's age who carries those around anymore?

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to celebrate a 60th Anniversary!”
Reviews.Author: PatKav17
Reviews.Content: I choose "The Inn at Key West" as the destination to bring my parents as a vacation spot - in order help celebrate their 60th Wedding Anniversary. We were there for 3 days (Jan 26, 27, 28, 2011) and had a wonderful time. The entire staff was friendly and helpful, the property (including rooms) were nicely maintained and very clean. The beds were very comfortable as well. A key feature is the tropical setting, centered on the property, boasting a VERY large swimming pool, hot-tub, tiki bar and easy access to lobby (which is also tastefully decorated). A great deal of creativity went into designing the pool, with waterfall, around a tropical setting of sand & palm trees with all the nice amenities near-by. Look forward to staying there again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel - would recommend it highly”
Reviews.Author: SlymanChicago
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. Comfortable beds. Clean, Quiet location. Excellent internet. IHOP restaurant 100 feet away if you don't want the hotel's buffet breakfast. Helpful concierge in the lobby. Would absolutely stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Courteous, and Bed Bug Free”
Reviews.Author: thorvath
Reviews.Content: As I travel frequently, it is nice to stay in a hotel that has taken every precaution to prevent to spread of the bed bug issue plaguing other high end resorts. The facility is clean and each box spring is protected by a nylon bag. People are friendly and courteous and the pool area is like finding a hidden oasis filled with beautiful tropical plants like no other on the island.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tonyp0717
Reviews.Content: The Inn at Key West is an exceptional hotel that will not break the bank. The lobby area is very comfortable to just sit and relax. The pool bar is a very nice area to unwind and have a drink or two. The rooms are a nice size, very clean and the bed is very comfortable. I would highly recommend staying at The Inn of Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Better than home”
Reviews.Author: illuminaughty
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Inn at Key West for ten days. Our stay was great. The hotel was clean and quite, out of the hustle bustle but close to everything. The parking lot was always full but, other than a few people at the pool, which is outstanding, we felt like we were the only guests there. The room was great and this is one of the few hotels I've ever stayed at where the bed and bedding were more cozy than our own bed at home. Another nice thing was that even if we slept in our room was always attended to when we returned, nice, and rare, touch. IHOP is right next door and general, everyday shopping is close and convenient. 5 stars for the Inn at Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Superb miniresort in Key West”
Reviews.Author: KarinOnSanibel
Reviews.Content: We came in the evening to this very nice place. Went straight to a restaurant within walking distance and then went for a swim in the very nice pool and hot tub. In the morning we experienced the best surprise - the very nice and affordable breakfast under the palm trees and by the pool. We had to stay for a swim before hitting the city. Then we made our first mistake. We started to walk as we were told it was 20 min away. No taxis within reach and the bus never came. Do order a taxi from the hotel as parking down-town is very expensive. We did have the room agains a quite buzy road so ask for the pool view. Wish we had stayed one more day at this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Most of all the staff makes all the difference in a hotel!”
Reviews.Author: oshant
Reviews.Content: From our arrival at the hotel we felt welcome. The hotel is beautiful (looks exactly as the pictures on the website) the grounds are gorgeous and well maintained. The rooms are a nice size and kept very clean. We had a little problem with outside noise on our first night there. We call the front desk in the morning and the staff took care of it right a way. We changed room and everything was great from there. The only negative comment would be that the pool wasn't warm enough. The heat didn't seem to be on/or working. With a temperature of 68 degrees Farenheit (20 degrees Celcius) outside if would of made a world of difference.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, gorgeous pool setting within reasonable distance to Duvel Street”
Reviews.Author: Vanski
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Inn at Key West 14 Jan 2010 for one night. We had booked the room through Expedia and had no problem with checking in at the hotel; the rooms were ready early afternoon and next to each other. The room had two queen beds with a large screen television and an elegant bathroom. The bed allowed for a very enjoyable sleep and the shower pressure was grand. The inn offered free high speed internet, however, I couldn't not get it to work though WiFi was available in the pool area and lobby. It was heaven to sit in the pool area to check email with the morning sun. The setting of the pool area was that of a Caribbean resort, unfortunately with a one night stay we did not get to enjoy it with all that Key West has to offer, Duvel Street, Sunset Key, sunrise on the Atlantic. The inn offers a cafe and pool bar, however we weren't in Key West long enough to utilize.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and everything you could ask for in a hotel”
Reviews.Author: jbolles08
Reviews.Content: Only 5 minutes drive from Duval/Mallory Sq. Close to several restaurants and other facilities (drug stores,etc.) Not on the beach, but great pool (warm!) and hot tub. Staff was super friendly and accommodating. Rooms were comfy and clean. Only 3 minute drive to Smathers Beach. Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Best pool ever”
Reviews.Author: permatri
Reviews.Content: The inn at key west has nice rooms and service - very similar too large chain hotels like Hampton inn, La quinta inn etc, but the real selling point is the pool that is large, heated and set in the most beatyful surroundings of palmtrees and flowers. Location is ok - we left our car at the hotel and took a taxi downtown to all the bars for about 15 $, but a local bus is also awailable just in front of the hotel. Very pleasant stay, well worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Nice for a hotel but not out of this world”
Reviews.Author: trishanddavetravel
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice enough and very clean. It was a little off the beaten track but worth the cost. I would say very close to a nice Holiday Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel, total gem with superb staff................”
Reviews.Author: Looba1
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived the hotel staff made you feel welcome, at ease and totally looked after. The hotel is spotless, grounds gorgeous and the rooms a good size. It is a lovely quiet hotel, during the day you can chill out by the pool & at night the pool bar is a great place to have a relaxing drink before going out into Key West for dinner. The food available around the pool was of a good standard and the kitchen will cater for any needs outside of the menu if required. The reception staff are happy to recommend restaurants in the local area, all of our recommendations by the hotel for dinner were brilliant & they will allow take out food to be ordered in if you fancy a lazy evening! Our favourite member of staff was by far, Andrea who worked the pool bar. Not only was she a fabulous bar tender she really made us feel like extended friends & made the best frozen daiquiri!!!! My husband and I really enjoyed our 5 night stay with this hotel and would return to stay here should we visit Key West again.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional clean, beautifully and tastefully decorated with friendly, efficient staff!”
Reviews.Author: FtMyersresident
Reviews.Content: This trip was our first to Key West. We were just planning an overnight stay. Upon arriving at the hotel we were amazing at the large waterview in front of the hotel. The lobby was large and nicely decorated. We were greeted immediately by staff. Our rooms (adjoining were mirror images of one another. The furniture was beautiful, large and accomodating. The room had a nice tv and refrigerator. The bathroom was very well done in tile and marble with nice finishes. The balcony had seating for two with a view of the courtyard. While this hotel is not in the nightlife section, it is less than 3 miles from it. It was quiet and allowed you to take in as much of Key West as you wanted and still have a quiet place to sleep. I would highly recommend this hotel and will stay there again. Ask about the water facing rooms with a balcony.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back.”
Reviews.Author: Sherib0
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. Beds were comfortable, rooms clean and the pool was awesome. Only thing was that we paid for a pool view but all we could see were the palm trees. We knew the pool was on the other side of them but they completely blocked the view. Concierge was very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great value non-chain well run motel”
Reviews.Author: postinterrail
Reviews.Content: I was impressed by how well run and clean this place is. If you are looking for a non-dingy motel experience with a pool, without being fancy this place is really a cut above.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Choice in Key West”
Reviews.Author: BonusGirl
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel for our annual wedding anniversary stay, based on reviews on trip advisor. We were very pleased with our selection. We stayed in the main hotel in a room with a balcony that overlooked the pool. Although the weather was unseasonably cold during our stay and we did not use the pool, it looked beautiful. We did use the jacuzzi right next to the pool and it was very nice, peaceful romantic setting in the evening. The hotel was spotless, service was great. We will go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: StarVoyage
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Inn at Key West for 3 days during December. The weather was cool, then so we did not use the pool, but it looked great. The business center did not have printers and I needed to print a reservation for a glass bottom boat trip. James K at the front desk was extremely helpful and had me email him a copy of the confirmation and he printed it for me. Although a few miles from Duval Street and much of the Key West activities, the location worked very well for us. Wished we had booked at extra night here rather than shifting to the Marathon area as we headed up the Keys.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Key West”
Reviews.Author: escape_tx
Reviews.Content: The hotel was beautiful. Exactly like the pictures on their website. The rooms were clean and very comfortable. The staff was very friendly and informative. It is a bit far from old town Key West, but we had a car so that was not an issue and the free parking at the hotel was a great plus. We did notice the Old Town Trolley stop on the hotel grounds. We would consider the Inn at Key West again.

Reviews.Title: “Website pictures gave me a much better feeling than the actual visit”
Reviews.Author: Rich8224
Reviews.Content: I looked at various hotels in Key West for our family vacation during the Christmas break via Tripadvisor. This hotel received a very good rating and what sold it for me were the pictures of the hotel on their website, in a word, extravagant. When we checked in, the feeling I got was, in a word, average. It's as if they "airbrushed" the photos. During our three day stay, the hotel desk personnel, concierge, and pool area were all average (the pool is quite large, but not heated). The business center consisted of two computers, side-by-side, at one end of the lobby. The best aspect of the hotel were the rooms (ample room, clean, with comfortable beds) and the exercise room (sufficient variety of machines & weights, overlooking the water). If you like to sleep in, however, keep in mind that you might hear kids in the hallways. Also, forget trying to find a parking place downtown unless you're there early in the morning- take a cab instead. I'm convinced that the term "luxury" & Key West do not go hand-in-hand.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel in Key West!! We will definitely be back!!”
Reviews.Author: NcSunlovers
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have visited Key West before and we chose the Inn at Key West because of its location and wonderful reviews! We thought that the location was fantastic - very quiet, yet still not far from the excitement of downtown. It is perfect! The hotel was beautiful - just like the photos! Our room, located on the 2nd floor in the back, was very very nice and extremely clean! The beds were ultra comfortable. So comfortable that it was really easy to sleep in every day. The roosters and chickens did not wake us up at all. We loved the balcony and the convenience of having a refrigerator in the room. The heated pool was very very beautiful - we stayed at the hotel during that cold snap in December and still went swimming! Hot tub was great! The hotel staff could not have been any friendlier! The area around the hotel is sometimes busy at different times of the day but there is a side entrance to leave the parking lot so you can turn onto a side road and then to the main road much easier.

Reviews.Title: “Rooster waking patrons from 1:00-7:00 a.m.!”
Reviews.Author: bahamamamma_ohio
Reviews.Content: The Inn was a lovely hotel...good location, clean, nice pool area but when we slept at night, due to Key West's free reign of chickens and roosters, we were kept awake from 1:00-7:00 a.m.! I'd recommend any room but the back of the building...our room number was 237.

Reviews.Title: “Great Pool, Great Room, Great Choice”
Reviews.Author: AndreaWaltz
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great. The pool and spa tub are fantastic. We spend lots of time there. The breakfast at the little outdoor cafe was very nice. The rooms are really comfortable, great beds, fabulous showers. The decor is "carribean upscale." Only thing - If you must be in the "heart of downtown" then this may not be for you. But we took cabs into downtown and walked around and had dinners there. There are lots of places to stay - this hotel is a wonderful getaway, again, I doubt anyone has nice a pool anywhere!

Reviews.Title: “First Trip To Key West - Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lyngale1
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Key West. We did not make reservation before arriving, however I had looked at The Inn At Key West reviews, etc., before arriving. I was not disappointed. The Inn was very nice, staff were friendly, room was clean and nice. We had a King room. The Inn At Key West is in a pretty good location in the "New Town" section of Key West. We were close to the public welcome center where we caught the Old Town Trolly. The hotel was quiet, comfortable and we would definitely stay there again. I recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay for a wedding party!”
Reviews.Author: 3kinishka
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for my daughter's beach wedding. It is an excellent Inn. The rooms were neat and clean, the staff was very friendly and helpful. (they even donated some safety pins!) The wedding families had breakfast in the lounge beside the pool. (I'd call it a lagoon) The pool was a great place to relax and unwind before and after the ceremony. My husband and I are looking forward to having our second honeymoon here!

Reviews.Title: “Good quality and value”
Reviews.Author: RandyCorbin
Reviews.Content: Rooms are nice size, good layout and clean. Comfortable bed. Nice amenities. Good parking available. Good location, close to Old Town and Duval.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay!”
Reviews.Author: Jonrob89
Reviews.Content: The inn at key west made my trip even more incredible. I have made several trips to Key West but the staff and resort of the inn at Key West made my last trip incredible. It was almost my home away from home and the staff catered to my every need. I will be booking my stay here in the near future for my next trip to Key West!

Reviews.Title: “Incredible vacation!!!”
Reviews.Author: Beccahill
Reviews.Content: We have gone to Key West for years but never have stayed at a place as wonderful as the Inn at Key West!!!! This hotel is absolutely amazing! The rooms are gorgeous, the pool amazing and the service impeccable!!! Great for families or a romantic getaway!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: ninagupta
Reviews.Content: This hotel was wonderful. The rooms are awesome with a huge flat screen tv (with all the channels), classy tropical style decor, and a lovely bathroom with double doors to enter. The lobby is beautiful and has a grand staircase leading up to rooms on the second floor. I stayed in a deluxe king room on the first floor which was easily accessed from one of the few parking lots on the premises. The pool area is breathtaking. The hottub is surrounded by palm trees, and you can see the stars at night while taking a dip. The staff was really friendly and very helpful. I would def. stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A quick Review”
Reviews.Author: pastmybest
Reviews.Content: My wif anf I only stayed one night and we chose this hotel as it was easy to find, We drove to Key West directly from Miami Airport and arrived in the dark. The hotel was clean well run and the rooms we well appointed. The pool was excellent. The position of the hotel meant the trip to resurants cost us $18 or so. We breakfasted in Key West but there seemed to be a reasonable breakfast on offer. Overall a good hotel. There is a downside the sea across the road has no beach.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Pool, Have stayed before and will stay again”
Reviews.Author: ourislandtime
Reviews.Content: Hotel is comfortable, clean, service is excellent, and its a great value for Key West. The pool can't be beat, which is important as there are not a lot of beaches to get your fill of sun and water. You need some type of transport to get to the activities downtown or at the waterfront, but we just rent bikes and go. We're coming back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “What a great vacation...will definitely go back.”
Reviews.Author: Britt05
Reviews.Content: We had an awesome time in Key West. The hotel was very nice. It looks just like the pictures, except for the lobby maybe. It didn't make me go "ooo" like the picture did. But upon closer look it was all the same...must have been the lighting. The check in process went fast. We asked about getting a king size bed, but I guess they aren't the type of hotel to do that for free when they aren't busy...so that was a bust. The workers all seemed very nice and polite. We didn't have one single problem so we never really had to talk to them. The room was really nice. There is a fridge, but it's kind of small so don't go crazy at the liquor store. Which are all over the place by the way. The beds are very very comfortable. The bathroom and sink area were nice. Absolutely every thing has been redone from the flood in 2005 (I think they said). Housekeeping came right at 11am every day to clean the room, and would come right back as soon as you left if you were still there. New towels were always left even though we hung ours back up. Not sure if they changed the sheets. Hopefully you aren't that dirty. There is a makeup mirror wich is always a plus. I'm not a huge fan of the little shampoos and stuff but they seemed to be of pretty good quality. The pool is amazing. It's huge with palm trees all over and even a little sandy beach area. There was a guy singing island sounding music during the day on Sat. and Sun. We used the hot tub twice and one time it was so hot I couldn't put my feet in. They do have beach towels at the pool. I had one frozen drink at the pool and it was really good. There is a small dining area next to the pool, but we didn't eat there. We glanced at the breakfast menu and it was $15 for the buffet. There are too many cool places closer to the main strip to eat at in my opinion. Now for going outside of the hotel. It is away from the downtown party area, but it is 10 min max and that's just because the speed limit does not go over 35 any where. I highly recomend renting scooters to go around. You can go to the lady in the lobby and she will set it up. They come pick you up from the hotel and drop you back off when your done..for just a tip. The company they used was $45 for 24hr and an extra $25 for extra days. Those prices are for the singles scooters. It was worth every penny. You can't help but smile on those things. Most every one is on bikes and scooters any way. We only took the car in to downtown twice and it was a pain to find parking where you didn't have to pay. Every thing on Duval is pretty expensive but if you go on the side streets it gets cheaper. We had great food and great drinks the whole time. They do not water any thing down that's for sure. They like to get their drink on so the bars and restaurants open pretty early and some of them had happy hours in the morning, noon, and night. All of the locals were extremely nice and wanted to know where you were from and told you about places to try. Being 28 and 31 we were some of the youngest people there. The beach and water is absolutely beautiful. It was just like Mexico, but without the waves. The hotel is for sure one of the top 5 on the island. There are a lot of house/inn type places. I guess you just have to know about those from experience. It was a great hotel and a great place to be. We will be back for sure. Probably try to make it to fantasy fest next year. You should look that up.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room and property, but not super convenient and a gripe about the price/confirmation process”
Reviews.Author: brently55
Reviews.Content: The room was very nicely furnished and the property well kept. A few small gripes though that detracted from the overall experience. When I made the initial booking and received the confirmation - the negotiated price was not included. I phoned back and asked that they include the room rate - but would not, which is very odd. Sure enough, when I arrived, they price we had agreed on was not honoured. There was no follow up as promised. Secondly the location requires a car - which we had, so wasnt a huge issue, but just be aware. Lastly, the room locations weren't very well marked. We ended up wandering a few times trying to find our room.

Reviews.Title: “Would go back!”
Reviews.Author: luvhighway1
Reviews.Content: This is the second year my husband and I have stayed at The Inn. No bed bugs (which is a plus since we're from Ohio!) You cannot hear your neighbors! The staff were very friendly! The only negative thing I can say, is the inner shower curtain had a little bit of mold on it. Overall I love staying at The Inn!

Reviews.Title: “Nicely renovated bargain”
Reviews.Author: Vacationer2Maine
Reviews.Content: It is obvious that this place was newly upgraded - the rooms are nice, the pool is really good and the breakfast buffet is very good. It would be nice if they had a more convenient way downtown other than just the trolley twice a day or a taxi, which mounts up after a few days, but otherwise, it's a good location, good place to relax by the pool and nicely furnished.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful quaint property, very welcoming”
Reviews.Author: Nancy35085
Reviews.Content: This property is removed from the downtown crowd and trinket shops but the trolley makes a stop in walking distance. Since we had a car, the location was perfect for day and night. We had a very nice, clean room equipped with flat screen TV and computer hook-up on the 2nd floor, overlooking the pool area which is absolutely beautiful, with waterfall and all the palm trees and other native tropical plantings around. Looking out from our room, one would think they were in the Caribbean. From the moment of arrival until we left, everyone, including the staff at the front desk, the tiki bar, outdoor restaurant on site, and maid service were all so nice and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel with great staff, pool/grounds beautiful-super reasonable!!”
Reviews.Author: Happyone69
Reviews.Content: Loved it all around. Could not say anything bad. So happy the pool was heated and beautiful grounds and wall fall-very tropical like. Price for room and food services was very fare. Great locations. Would go back if I could and would stay longer.

Reviews.Title: “Be prepared to get bitten by mosquitoes!!!”
Reviews.Author: loveoutdoors5
Reviews.Content: Well I just got back into the hotel for my second night here. The place is not bad overall - nice furniture. Everything is updated. Just one big problem. The room is teeming with mosquitoes. I have not yet even opened any doors or windows my entire stay! I complained to the front desk earlier tonight; they said that they would call security to "spray down the room". never happened. If I would have known, I would have gone to the store to buy a box fan or mosquito net. It all started last night when I kept getting bit by mosquitoes all last night. I awoke every hour to the sound of mosquitoes buzzing in my ear. Very bad considering there are now reports ot Dengue Fever returning to the area. I don't know. Maybe it's the room. Maybe avoid the rooms with the patios/balconies facing the back/south side of the building. I've been staying at various hotels in Key West for at least 20 trips over the past 5 years. never had this problem. So I will be using bug spray before I go to bed tonight. Hopefully the place won't smell like bug spray for the next customer. Wish me luck tonight vs the mosquitoes... UPDATE/RESULTS: it's not so bad if you wear bug spray to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Inn at Key West is a really nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Work2Vacation
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights with my husband and teenage son November 7 - 9, 2010. We were fortunate to get a room that opened to the beautiful pool area. The foliage in and around the pool is beautiful. Being early risers, we saw that the pool and the patio area surrounding the pool was cleaned every morning and maintained throughout the day. There is a nice walkway that leads to the cafe that serves breakfast and lunch daily (we did not get around to eating there). There is fresh brewed complimentary coffee at the cafe every morning from 7 to 11 in addition to the small coffee maker with complimentary coffee in the room. The room itself was very nicely furnished; especially the bathroom. (I just loved the bathroom!). The room was very clean and the beds were comfortable. The only complaint is that the AC unit was too loud for me during the night. The large flat screen TV was nice too. Check-in and check-out were smooth and without issues. The staff were all helpful and courteous. I would definitely stay here again. You do have to drive to old town from the hotel, but I knew that when I booked it.

Reviews.Title: “Just for the wonderful pool in the garden...I would go back!”
Reviews.Author: floride55
Reviews.Content: >Perfect place to stay......great room........great service and a wonderful pool.........

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but not a beach resort.”
Reviews.Author: mike154948
Reviews.Content: It really is just your average motel with nice furnishings and a big pool. It is across a busy street from the ocean and there is no beach there. They didnâ€™t have the bed configuration we booked and they gave us an ocean view for free. The view was pretty good but ruined by the parking lot and noise from the street. I thought it was overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome pool and nice rooms at a reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: joeyismydog
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel. When my wife and I were in Tokyo this year, we stayed at a 5-star hotel designated as "Expedia's Insiders' Select", and we were very happy with it. It was the best hotel we have stayed in Tokyo, and we have been to Tokyo many times. So when I saw this hotel's reasonable price and the "Insider's Select" designation, I went for it, and we were not disappointed. The hotel is not near Duval street. It's about a 5-min drive, near the entrance to the US-1, which means it's really easy to find coming off the highway. The best part of this hotel is the pool. It is clean, surrounded by palm trees, and full of lounge chairs. There is a bar by the pool, though not a swim-up one. We stayed here for 3 nights and has enjoyed the pool a couple of times. (To hotel management: why don't you provide pool towels there as well? It will be great if you do) Near the pool is a small fitness room. I was impressed with how comfortable a little fitness room could feel. There are only four cardio machines, a weight bench with weights, and some medicine balls in the room. But all the cardio machines are brand new, with working TV screens. The room is very chilled and has a water cooler, towels, headsets, and another large flatscreen TV. The best part is, no one uses it. The room, while not big, is decorated with tasteful tropical, dark wood, furniture. There is a 42-inch flat screen TV hung nicely on the wall. The a/c works extremely well and the bathroom is nice. Our room faces the parking lot, which is good and bad. Good is that it's kind of secluded. I noticed that certain pool facing rooms are along the walkway to the pool and the breakfast rooms so there could be a lot of foot traffic. Bad is that we hear the roosters in the morning. There are many chickens and roosters in the parking lot. They are not that loud as they are not right outside the rooms, but I could hear them. Other than that, I think Inn at Key West is a great hotel and very reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, lovely room and fabulous pool area but out of the way of Duvall Street”
Reviews.Author: APanovScouse
Reviews.Content: * Say what you liked best & least As our stay was room only the only service we encountered was pool bar and reception. Both were very good service. The room was very good indeed. Looked very luxurious on entry. Fantastic bed and bathroom and very clean indeed. The location was about two miles out from Duvall Street and required a drive / taxi to get there but if you want to get away from Duvall Street it is perfect. If, like us, you were room only you are within walking distance of food outlets and Publix supermarket. The best thing for us was the pool area which my wife described as the best she had ever seen. The worst, according to my wife, was a picture seen on the internet that showed dining tables around the pool suggesting this might be a feature of the evening when staying. Apart from this The Inn is a wonderful place if you want to get away from it all. On the Whole, the pictures you see on the Internet are not misleading.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: dave0520
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel. A little out of the way but well worth the time spent traveling to Old Town (about 10 minutes to a parking spot). The room was clean and comfortable. We had a view of the Gulf and sat on our patio reading and enjoying the view. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. Pool and bar were great. It was a little difficult getting out of the parking lot at times because you're on Rte 1 but there is a back way out and you can take 2 minutes to get to a light. All in all a wonderful time. Would definately stay here again and recommend it to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “The Inn was awesome in every way we needed!”
Reviews.Author: JandAsDad
Reviews.Content: The Inn provided our family the comfortable, quiet, clean, and well-located lodging we sought on our trip to Key West. The pool area was spacious and clean with a wonderful bar avilable for us to obtain our libations. Our room was poolside which concerned us for being quiet, but we never heard noise that would have interrupted our rest. The concierge helped us arrange bicycle rentals that we used for all our transportation throughout the town for both day and evening activities. We only wish we would have stayed longer!

Reviews.Title: “This is a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pang0lin
Reviews.Content: We arrived after a tiring trip from Orlando. It poured with rain for about 100 of the 120 miles of the overseas highway so we were pretty relieved when the sun came out and we arrived in Key West. After such a long drive it was a relief the hotel is so easy to find. We parked right outside and went and checked in. Very smart reception and friendly staff. Our room exceeded our expectation and my wife just kept saying 'look at this, look at this' etc. We were pretty tired so all we wanted was to find somewhere to eat - we asked at reception and they could not have done more. They helped us decide on a restaurant and organised a taxi etc. The evening was fantastic, the taxis worked and we had a great experience. When we got back I went and had a drink at the poolside bar with my son-in-law. A great pool area. I had seen other reviews on trip advisor for this hotel so we were quite nervous about what we would find but our experience here was completely at odds with those negative reviews.

Reviews.Title: “This is a come-backer”
Reviews.Author: bobgreg05
Reviews.Content: Everything about this place is top-notch. The lobby is beautiful - the staff is cheerful, friendly and helpful. They make changes and solve problems with a great attitude. The rooms are clean, well-furnished and comfortable. The pool area and hot tub are well-maintained and a great place to just kick back. This would be my first choice if I ever return to Key West. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Simply superb”
Reviews.Author: ksk316
Reviews.Content: We looked around for a decent hotel to stay for 3 nights in Key West and weren't expecting much when we got this one for 99 bucks a night. All we were expecting was no bed bugs and filthy smell. To our surprise the hotel and our room was very clean. We were originally told that we'll have a pool facing room but the pool view was completely blocked by banana trees. The receptionist James was very kind to let us have take a look at a few rooms to decide and when we didn't like any he told us we could move into another the next day. The pool is a great sight esp in the night. Feels like you are in the Caribbean. Though it's not in downtown, the hotel is very near to Publix and a few other fast food places and scooter rentals. Unfortunately we had to cut our trip short due to the windy conditions and we were only charged for the nights we stayed although we informed late. Great concierge service as well. The only flip side is that there is no wireless internet in the room. We used the ethernet cable though. We would definitely recommend this hotel if you are on a budget but still want a decent hotel and a great pool.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel...”
Reviews.Author: Kimberly418
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at this hotel and we had a great time. The rooms were a little smaller than we thought they'd be, but it was cleaned and well-maintained. The hotel is a ways from Duval Street so it would have been nice if they had a shuttle or arrangements for discounts with trolleys or other hotel shuttles. The pool area was absolutely beautiful! Nice staff!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Key West”
Reviews.Author: phil1985
Reviews.Content: Spent Columbus Day weekend in Key West with my girlfriend, and we were incredibly pleased with the Inn at Key West. Neither of us had been to the Keys before, so we wanted to make sure that we stayed at a great place, and as usual TripAdvisor helped us choose. Big, beautiful pool; great room with a view looking into the pool area, (we had to upgrade for this room, but it was only $30 more), and a great Tiki Bar, (highly recommend the Pina Colada's and Mojito's). I suppose the only things I saw as issues (if you want to call them that) were the location, (not super close to Duval Street, but a very short cab ride, and not super close to the beach either, but not incredibly far). All in all a great stay. Highly recommend to other travelers and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Very helpful”
Reviews.Author: 007bug
Reviews.Content: The 4 of us had never been to Key West and found our accommadations on line. When we arrived the staff starting with the 'door man' to the front desk where they were so customer oriented, friendly, 'smiley' faces and helpful. The rooms were so clean and beautiful and quiet. The grounds were well groomed. The pool staff was also so accommadating. All staff was able to recommend places to eat and where to go as far as what to see. It as an over all great experience!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a honeymoon!!”
Reviews.Author: OctoberWife
Reviews.Content: When we got to our hotel, we were amazed.. the pictures don't do justice. You have to see this place for yourselves!!!! There's an IHOP right next store for breakfast, your walking distance from the water, and close by a scooter rental place. My husband and I were so glad we stayed here and can't wait to go back. The bartenders at the Tiki Bar by the pool were always happy and helped us with information. If you don't choose this as your place of stay... you're crazy!

Reviews.Title: “Tropical Paradise!”
Reviews.Author: Malaki15
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a very tropical themed hotel for a relaxing three day weekend- and this was perfect! It's not beach front property- but has a fantastic pool that does not let you forget you are in the tropics! We upgraded to have a balcony facing the pool and were very happy with the room and view. This is a great place for couples there is a great bar at the pool and certain days even live music. Also only a $10 cab ride down to Duval street- where a lot of good restaurants and nightlife are located.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jerseytraveller_8
Reviews.Content: The only reason we didn't give it a rating of 5 is due to the location. What previous reviewers accurately conveyed was true. A cab ride or a car is the quickest way to get down to Duval St. but we didn't have a car and didn't pay for a taxi. We bought a 7 day bus pass for $8.00 even though we only stayed there for 5 days. You will save tons of money but there is the bus schedule to seriously take into consideration. With my wife and I, time wasn't a big deal so we rode the bus all over. We take public transportation wherever we go because in addition to the cheap fare we also get the local flavor of the residents. The Hotel was absolutely gorgeous. For those who have been to a caribbean resort, you would appreciate the layout and scenery. We were given a an early checkin which was great but that same night after getting back to the room we found that the air conditioner wasn't working properly. We called the front desk and they had someone show up within 5 minutes which was great. He tried a couple of things with no success so he called the front desk and they moved us to an upgraded room in the main building which was a pleasant surprise. The larger room had a larger bathroom, an in room safe and the rain shower. To be honest I believe all rooms should have in room safes. The bed was very comfortable. High speed internet in room was spotty as was cell phone reception (carrier is verizon) Both signals were stronger in first room (#234). We didn't eat any meals at the cafe so I can't comment on the price, taste or selection. We walked over to the Publix and bought some food and walked down each morning to the McDonalds for breakfast. Also next to the hotel is a Wendys, Subway and I-Hop. They also have a movie theatre next to the Publix. Dinners were down on Duval. They also have a fitness center which was more than adequate. They have at least 5 cardio machines and a free weight stand with a bench. They also offer washer and dryers for the cost of $2.00 a load which was huge as we didn't have to check any bags in at the airport and pay those hefty bag fees. We each had a carry on and did our laundry the day before we flew out. Our ride from the hotel to airport was about 1.5 miles from the hotel and the cab ride was $6.50 p.p. As I written in previous reviews, when we are fortunate enough to go back to a city we like, we stay in different parts of the city so even though we loved the hotel we will stay someplace closer to Duval.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience, Beautiful Hotel, Great Price!”
Reviews.Author: teddyp19
Reviews.Content: The location is not in walking distance of Duvall or night activites, but is great if you need some time away from the crowds. It is also next door to a Publix, so you can get snacks and drinks without paying tourist costs. The pool is beautiful- the best in Key West. The concierge service is also excellent - be sure to visit Millie and Nicole for tour ideas. James at the front desk is professional , personable and very accommodating. The rooms are all decorated in Tommy Bahama style and are very nice and comfortable. We will be sure to stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Great room!”
Reviews.Author: klbc1977
Reviews.Content: The room was great, the staff was great, and the pool was great! Very comfortable beds!!! You can't walk to downtown from the hotel but driving there only took a few minutes and there was plenty of parking in downtown. I loved my morning wake up call from the resident roosters in the parking lot! A great hotel to take the kids....they will love the swimming pool!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great city!”
Reviews.Author: mikejulie00
Reviews.Content: This hotel was awsome, the rooms are a great size and the staff was wonderful and the pool was spectacular. This place is great for families or adults wanting to get away from the busy life.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury Feeling”
Reviews.Author: cpinktinkerbell
Reviews.Content: The reception and the rooms were decorated in a very elegant way. reception and concierge were very helpful. The pool and hot tub was lovely, largest pool in Key West. Lovely bathroom facilities, massive flat screen TV and very comfy bed. I-Hop right next door which was ideal for breakfast. Situated out of the main town but a taxi in wasn't too much and was worth it so could have some amazing frozen cocktails at Sloppy Joes!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cappelleri
Reviews.Content: We had never been to the Key's and didn't know any of the Hotels but I picked that one because I read the past reviews and they were mostly good.

Reviews.Title: “It was ok.”
Reviews.Author: Jeuls
Reviews.Content: First time at the Inn, Entrance is nice front desk depends who tends to you. I had a snobb - felt like he didn't like hispanics. But my friends went to the person next to my snob and he was very pleasant, informative and welcoming. I asked for the manager was told she would be there the next day - NO ONE SHOWED. They hold $50 a night for every night you stay. When booking NO ONE mentioned this and when I checked in NO ONE mentioned this. I found out because I always check my accounts. It was 3 couples we booked a couple of days apart and all got different rates. They didn't apply my AAA discount and I asked them to and the front desk person said the rate included it I didn't see that on my bill. All 3 rooms were different, mine was small with an Oversized bathroom. The other two couples had almost about the same except one had no tub, and the other had a love seat and table in there room and a small shower. Besides that the person with activity information was pleasant and very helpful. THE POOL AWESOME and the FOOD was GREAT. We had music by the pool for a few hours on Saturday very nice. Besides that I guess I was just spoiled at other hotels that don't charge a deposit and the rooms are spacious. OH and no view to anything. NO balconies.

Reviews.Title: “Inn at Key West was even better than we expected.”
Reviews.Author: stanpat2
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. The staff was very helpful with making restaurant choices and securing transportation to the downtown area. We would definitely stay at the Inn again and would recommend it to all of our friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “WHY STAY ANYWHERE ELSE..”
Reviews.Author: tragicallyhip
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for two reasons... a) the pool b) the price We were not disappointed. The service was amazing as we were upgraded to a pool view room. The pool itslef was huge but the with the coverage of palm trees the pool seemed like a beautiful quite, secluded oasis! the tikie bar was nice too. Our room was very cleand and was quite obvious it has been recently renovated. We loved the way it was done up and was very comfortable. The only two drawbacks are the location....so if you want to party on Duval you better plan on a 5-10 minute cab ride or have a DD. Luckily my wife wasnt drinking so she drove. the other thing was luckily we didnt notice until the morning of our last day, but the duvet is only covered by two ned sheets on either side is obviously not washed all the time as my wife did notice quite a few stains...but no biggy. i dont know why anyone would spend double the price to stay, this was great and would def. stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: junejbb3
Reviews.Content: The Inn at Key West went out of their way to make our stay enjoyable. We planned our trip and used the Florida Resident rate. A couple of days before we were to check in we were advised that the pool (a very beautiful one) was going to be shut down during our stay for maintenance. They offered us $25.00 off the rate per night and transportation to their other hotel on Duval Street , with use of their pool or to the Beach. Transportation each way was 13.00, charged to the Inn, plus the tip we gave the cab driver. The cab charges could have been expensive had the Inn not picked up the cost. I really would have enjoyed using their pool, but understand that maintenance must be done at some time. I believe The Inn did everything possible to make our stay enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Stay in Key West”
Reviews.Author: cheferjoe
Reviews.Content: Like to stay here when in Key West. Staff is friendly and helpful. They were resurfacing the pool, so it was closed during my stay, but an alternate was offered. I didn't take the offer because the pool wasn't my number one priority. Would return for another stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great for short stays”
Reviews.Author: marcogirl
Reviews.Content: Hotel is great for short stays. Pool was closed for our stay due to resurface. That was a bummer :( They did have free taxi service to their sister hotel on Dual St. to use their pool for a few hours a day. Totally took advantage of that. Front desk/concierge was helpful. They do not have a shuttle service. Taxi was about $15.00 max for one way trip to Duval St. DO NOT rent an electric car especially from Adventure Rentals. We used the car a total of an hour. After that the car broke down and had to leave in a parking lot. Called the company to bring us another car and they were closed with no emergency number. So, We had to call a taxi. We were not happy.

Reviews.Title: “PARADISE”
Reviews.Author: mmdjte
Reviews.Content: This was where my husband and I came for our honeymoon and we couldnt have been more pleased, Everything was beautiful and clean and friendly. We definately will come to the Inn at key west the next time we come. You made our trip perfect! Love the roosters. We even named one Julio.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME”
Reviews.Author: BLACKANGEL13
Reviews.Content: I took a chance online to book this hotel for me and my family. It was my sisters and brother in law first time to the Keys and I wanted them to enjoy it completely. This hotel is absolutely beautiful. We loved everything about it. The rooms were clean and beautifully decorated, beds were comfortable. The pool was was clean and the fact that we were allowed to use it at night was a huge plus. The staff were pleasant and very helpful. We will definitely be staying there again next year for our event ...... HIGHLY RECOMMEND IT. Sincerely Familia United

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel...”
Reviews.Author: AjaKing
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel after a thorough research of all the hotels in Key West, i admit the location is not exactly in the heart of Key West, next to Duval St but it's right on the water and the large pool and beautiful room definitely made up for it. Service from check in trough small requests, to check out was great, friendly and professional. For the price we paid we were very happy...

Reviews.Title: “Relax and enjoy a Key West oasis”
Reviews.Author: Niecie-roth
Reviews.Content: Not only was the property maintained excellently, the staff was very attentive. After spending hours in the excersize room, gazing at the bay and sky, we lounged by the lush pool sipping our martinis. The conceirge was helpful directing us to a marvelous boat outing combining snorkeling, kyacking and sunset viewing. He efficiently made our dinner reservations and direct us to the appropriate parking. My favorite part of our room was the bathrooms "rain" shower. The room appointments and accessories were elegant. We would certainly return to this relaxing atmosphere to enjoy this tropical oasis.

Reviews.Title: “WHAT A POOL! WHAT A GREAT PLACE TO STAY IN KEY WEST!”
Reviews.Author: nyyankeegirlSC
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent a week at The Inn at Key West. We stayed in a king suite that was beautifully decorated and roomy. The room was quiet, clean and comfortable. It was really peaceful and the bed was very comfortable. It had a mini-fridge too. The freshwater pool is huge and surrounded by beautiful tall lush palms and tropical plants. You feel like you are in an oasis and worlds away from the hustle and bustle of US 1 even though it runs right in front of the hotel. We spent every day at the pool for several hours, because we just could'nt tear ourselves away. They provide pool towels. The hotel overlooks the bay. The food and mixed drinks at the pool's tiki-bar and cafe on-site were excellent! Try a fozen tropical cocktail...yum! It is just a short jog to Old Town, Duval St. and Mallory Square. We had a rental car and it only took 5 minutes to get to Old Town. You could take a cab or bus because it would be quite a walk. We will stay at this inn every time we come to Key West. It is a great value, the rooms are great and the staff is amazing!

Reviews.Title: “An excellent experience...”
Reviews.Author: SmOrE628
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Inn at Key West on our first vacation together and had a wonderful time. We had an issue with our room when we first arrived and it was taken care of promptly and we were even upgraded to a suite for our entire stay. The employees at the hotel are all extremely nice and helpful. They provided a lot of information about the area and important places to go see during our stay. The concierge helped us line up 2 day trips that we enjoyed immensely. The hotel was a little far from downtown, but it's very easy to get back and forth via taxi or by renting scooters. Definitely a place to stay if you're looking for a relaxing getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel. Very friendly staff. Great...”
Reviews.Author: Vinz4u
Reviews.Content: Amazing hotel. Very friendly staff. Great pool. Recommend to everybody.

Reviews.Title: “Great pool, Clean rooms!”
Reviews.Author: TravelnGalNj
Reviews.Content: When I arrived to check in early, my room was ready and they were very friendly and polite. The pool is fantastic. They had live music playing and the bartender was great! The room was very clean and pretty up to date. The only downfall of this hotel is that it is about a $18 cab ride to Duval St. I did have one little issue with the hotel service. When I got out of the shower I stepped on a piece of glass and started bleeding like crazy. I didn't break anything but I guess the previous guest must have. My husband called the front desk for a bandage or something because a bandaid just wouldn't help the situation. They said to come and get it at the front desk. When he got to the front desk they handed him a bandaid and told him if he needed something more there was a publix down the road. I'm not holding it against them but considering I didn't break the glass you think they would have shown a little more sympathy

Reviews.Title: “Perfect! We were very happy with our booking!”
Reviews.Author: nomadjam
Reviews.Content: We booked after reading the comments and were absolutely not disapointed. The hotel is really nice, the rooms are clean, cosy and big! The pool is gorgeous! The staff is very helpful and friendly. We got very good advices as for where to have dinner and where to have a drink! We stayed only one night but would have definitely extended it if we could (back to work!) I absolutely recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “The best place for a honeymoon stay”
Reviews.Author: cathiedeanpaci
Reviews.Content: This hotel had the best pool, the most amazing rooms and very helpful/professional/courteous staff. We went for our honeymoon and would stay again in a minute! Great b argain for the price we paid!

Reviews.Title: “Exceptionally clean”
Reviews.Author: Tess0247
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a weekend getaway and were overall pleased with the inn at key west. Pros: the room was very clean with an updated bathroom, hair dryer, iron, mini fridge & coffeepot. The pool is wonderful...not too busy but still fun. Lots of lush landscape, hot tub, tiki bar & poolside lunch avail. Cons: the room was small for the price. The balcony very small with barely enough room for 2 to relax. Ours overlooked the pool but all we could really see was a very large palm & the patio (&people) below us. No room service at all. Breakfast & lunch is served at a cafe by the pool. Don't waste your time w breakfast...VERY pricey buffet with not so great choices & not so fresh looking food (There's an ihop in the parking lot & that was much better for bfast) Did not go to the hotel rest for lunch but did order an appetizer by the pool which was very good so lunch would have probably been ok. Few miles into downtown so you really cannot walk but a few fast food places & public nearby.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: Karin159
Reviews.Content: Friendly and helpfull staff. Beautyful rooms with good beds. Swimmingpool is very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean at a cheap price.”
Reviews.Author: BStagg
Reviews.Content: Because everything is so clean, it appears this property was recently remodeled. To find the CHEAPEST rate go directly to the hotel's web site. I did not use their restaurant for breakfast because they have a Itenational House of Pancakes (IHOP), next door. Many of the guests were european. This is a family hotel.

Reviews.Title: “one on the most beautiful hotel i have ever visited”
Reviews.Author: Hygie
Reviews.Content: We went at Key west for visiting the archipel and we stop sleepping at the Inn hotel. the price at key west is more expensive of somewhere else in florida but this hotel was very wonderful!! the room was lovely decorate with palm theme and the mattress was very confortable. The pool was awesome. it's a huge swimming pool with many palm tree and vegetation all around the pool. it's very a paradisiac place to go swimming. The hotel is very calm and quiet and it's close by car to the downtown of key west and duvall street.

Reviews.Title: “FABULOUS GET AWAY”
Reviews.Author: skippy04
Reviews.Content: We Were treated very well. Like we were the only guests there. We would recommend this hotel to anyone needing a relaxing vacation. I brought home information for a girlfriend and her husband .

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gdraft4257
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel on our honeymoon for one week. I was impressed with it when we arrived but i must admit was a little disappointed on finding our room was on the ground floor facing the car park. However, after settling in this didn't matter, the pool and bar area was so beautiful that we had no reason to stay in the room for any length of time. It was a fantastic place to chill out and the adjoining cafe/eatery was convenient along with the friendly bar staff. The location of the hotel was not ideal though as it felt it was plonked in the middle of nowhere, nothing much around for tourists apart from a few malls containing the regular chain stores and supermarkets. We knew nothing about the geography of Key West before we went and it was only by the knowledge of a friendly local whilst on the bus that we found out about Mallory Square and Duval St; after this we spend every night getting the bus to Duval St as that's where everything is, in the night anyway. In spite of this, the bus was very cheap and as long as you pick up a timetable you can plan nights out easily, I will add that the buses finish rather earlier than any party-goers may like. Beaches are mainly on the south west side of the island and were great, we had use of the sunbeds, shade, kayaks and pedalos included. This made for a great day at the beach. Overall I would have to thorougly recommend this hotel as it was such a stunning place to stay, the pool area was fantastic and although I have commented on the location it really did not spoil our trip in the slightest as the island is so compact and easy to travel it wasn't much of an issue, I just feel that I should mention it. The rooms were comfortable and cleaned regularly. A great place to stay! Highly recommended for couples too!

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected!”
Reviews.Author: DavidIdaho
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel was a disappointment - it smack between a Kia Dealership and IHOP. I didn't get that feeling from the pictures. Our stay was OK, but the pool is nowhere near as large as the pictures lead you to believe....my wife kept thinking here must be ANOTHER bigger pool but alas there is not. I'd probably try to find a better, higher end hotel if I return, but since I used my Capital One points and paid $0 for two nights I guess I can't really be too annoyed. Still, I was let down when I drove up and wondered if I was in the right place for a bit.

Reviews.Title: “Norhing special, but OK.”
Reviews.Author: Vestfoldgirl
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights. My expectations were probably too high due to the raving reviews here. The hotel is easy to find, as it's situatated along the main road into Key West. I knew from reading here that it was a bit far from down town Key West. And it sure was, it took us over an hour to walk, so don't do that!! The taxi back was $ 18. Take your car down town, there seemed many parking lots. If I ever go back to Key West, I will find a place closer to Duval street, as we like to be able to just pop out of the hotel without using the car all the time. Liked: The pool. The room and bathroom was clean. 2 computers in the lobby were we could surf the internet. Free parking. Exercise room. Laundry room with washer and dryer. Disliked: No in-room safe. The balcony was tiny. The AC was really loud. The maid knocking on our door every morning between 8.30-9 am asking to clean the room. It's too early, even if we hadn't put on the "do not disturb sign".. The staff did not greet you when you walked by. We did not try out the restaurant in the hotel, as we did not think it looked very nice.. We ate down town Key West. There is a IHOP right next to the hotel, if you want breakfast and lunch. There is a Publix very close to the hotel, so can also pick up fresh fruits etc for breakfast there.

Reviews.Title: “This is the most Beautiful hotel in Key West!”
Reviews.Author: TamaraFotWayne
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in Key west many times at several different hotels. I must say, that this is the nicest place we have found. My Husband really liked the flat screen TV. The decor was lovely. My Husband is a Contractor and we really enjoyed our stay. We will definetly go back.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel with great staff!”
Reviews.Author: Diva_Surfer80
Reviews.Content: The hotel was recently renavated and looked amazing. Driving up to the hotel we were not sure we made the right choice but after we walked into the lobby I knew it would we a nice stay. Rooms were a nice size, clean and very up-2-date. Free parking out side of our room and the pool was seconds away. We had lunch at the hotel it was very tasty and beachside made it ten times better. I recommend renting a car you will never be able to get to all the amazing sites without one! Best in country vacation ever. Everyone was so relaxed and you must stop by the front desk and sign up for excursions as soon as you check -in! Hotel is great for any traveler!

Reviews.Title: “Have Booked for my next stay already”
Reviews.Author: SPZ1978
Reviews.Content: The minute you enter the lobby you can tell that this hotel is of very god standard. when I called and they gave me the rate over the phone I was incredulous. Everything nice in Key West does not go below $200 a night, so when I saw the pics in the website and got the rate I said to my husband, "This is too good to be true". Well, it's not. The place is awesome. It doesn't matter if it's not in the middle of the hustle and Bustle of Duval, Its driving distance from Duval and Mallory Square, but it's worth it. We planned on taking a cab but we decided against it. We got our car and went and we found a parking lot close to The Key West Winery that only charged us $15.00 for the entire day until 4 am. We enjoyed the pool every day. the pool was clean so was the Jacuzzi. The ambient was quiet and very family oriented. It was funny while I was in the pool, I see my daughter running over to the bar by the pool and when I go see why, she says "look Mommy, they are putting Shrek!" I liked that. They realized there were lots of children in the area and put in a movie. The rooms are spectacular. Marble bathrooms, plasma tv's, DVD, refrigerators, very clean. the staff was amazing. The only complain I have is that our refrigerator was broken and we called twice to have them fix it, but no one came. I didn't worry too much about it since I had nothing that needed refrigeration, otherwise I would have really complained and would have had the problem solved. Overall, I loved it and loved the fact that the pool is open until very late. So when we arrived from a long day of walking, we just changed into our swimsuits and ran to the pool. I love this hotel and plan on staying here again for the Key West Poker Run in Sept.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: keysjuly4
Reviews.Content: For the price of the rooms I wouldnt reccommend this hotel read my story and you will see why ..We went with family and friends over July 4th. The hotel is clean and the pool area is beautiful. Some of the staff was friendly.The bad expereice we had was the 1st day there our a/c wasnt working they had no management or maintenance after 5:00 pm, So at 11:00pm we had to go to 2 different rooms check them out ourselves to see if the a/c was working in those rooms once we found a room we had to move everything ourselves it took us a hr. The 2nd night there at 2:15 am our toilet over flowed and flooded our bathroom again no manager on or maintenance we had to plunge the toilet ourselves and clean everything up. For a room that we paid almost $200.00 a night for not acceptable. they gave us about 100.00 off our bill for the weekend. I filled out the comment card asked for a call back from the GM it is 2 weeks later and still no call. i had told some of my friends before we got there to book rooms because it looked so nice after my experience they canceled and booked a room somewhere else..

Reviews.Title: “best trip ever!”
Reviews.Author: mariem11
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here in June of this year and have been telling everyone how amazing the hotel was ever since. All of the staff was very helpful and nice, but Rigo the lead engineer stood out in both his friendliness and helpfulness within minutes of our arrival. He made our trip even more special than I could have ever imagined it being! Especially setting us up with his friend's jet ski company, Everyone in Key West is friendly, but he really stood out and impressed us. The room was spacious and comfortable. We even had a private patio surrounded by trees giving us privacy. The pool was also large and beautiful. Exploring Key West was fun, but we really could have spent the entire trip relaxing at the hotel and had just as much fun! The location is a few miles from Duval St. but we rented bikes and went everywhere we wanted to go easily! This trip was amazing and I highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great Destination Wedding hotel.”
Reviews.Author: creationspluscg
Reviews.Content: Loved the place-The staff was very helpful. If something was not right they fixed it right away. The Cafe at the Inn severs great breakfast and Lunch and the staff there are very friendly and helpful. Linda and Al you rock. Sandi is great as well. Great place to hold a destination party. The Pool is awesome clean and beautiful surrounding. Room are large and clean nicely decorated.

Reviews.Title: “the best secret in the keys”
Reviews.Author: rao1
Reviews.Content: stayed at the keywest inn on june 18 thru the 20,we loved it,as soon as we walked in,my wife was overtaken by the clean lobby and fresh clean air.the room was 212 which is right in front of the stairs,meant no walking down the hall.balconey room with a pool view.king size bed was awesome.the pool is huge and super clean.tikki bar great for drinks and great burgers.james at the front desk is very helpful and attentive to guest needs.we will stay again very soon.and theres an ihop next door with better menu and prices then the hotel breakfast menu.awesome trip,see you guys again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot for a family to stay”
Reviews.Author: chefriley
Reviews.Content: My family decided on a car trip south to Key West from Palm Beach County. When we went through some different websites to find a nice place to stay in town, we stumbled across the Inn at Key West. While not a big name resort, they satisfied us very nicely. We aren't a huge snorkling/boating/fishing group, mainly we wanted to stay somewhere away from home that we could sit at a pool and worry about nothing. This was the perfect place for it. When people complain about how "far" it is from downtown, one needs to realize that from tip to tip, Key West is about 5 miles long and 5 miles wide. It's a 10 minute drive to Duval St., and we found a parking spot at Mallory Square in 5 minutes...though parking is retarded expensive. You are within a 10 minute drive of everything in Key West...Ft. Zachary Taylor, the southernmost point, Duval St....it's all right around the corner. The concierge was helpful in telling us the best beach to go...though if you are going for beaches, you're going to the wrong place. The beaches in the Keys are notoriously rocky and meant for sitting, not surfing. She also recommended a nice pasta place and had a coupon to go along with it. The pool was great. Nice and large with a ton of seats, as well as the Tiki Bar (not really a Tiki bar...you need a thatch hut for that). Decent prices on booze and food for a hotel, too...plus a happy hour that offers $1 off from 4-7. It really is a tropical pool...tons of palm trees, a sand "beach" by the spa. Very, very nice. My only gripe is the bed was a little stiff for me, but I have a bad back anyway. So take that with a grain of salt. The room was nice, the fridge was a bonus and the TV was big enough to keep the kids engrossed from their bed across the room. I left happy, my wife left happy, and more importantly, my kids were happy. That's all I could ask for.

Reviews.Title: “Very up to date and clean”
Reviews.Author: EaglePointWeather
Reviews.Content: I booked this property based on reviews from others in tripadvisor and have to say we were not disappointed. Our room was a Superior Double, very clean and up to date decor. The huge pool area was beautiful with numerous tropical plants including a few banana trees. The maid service and staff were very friendly and courteous. The location is a few miles from Duval street but not an issue for us, if you want some quiet time with family. The Inn at Key West was a great value and would return for another stay.

Reviews.Title: “Ehhh, it's ok.”
Reviews.Author: hlalwine
Reviews.Content: This was our first time to Key West so we didn't know what to expect. It's always hard to understand the proximity of your hotel to where the "action" is in the area you are traveling, until you get there. The Inn at Key West is a few miles to Duvall Street, which is the only fun/touristy area in Key West. It is by no means walking distance and parking can run you $10 for all day or $4 per hour, depending on which of the VERY FEW parking lots are available in the Duvall Street area. The hotel PROS: Lovely lobby with delish water with lime, lemon and orange slices all day. Comfortable bed Fridge and coffee maker Nice pool - although it's never refreshing as you will see all the pools are heated by the sun VERY FAST! Like bath water. Tiki bar next to pool IHOP next door Publix grocery store and KMart just down the street James at the front desk... great guy Hotel CONS: The air conditioner is SUPER LOUD!!! The balcony is so small I have no idea how they got 2 chairs on it. Once the chairs on on it... there's no room for you. The pool towels are rarely available as there is no towel person You can only hear the music when you are near the speakers by the pool and they ONLY play raggae or Jimmy Buffet... which is fun but after 2-3 days... you want something else. The breakfast buffet is outsid eand it is honestly so hot there that it is difficult to eat at the buffet. Also, they had cream cheese that was not on ice or chilled, even though the package said "needs refrigeration" right on it. Did I mention it was blazing hot with un-refrigerated cream cheese? The concierge scheduled a sunset snorkle and a dinner at Lattitudes (a restaurant on Sunset Key) at the same time on the same day... which is physically impossible to do. So we were given the worst seat left at Lattitudes when we arrived. Lattitudes is a very expensive restaurant.. which is contrary to what the concierge told us. My husband and I spent $141 between the 2 of us. That included 1 appetizer, 1 coke, 1 martini and 1 entree each. No dessert. $141!! And she told us it wasn't very expensive all while messing up our reservation. We were not happy. When we returned to the hotel to tell them what had happened, the night gal working the front desk was sitting on the counter on the phone talking to a guest. She didn't make eye contact with us and was sitting there all slouched over, picking at her nails. I would have at least stood up when I knew a guest could see me and make eye contact. At the very least. When we told her what happened she said "Ohhhh, geesh. Sorry." Yup... glad to see she wanted a manager to know. Not. We told James the next day who immediatly told the concierge who then denied any responsibility. Of course. Overall... I would have stayed at a different hotel. I would have stayed at the Southermnost Hotel or Westin. Without a doubt. By the way... the adverstisement "the largest pool in Key West"... make sure you understand that it very well may be the largest in Key West but it is by no means large. Or refreshing. It's like bathwater due to the extreme heat in the Keys.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Tropical Pool”
Reviews.Author: Frostylite
Reviews.Content: Hello, we just returned from this hotel and we enjoyed it very much. We had a garden view with the pool and many tropical trees and water fall. Normally we get water sites but We were not disappointed . We rented bicycles for 1 day through the hotel concierge and it cost $10 each for the day till 6:30. To get a taxi from the Duval back to The Inn cost 13.00 which we did after we returned the bikes and stayed laterfor the sunset at Duval's Crowne hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay and Fantastic Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: SpookandtheBasset
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at The Inn for 5 nights on our 1st visit to Key West and had an amazing stay, the hotel is lovely and totally what you want from somewhere as fabulous as Key West, the rooms were really nice and very well appointed, couple of minor issue about the rooms were that they were a little dark so you would have to have the lights on regardless if it was day or night and the balconies are rather small so we only used ours for drying stuff out on but really who wants to spend the day in their rooms! Other than that itâ€™s a great place to stay the pool is a massive plus and the Tiki bar serves some great cocktails! The lobby and reception is very grand and the service was great, check in was quick and simple! The only real negative about the hotel is that it is a $10-$15 cab ride away from Duval Street and Mallory Square but I believe that a shuttle bus will be available soon for guests so this will solve this issue. Again Key West is amazing and we canâ€™t wait to return and I would definitely recommend the Inn as a great place to stay!
