Reviews.Title: “VERY CLEAN and roomy”
Reviews.Author: albert407
Reviews.Content: very clean, roomy, and a great pool. The gym in this hotel is HUGE,a and water front suites are available. Great 24 hours Dennys at Lobby

Reviews.Title: “Just like the pictures”
Reviews.Author: PurrfectZ
Reviews.Content: Inn was just as pictured. Very pleased with the cleanliness. Our room overlooked the pool which was beautifully landscaped. Nice decor and a good sized refrigerator. We would stay there again. All hotels seem pricey in Key West, but at least we feel we got good value for the price. The hotel is outside of downtown, so you do have to figure out how to get to town. We drove and found free street parking after hunting 20 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “I'd stay again and again”
Reviews.Author: chuckslover
Reviews.Content: Great hotel just north of Old Town. Drove into town. Was able to find parking . It was worth having a car being on the outskirts of Old Town. Hotel is clean, beautiful, pool was clean, large. Can't say enough. Great stay, would go back again. No complaints. Didn't eat at the hotel. We called to tell the front desk that we didn't think the refrigerator was working and when we came back to the room, there was a replacement. No elevators to the 2nd floor in the main building. If you book with a debit card, check with their procedure for pending money from your account. Didn't know that when I booked the hotel. I booked through their website and got the best nightly rate. I just can't say enough about this hotel. We loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in Key West”
Reviews.Author: Shamoson
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed 2 nights at the Inn at Key West. We had not orginally planned on going to Key West during our week in southern FL, so there was not a great deal of planning that went into the selection of the hotel. I litterly booked it the day before from my phone....But it turned out GREAT... As other people have stated, it is not near Duval Street...which really was perfect for us. When we were there, it was so hot, the time I spent down on Duval street was not enjoyable, so it did not bother me staying away from the area. We had a car and did drive down, once at night to see the sunset and another time during the day to shop and sight see. On both occasions, we parked 1/2 a block off Duval street, so the location of the hotel was not an issue for us at all. The hotel was really lovely. It is a small resort, that has nice furnishings, a great pool and a nice pool bar area. If you want to relax by the pool during the day, it was a great location. We booked a King room, that had a baloncy overlooking the pool in the main building. It was very comfortable, clean and well appointed. I had looked at hotels in Key West in the past and this hotel was a good value. After staying there, I would look to stay there again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointing”
Reviews.Author: smlair
Reviews.Content: I felt we were mislead by this hotel. When I spoke to them on the phone I was told our room had a king bed, ocean view and a balcony. When we got there, I was told that such a room does not exist at this hotel and that our king room had a patio that essentially sat right off the hotel driveway where folks park there cars to check in - not exactly scenic. The hotel is a good 3 miles from downtown and the walk is doable at night, but don't try it in the Florida sun - they may have to scrape you off the pavement. I do have to give this place points for value. After scouring the internet for discounts (I think I ended up using an early bird special on the website and then another one I found online) we paid $155/night. If you are going to stay here, make sure you get a discount!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: eatsleepskirepeat
Reviews.Content: My second visit here. Will come back again. Small and intimate hotel with a pool as nice as a large resort. Reasonable prices for poolside drinks. Rooms very nicely furnished. If you are ok with being a 10 minute drive from the action you can't go wrong with the Inn at Key West.

Reviews.Title: “What a great place to stay in Key West.”
Reviews.Author: NewJerseyBeachBumb
Reviews.Content: The Inn at Key West was all that we had expected it to be. The property was like a mini Caribbean resort. The landscaping was beautiful, the pool was exceptionally large and nice along with the tiki bar. Pool side service was really a nice touch. Check-in was a breeze and the personnel handling our check-in were extremely helpful. We had a second floor room in the main building with a view of the pool area. It was great to sit out on our private balcony to have coffee and just relax with the surroundings. The room was extremely clean, the king bed was very comfortable and well appointed. The room was decorated with a Caribbean theme and the flat screen tv was great as well. The Inn was a bit out of town but was nice to be away from the hustle and bustle of Duval St. We had no problem getting to town which was a short ride . We had a car and used it occasionally but also used a bus to go into town. Either way there was no problem getting around. The staff was very friendly, helpful and our room was cleaned beyond our satisfaction. Overall this was a great place to stay in Key West. We hated to leave. We had a great stay in Key West and our experience with the Inn played an enormous role in making our stay memorable. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Does what it says on the tin”
Reviews.Author: Plainville07
Reviews.Content: Most of the reviews about this Hotel seem to hit the nail on the head. It's good, but it isn't great. However for the rates they are charging, I think you would be hard pressed to find something better. Positives: Really easy to find - yes a bit of a trek away of the 'action' of Duval Street, but if you have a car, or can get a cab this really isn't an issue Plenty of parking space was a bonus too. The Pool - a really big plus point here in terms of it's size, the shelter that the palm trees offer from the intensity of the mid day sun, and the fairly efficient service from the pool side bar. The Rooms - very clean and comfortable, although a tad 'traditional' for our tastes. Local amenities - if you didn't fancy trekking down into town, there are a few other hotels, bars, shops, ATM's etc all right next to the hotel. Views - apart from the main road at the front of the hotel, which can be busy during during the day, the sunset views were 1st class. Food - Not bad at all, typical US size portions, so you never went hungry! Negatives: The surly staff - from our immediate arrival through to our departure, the typical US good nature was seriously lacking. Pool toys - personally I want to be able to swim in a pool, not have to dodge around lots of people floating on it. Poolside music - I love Bob Marley most of the time, but seriously I don't want to listen to his music or tacky Calypso 24/7! Lack of lifts (elevators for my US friends!) - if you've been travelling for 5+ hours to get somewhere, it'd be nice if you could use a lift to get to your heavy suitcases up to your 2nd floor room, or at least have your bags delivered for you. Room - small balcony which was fairly unusable due to hot air being blown out from AC unit. AC unit was also way to loud in the room just when you needed it most. Overall, this hotel was ideal for our 5 days on Key West but any longer and I think the negatives would become irksome. Having throughly researched other options, I think that the Inn at Key West is probably the best value for the rate you pay. If you want better, you will have to pay a lot more!

Reviews.Title: “great deal , great pool area”
Reviews.Author: BruceHToronto
Reviews.Content: Grabbed the deal with Expedia and it was worth every penny. The pool area is fantastic. I only saw the lobby once during check-in. After that , we just parked in the back since it was so close to the room. Rooms very quiet and the big screen TV on the wall was a big hit. I think they run a shuttle for old town , but we never used it. Tiki Bar handy for watching the game and having a few pints before turning in. Grat spot , would use it again.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad but it wouldn't be my first choice next time”
Reviews.Author: PrivateJoy13
Reviews.Content: I expected great things from this hotel based on the reviews on this site but it was pretty average and below average in one very important area. We checked in and asked for a room facing the pool and were told that none were available and were given a 1st floor room facing the IHOP next door. We felt a little uneasy being on the first floor of a hotel where someone could easily walk up to and break into our room so we asked to be switched to a 2nd floor room. We were switched quickly and without issue but the internet in the 2nd room didn't work so we they switched us to a room facing the pool that had "miraculously" just opened up (yeah right). Rooms seemed clean enough until I went to the bathroom of our last room which had the remnants of a jumbo roach squashed on the wall next to the shower. I guess the prior guest had killed it and housekeeping didn't think that was their job to get what was left of it off the wall. I also had the pleasure of killing about six baby roaches in the bathroom area during my stay in the first day alone. I was only staying for 2 nights and it was a non-refundable rooom so I just zipped up all my bags before going to sleep and shook out all bags that couldn't completely close before leaving the hotel for good. Good looking hotel with good service but the roach issue would make me hesitate to stay again. I guess I should be thankful I didn't see a bunch of roaches scatter in the morning like a guest did at the Wicket Guesthouse which we were also considering for our stay. It's pretty far away from the action. We're New Yorkers so a little bit of a walk doesn't scare us so when we saw one reviewer say that it was a 30 minute walk to the center of town we were hopeful of doing just that but it's just too damn hot to walk that far. Next time we'll stay somewhere closer and just hope that there will be no roaches to be found.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what I was looking for!”
Reviews.Author: scheerl528
Reviews.Content: I'm from Miami and had a friend visiting from Ohio and we wanted to go to the keys to relax. I wanted a hotel with a great pool and this was it! The poolside tiki bar was wonderful and we spent the entire day poolside..perfect! Rooms were clean and service was great! Not terribly far from Duval Street, but away from it so you can relax and have some space. There's also an IHOP next door, which was a convenient option for breakfast. I will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre at best.”
Reviews.Author: MrsTugDog
Reviews.Content: Inn at Key West was fine. Not great. Not bad. Not special. Not terrible. Just fine. The front desk was a little rude and the concierge was short. The location was a bit too far from the hustle and bustle of Key West. It was about a 35 minute bike ride or a $15 cab fare. I will say that the pool was great (though I think it should stay open later than 10). The rooms were clean (though our mini-fridge didn't work).

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable, friendly place to stay”
Reviews.Author: ForceRugbyfan
Reviews.Content: We were concerned that other reviews had reported that the hotel was far away from the main area of Key West, but did not find it a problem - we had a car, and the drive into town was 5 -10 minutes, and parking easy (it was free at the hotel). The hotel suited our budget, and was clean and newly refurbished. The staff were friendly and very helpful (they accommodated our request for a room change very happily, even though they were pretty full). Advice and information about tours and activities was readily available, and bookings easy. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay, and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “The Inn at Key West is an absolutely awesome place to stay!!”
Reviews.Author: va021508
Reviews.Content: We totally enjoyed our stay at The Inn at Key West. It is an absolutely beautiful hotel. The rooms are very clean, the beds are so comfortable with the down comforters and the large flat screens on the wall makes it easy for everyone's viewing. The pool area is gorgeous with the rock waterfall and the adjacent tiki bar is very nice touch. The restaurant serves wonderful food, with a lot for your money and the service was great. We will definitely stay at The Inn at Key West on our next trip to the Keys.

Reviews.Title: “A relaxing stay”
Reviews.Author: UllanlinnaTraveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a very nice place to stay when visiting Key West. Our room was very nice and clean. The pool area is beautiful and pool is big enough for a good swim. Service at the front desk was nice and very helpful. The breakfast was excellent for the price. The distance from the Key West city centre is an half an hour's walk away or a short taxi ride. At the price we got, this place is absolutely to be recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great pool, good rooms, ok service.”
Reviews.Author: chambersclan
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights on a quick weekend getaway in Septembr of 2008 and ended up getting engaged! We made reservations about a week out as this was kind of a spontaneous trip. We werent informed at time of reservation that the biggest part of the hotel was being renovated. Not a huge deal but this ate up the majority of the rooms that view the water on the opposite side of the pool. We were given what they called an upgrade due to the inconvienence but I suspect they just gave us whatever they had open because it wasnt anything special. The room we ended up with wasnt bad at all. It was very clean and although we had originally wanted one king we got two queens. I know this sounds like a terrible experience so far but while it was an inconvienence a bit everyone was very friendly while handling it and I think they were just a bit handcuffed by what they could offer due to the renovations and lack of available rooms. Maybe I am just a bit more understanding than most. Anyway, the room was very clean and the beds were comfortable and clean as well. We didnt spend much time in the room as Duval was just too inviting. The pool here is spectacular. Great, large pool, with awesome thick and comfortable floats that even hold your drink. The pool redeemed everything else about this place for us. They even have a hot tub back in the cut that is kind of hidden behind some palms and down a sand path. It was nice to be able to escape back here and enjoy some drinks in the evening. For the price we paid to stay here I would say that the value was pretty good compared to other places in the area. I think we did end up getting a discount due to the problems we had which made it even better. We both slept great in the beds. Whether it was due to the beds or the drinks Im not sure but regardless. The lady at the pool bar was a local who had lived in the area for quite some time and had some great "off the beaten path" suggestions. They also had a tv at the pool bar so we could keep an eye on the football scores. I enjoyed the location of the place. It was close enough to Duval to not be a bad drive or taxi ride and far enough away to not be overwhelmed by the cruise people. Also if you are staying here for an extended amount of time there is a Publix and a few other shopping options in the plaza next door about 100 yards away. All in all we had a good time here and would love to give it another shot under full opertaing circumstances. I would reccommend it to anyone with kids because the pool is so good. Hope this is helpful!

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: rxlady
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a good value for the money, the Inn at Key West is the perfect place to stay. People are knocking the fact that it is not in walking distance from Duval Street. My feeling is that you are on vacation to relax, so if you are not on some sort of excursion for the day, why not have a beautiful pool to hang out in all day? Once again, after a relaxing day sipping margaritas by the pool (and having delicious food from the bar), take a taxi to downtown for dinner and nightlife. The rooms are very nice, the staff was very pleasant, and check in/check out was lightening fast. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise, look no further !”
Reviews.Author: jackdanieluk
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel. Rooms modern , clean and roomy. The balcony was a bonus , sitting out in the evening overlooking the Gulf of Mexico with an ice cold Mojito. The pool area was fantastic, very well thought out and beautifully landscaped. The breakfast buffet was great , we tucked into a good range of fresh fruits and tasty pastries. Staff were brilliant , very helpfull and nothing was too much trouble, their smiles were infectious. We found the location good, close to shops and a good choice of local restaurants, just far enough away from the party area of Duval st etc. The Historic seaport area was our favourite spot in Key West ,always something going on. Fort Zachory Beach, the best local beach and Bahia Honda and John Pennekamp a must see along with Big Pine Key. I would recommend the Inn at Key West to everyone. Our week there will be remembered with warmth and can't wait to go back .

Reviews.Title: “Very clean but far from Key West action.”
Reviews.Author: lumoreira
Reviews.Content: Quick check in when we arrived. Hotel lobby, pool and room was very clean. The only downside is that the hotel is a little far from Duval Street and Mallory Square. We drove to the old town and paid $10 to park our car at the Two Friends Patio Restaurant (512 Front Street). You have to go inside to pay the bartender, get the receipt and put on the dashboard of your. We decided to drive because a cab ride from hotel to duval street is $15 each way. Next time we return to Key West we will stay at a hotel closer to town or one that provides shuttles to/ from town. We recommend this hotel if you don't mind driving and looking for parking.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel a few miles from the action of Duval Street”
Reviews.Author: mskoz
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled to The Keys for our 3rd anniversary. We decided to save a few bucks by flying into Miami and driving down to Key West. After arriving in Miami, we drove to Key Largo(about an hour ride) and spent the night at the Holiday Inn to break up the travel time. (We later realized that the drive to Key West wasn't as bad as we expected and would recommend to knock out the drive in one day.) While in Key Largo we stopped at the local liquor store to stock up on liquor.. and to Kmart to get a cheap cooler, beach chairs and plastic cups (we knew drinks in Key West would be pricey and chair rental at Smather's beach was $10/day). While in Key Largo we ate at The Fish House for our first round of Mahi-Mahi (very tasty but overloaded with salsa). Early the next day we checked out and headed to Key West. The 2 hour drive seemed much shorter than it was- before we knew it we were in Key West! The Inn at Key West looks exactly how pictures on TripAdvisor show it-except the poolside view room didn't have much a view. Here is my breakdown of the hotel and Key West in general... Rooms- I'm not sure what the options are for this hotel but we paid for a King Suite Poolside. Our first room was 222. The room itself was a decent size, modern looking with a king bed w/ a down comforter and feather pillows. The bathroom's counter had minimal space but that's nothing to really complain about. The room had a nice flat screen tv on the wall. The balcony, however, was very disappointing. It was a very small balcony that barely fit 2 chairs on it-one of which was in front of the air conditioner so it blasted 100degree heat on you (however, we did see rooms that had larger balconies, so I'm not sure what kind of rooms they were). While our "poolside" room was on the same side as the pool, it overlooked foliage-no pool. The next day we requested a new room, and with no problem, we switched to room 213. This room had the view we were looking for! (although we had the same problem w/ the balcony). From what we saw- many of the "oceanview" rooms had the same type of foliage blocking the balcony so I'm not sure which balconies actually had a view of the water (keep in mind-the oceanview rooms are also facing the parking lot and a busy street). While the water is across the street, it is not a beach, so don't get too excited... Pool- The pool wasn't as big as we expected, but it was still gorgeous. The maintainence crew was out every day either testing the water, cleaning the rocks, or doing other things to keep this area up to par. There were always lounge chairs available, however, there were chair hogs that placed towels on beach chairs for large parties who never seemed to be there. Regardless-whether you wanted sun or shade, you had a place to sit! The hotel offered "poolside service" but we really didn't notice much of this going on (then again, we didn't splurge on the $8 poolside drinks). We did eat at the pool cafe and it was great! I had a bacon burger and my husband had a chicken sandwich that he raved about! mmmm! The downside to the poolside cafe was that it was only open until 3pm. Restaurant- One day we were up early and had breakfast at The Inn. Continental breakfast was $9.99 and Continental with eggs was around $13.99. Overall the meal was fresh and tasty (but expensive). IHOP is located next door-however we didn't really like it there. Staff- We found the staff to be helpful and friendly, even when we requested a room change. Beaches- We have traveled to the Bahamas, Barbados, Antigua and Jamaica and were expecting the beaches in Key West to compare.. they don't. If you are looking to book a "beachy" trip, Key West is not for you. Smather's beach made it on Florida's top 10 beaches as #3, but we were not impressed. It's only about 1/2 mile long and has lots of seaweed and cloudy water. We also visited Higg's Beach and found it to be the same- not the crystal clear blue water you'd expect. We spent most of our days at the pool. Smather's did have chair rentals for $10/day and various water sports available. Duval Street- If you like to party, book the hotel closer to Duval Street! Duval Street is filled with action, bars, shops and restaurants. We went down to Duval for lunch- dress casual- it's hot! .. and there are lots of beach goers nearby so everyone is pretty much in beach attire. Nightlife duval is very packed! Lots of drunk people (which was a little annoying for us). We didn't make it to any bars, but we walked down there on a couple nights and it was definitely an experience. There's a couple "couple friendly" strip clubs and a couple drag shows along the way. Garden of Eden is also on Duval- a clothing optional bar. Dry Tortugas/Fort Jefferson Sunny Days boat tour- we made reservations online and paid the day of the trip ($300 for 2). It was a great tour. It was a 2 hour ride to Fort Jefferson, lunch onboard (sandwiches, potato salad, etc) a tour of the fort and snorkeling (snorkel on the backside of the fort, there weren't many fish in other places- but be careful! We saw 3 baracudas swimming while we were out of the water!) Bring lots of sunblock- we wore SPF 30 (after getting a base tan of 3 days) and still got sun burn! Restaurants- We checked out a couple places while in Key West. We spent about $1300 in food for the week (and that's not eating 3 meals a day, or overdoing it on alcohol) 915 on Duval street was a decent restaurant if you like seafood. It's not good for red meat. I had the special- halibut over clams with roasted potatoes and veggies which was very tasty, but my husband ordered filet mignon. It was served with french fries. After 1 bottle of the cheapest wine we spent over $140. My husband was not happy about eating fries w/ his $100-something dinner. Hog's breath Saloon- we checked out Hog's Breath for lunch. We both had chicken sandwiches w/ fries and 1 drink each- it came to about $50. They had a band playing and the bar was pretty packed. I guess it's good for the experience, but the food wasn't anything to brag about. The Commadore Restaurant- Now this is a restaurant! It's located near Mallory Square right on the harbor. We both had filet mignon (with baked potatoes and veggies), side salad, and a side of asparagus and mushrooms. The bill was high (nearly $200 after a bottle of wine) but it was well worth it! We visited the restaurant at 830p, so the crowds were gone and we had excellent service. We had a great time in Key West, but probably wouldn't go back.. For the same price we could have went to an all-inclusive resort on an island with the white sand and crystal clear water we're used to.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Mhicks_10
Reviews.Content: We came down to Key West to get married on the beach and stayed at the Inn. What a wonderful place for a honeymoon. We were treated so well by the staff. We stayed for 5 days and spent most of our time at the beautiful pool. It was so nice and relaxing. If you just want to relax and avoid all the hoopla from down town, it is a wonderful place to do so. Like your own little world out at the pool and tiki bar. The staff at the pool and tiki bar were just great to us. We felt like we were friends by the time we left and will come back to visit again. Also all the people staying there were there to just relax and were all very friendly no matter where they came from. We met a lot of nice folks. Thank you for the friendly service.

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal Great price Great Staff..”
Reviews.Author: Keywest24
Reviews.Content: If your looking to get a great deal and a very nice staff then you want to stay here. The hotel is very clean and we have been arriving to this hotel 2-3 years now. Seems like every time we go the service gets better. The pool is huge and very well kept. I also love the landscape. We did a graden view room 1st foor and it was amazing. $165-$200 was the price we paid for a room a night and it was well worth it. After going out around town I asked the front desk if it would be cool if my wife and I took a quick dip in the pool and were extremely quite about it. He didnt mind and we were very respectful and didn't seem to be a problem! I can't wait to go again.. oh ya and the bar tender there is a cool dude!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for relaxation in Key west”
Reviews.Author: icerider82
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel as part of our honeymoon and thought it was realy great. The setting is super with the white balcony's and palm trees. The reception looks great and we were pleased they had a free PC for customers. The pool is also great. This is a hotel which we realy recommend to people we know who would go to key west.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff, pool, brunch and concierge.”
Reviews.Author: Gucci97
Reviews.Content: This hotel is away from Duvall Street, so it's much quieter. The guests were very respectful of each other, including the children. The Tiki Bar by the pool was excellent with frozen drinks and multiple TVs with sporting events. The pool is large and beautiful with a waterfall. Very cozy jacuzzi. The Sunday brunch was delicious and the service outstanding. We worked with the conceirge for numerous outings (jet skiing tour, bi-plan ride, parasailing). He booked everything for us a coordinated rides to and from the hotel. He also advised us to get dropped off at Duvall Street afterwards, so we could avoid the cab ride into town. The only downside is the hotel is not in walking distance to Duvall Street and all the hot spots and driving down is not the best option with limited parking. Cabs ran about $15 dollars one way. The rooms were spacious, clean and very nice with private balconey's. This was our 2nd stay at this hotel and plan to keep coming back!

Reviews.Title: “Secondary location doesn't really matter”
Reviews.Author: Windfeld-C
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews on Tripadvisor and looked at the hotel's website prior to deciding to stay here. It looked almost too good to be true. After all, this was Key West, how good could it be? In fact it lived up to all my expectations and went beyond. No question about it. The room, the pool area, the staff.... Everything was perfect. They'd even fixed the weather for us :) I wish we could have stayed longer, but we had to head on North. For my third time back to Key West I will most definitely look to go back to the Inn at Key West. It is a very good family resort â€“ the pool area is a tropic paradise with a large pool with a shallow end for the kids and a not as shallow other end with a small waterfall. I enjoyed the hotel. I'm sure all other guests will, too. If not I'm pretty sure you are having a really bad day. The location on North Roosevelt Blvd is not the best, but Duval is just a short drive away.

Reviews.Title: “The best vacation I've ever had! Thank you Inn at Key West!”
Reviews.Author: KristinesShower
Reviews.Content: You know, I can't say enough good things about this hotel! My husband and I decided to take a nice long vacation to get away from it all and reconnect with each other. After many places we could have gone, we decided on Key West because of the beauty, history and just overall fun of it! I did alot of research on this website to see which place was for us. We have been together for 12 years and really wanted to be able to hang out by ourselves if we wanted to and a bed and breakfast was just not for us, but I didn't want to get stuck in a hotel for 9 days if I hated it too! After much deliberation and research (I use this term to its FULL capacity lol), we decided we wanted to stay here. The kid in me couldn't wait to dive in that pool and face it, the plants, palm trees and having the Gulf of Mexico just across the street just makes it an oasis! To my surprise, when I went to book the room - it was actually about $50 cheaper PER night! I was thrilled - we had an extra $500.00 to spend when we went on vacation (that we really needed lol) I do have to mention that once you make your reservation, they DO NOT charge it! That really threw me off when we went to check out and they needed our money! The room itself was beautiful - we got two double beds, huge flat screen tv, desk and chair, dresser with DVD player, refridgerator, coffee machine, hair dryer, safe, iron and the bathroom had a tub/shower combination. Two towels apiece (bath, hand and washcloth) and even though they have a sign for participating in the water reserving program, they changed our towels every day and cleaned our room spotless around noon or 1pm. The bed covers were great - nice clean white sheet, feather comforter(!), and a sheet over the comforter. I know this is weird information, but I've never been to a hotel that had such comfortable sheets and comforters! It wasn't like a hotel bed at all - more like my bed at home! We loved it - big pillows ranging from soft to firm and since we had two beds, we had tons of pillows! We had a nice A/C unit that kept our room super comfy - but it was a little loud. Honestly nothing I would complain about though - every AC makes a little noise and I found it relaxing when we would drift to sleep. The outside is just a beautiful place to be! Around all the rooms and the pool, there is just this quaint cobblestone paths that you can see a few lizards hop about here and there - not to mention the lush greenery! If you are big on plants and greenery, this is your hotel! It's not only surrounding the pool, but the cafe and the parking lot too! I loved that aspect about the parking the most. It really was nice and secure - made you feel like you were very safe and in a tropical paradise! The pool is as amazing as it looks - actually way better. It is heated, has a waterfall, steps, free pool floats - geez, we spent about every day (and night!) in the pool! The best part was it never seemed to close either - no matter what time we wanted to swim, it was always open if someone was out and about! The jacuzzi was nice and warm too - back behind the greenery, like another world! Nice tiki bar and the bartenders were very nice and really told you about Key West and what to do while you were there. The blended drinks were great (and strong!) and the best part for me was they let me watch my Cubbies play on the big screens they had in the tiki bar. (they have four total!) Happy hour was always a hit and can you believe they have pool side service! Yep, that's right - pull up your lay out chair and Mike will come and take your order! We didn't do much but drink - so I can't compliment on the food, but I did look and see that the portions were HUGE for the $$$ By the way, the fitness room really is great and I really wanted to go there every day, but from all the walking and swimming - I never did get to work out! We stepped in to see it - really a nice place if you can stick to your exercise regimen! I also wanted to fill you in on having the Gulf across the street. It is beautiful to look at, but please note - there is NO BEACH, only pavement to walk up and down (which is a great morning/evening walk!) if you can get across US1. This highway is really busy, so if you don't like road noise, request to be by the pool. (PS - awesome beach just down the street - about 3 minute drive) You know I did see alot of posts about how "far" this hotel was away from Duval. Seriously, after the second night of partying on that street I was ready for a vacation away from my vacation! This hotel is far away from town, but not so far that you can't get there - the whole island is only 2 miles by 4 miles lol And it is kinda nice to get away from all the hustle and bustle (not to mention the drunks and music!) We rented a car when we landed in Ft Lauderdale and drove through the entire Keys - something I would recommend if you don't mind driving and taking in the sites. By doing this, we had the car the whole time and the drive for us (from the hotel) was about 5 minutes away from Old Town. There is also a bus that runs daily and the cost is super cheap (like $2)! If you have any questions, or you want to do stuff while you're there in Key West, just ask the concierge! Yep, they have one that just sits there all day telling you what you can do and how much it costs! I loved this part of the experience because Millie really knew what was fun to do and we got discounts from the hotel! The staff was very accomidating and really worked hard. All the people I had direct contact with were always nice and had a smile on their faces. They did have to work on the parking lot while we were there, so we were asked to move our car to another lot. Not a big deal at all in my opinion - we had to walk maybe 10 more steps! I have tons of pictures because I really wanted to let you know the awesome experience I had here, so maybe if you are looking for a hotel you will give the Inn a try! We stayed in room 133 poolside which was on the bottom floor, so we neither had a balcony or a porch like some of the other rooms, but our room was a stone's throw from the pool and that is something I loved waking up to every morning! We had internet access in the room, but didn't bring our laptop. We would go into the lobby and do our emails there nightly. I'm not sure if it was just our room, but our phones had a hard time. I could rarely make a phone call from my cell phone in our room and I have AT&T as a provider. If you just feel like pizza or some fast food - this hotel is very close to that as well - not to mention a movie theater and bank right next door. This was the best hotel for our vacation - truly a vacation I will remember because of staying here! Here are some other things I think that are worth mentioning (to me anyway!) - They have washer and dryers so if you are there for awhile you can wash your clothes - The pop machines are expensive $2 per bottle. Better off going next door to gas station - The cafe is only open til 3pm or so - The bathrooms are really updated and clean! - There are lizards playing about, but nothing to get riled up over. I literally only saw maybe 5 of them the whole time I was there (9 nights) and most of the time we saw them when we were in the parking lot. - The hotel has a little room with candy bars, soda, sandwiches, medicine, hats, etc. I didn't see this until our last day and believe me - I would have loved to know that when I wanted that candy bar the second night lol - There is always someone at the front desk - even super late! - There is a fresh water shower and roomy bathroom right next to the pool I 100% recommend this hotel and can't wait to go back again!

Reviews.Title: “nice pool”
Reviews.Author: putchka63
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel. There was a mix up at check in, and staff was not accomodating to what was agreed to on the internet reservation (room for 5). The room was small, but nicely decorated with big furniture that was difficult to get around. The pull out bed was in the way of getting to the balcony door. To be out on the balcony, you had to close the door, which cut off all air to the room and there was no AC. This made for a very cramped, hot place to be. Some of the staff was less than friendly. When we got there, we asked the bartender for "things to do." She said it was late and she was to tired to tell us and to ask some of the remaining guests at the bar! The pool area is beautiful, but next time I will stay somewhere closer to Duval Street.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Stay Ever”
Reviews.Author: 7Elway
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel, we had originally booked our vacation for Feb., but due to business we had to postpone it until April. The Hotel exceeded our expectations in every way. We had never been to Key West before, but after going we would not stay anywhere else. This hotel is not right on Duvall street, but personally we wanted to be able to have it a little quieter where we slept. And we enjoy finding our way around places. The staff was very friendly and ensured that we were happy. I agree with the other reviews the hotel pool was beautiful and large. It has many palm trees throughout the grounds to enhance the beauty. Thank you again to the entire staff of the Inn At Key West for a great trip. We will see you again. Kay Lynne

Reviews.Title: “Wow! What a nice supprise.”
Reviews.Author: mickeywhitson
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have wanted to travel to Key West for some time, and now was finally the time. I began to investigate hotels on the island and soon became quite overwhelmed. I usually go for the chains that I know, but the ratings and reviews I read for those were very expensive or not very flattering to say the least. As I looked, the Inn at Key West kept coming up rated at least in the top 10 of "ALL" the hotels on the island. I checked and read everything I could find on their website to make sure I was doing the best thing for my family. Finally, in January I booked an early bird type deal and saved a few bucks. About a week before we were to arrive I got an email from the hotel asking if I would like to upgrade to the "Generous King" for an additional $30 a night which I agreed to. I am brilliant!! What a beautiful, huge hotel room. The furnishings were exquisite and service we received from the staff and service people was more than anything I could ask for. The pool is beautiful and the Tiki bar fits perfectly in this surrounding. If you are interested in enjoying Key West and enjoying outstanding hospitality book you reservations today, you will not regret it. Mickey

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: Tamale1
Reviews.Content: Went to Key West for our 25th wedding anniversary. Stayed at the Inn for 5 days and enjoyed every minute of it. The staff,rooms,pool,and food are all wonderful! Mille even scheduled a couples massage for my husband and I and it was awesome! They set it up by the pool. By the way, the pool is just beautiful! The prettiest we saw in all of the island :) . The food at the cafe is yummy! The breakfast is delicious (try the French toast ) and lunch items are all good too! My favorite place was the tiki bar! Brenda the bartender is just awesome and a joy to get to know! She makes the best rum punch! Any questions about the island ... She can answer! We are going back in September and I cannot wait!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A very friendly and relaxing place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: adrian55
Reviews.Content: Our first trip to Key West and we took in a lot of the sights and we really enjoyed coming back to our hotel to relax and enjoy the pool.The staff was really friendly and our room was always clean.We are looking forward to staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “medium quality/price ratio”
Reviews.Author: skripta
Reviews.Content: positive points: nice furniture (to American taste but still), excellent king, spacious bathroom with walk-in shower, amenities, very nice pool, coin laundry (bring rolls, reception never has change!), free wifi,flat TV, safe negative points: standard rooms have view on parking lot (though behind some palm trees) on a high traffic road (noisy despite double panelled windows), noisy AC, corteous but not particularly friendly staff Location: far from center (but bikes/moped rentals just next door and fun to use), close to mall (Publix, theatre, numerous shops) and a very nice Outback restaurant (great for meats and cheap for the budget), close to IHOP for breakfast and Denny's will try the Sheraton on south Roosevelet next time or why not one of these lovely guest houses in the Center, though parking is not very easy

Reviews.Title: “A very nice experience.”
Reviews.Author: schoonerwharf
Reviews.Content: My wife found this hotel online & was attracted to it because they boasted the largest pool in the keys. We usuually stay on Duval Street but decided to try something a bit different for this trip & we were very happy we did. The pool was indeed large (and beautiful), the food at the poolside bar was very good, the poolside cafe was beautiful, with a great breakfast buffet (or a la carte items if you wish), the rooms & our private terrace were very nice & the staff were very friendly. It's a 10-minute scooter ride to duval street (you gotta rent a scooter when you're in key west!). I would most definitely stay there again & highly recommend the Inn at Key West to anyone considering staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant and Affordable”
Reviews.Author: BackstreetsBack
Reviews.Content: This hotel was tastefully decorated, and cozy. For the price we paid, we got a lot out of it: 40 inch flatscreen, free internet, and access to the beautiful freshwater pool to name a few. The lobby is exquisite. When we first drove up at 3AM looking for a place to lodge, we thought this inn would have cost an arm and a leg but we were pleasantly surprised and immediately booked 3 nights. The whole town was quiet at this hour and a few hotels including the Marriott had closed doors, so the Inn welcomed us with open arms and I am truly happy that we happened upon it. My only complaint is the darn chickens!!! Though no fault of the hotel's, these freaking free range chickens of Key West woke me up every day at 4AM! I am an insomniac and don't always fall asleep that easily so I was often aggravated by their rowdiness. Thank goodness for the sun-proof curtains that gave me a couple extra hours of shut-eye after the chickens decided to shut up lol. One complaint though. Our room was situated directly beside the supply room where the staff meet every morning. They were VERY loud and had full conversations, waking me up and ensuring that I didn't fall back asleep. I understand work should be enjoyable for all, but I think management needs to keep a close eye on the staff because it sounds like they're having a party there. It was very annoying.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous pool. Nice rooms. Great bathrooms.”
Reviews.Author: Sonja_W4
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights over spring break. Very nice rooms and hotel. One of the prettiest pools I have ever seen. Had breakfast one morning. Nice buffet. $13.95. Had a late lunch at the pool bar. Food was decent. Our room faced the ocean. Was typical hotel room layout. Bathroom is very clean and has upscale tile and fixtures. It is located on a very busy street and is not in town. We had a car and got tired of driving into town and back and trying to find parking. If we come to Key West again, we will try to stay in town. But The Inn at Key West was nice because all 4 of us could fit in one room comfortably and the kids loved the pool. There is an IHOP next door. Down the street (walking distance) there is a grocery store and a Wendy's and a Subway and a movie theatre. The concierge service (Bob and Millie) were very nice and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: onesunset
Reviews.Content: Great hotel! Check in was very easy, rooms were nice, clean and well decorated. They have a great pool and bar & grill by the pool. All the staff was very friendly. The only thing i wish about this hotel would be that it was closer to Duval Street. Its not too far but you need to take a cab. Over all a great place to day!

Reviews.Title: “OASIS in Key West!!”
Reviews.Author: DannyMarmol
Reviews.Content: The room was great...love the beds, the Bathroom very nice, the Pool was beautiful, live music "Awsome" Great food at the Restaurant....Over all A+....everybody should stay here!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel! Good service for the right price. Some rooms noisy though.”
Reviews.Author: kristinmbarr
Reviews.Content: Love this hotel. Go back every time we go to Key West. Largest pool in Key West. Great poolside service. A paradise!!! Main building rooms are amazing. Side buiding can be noisy. You hear other visitors yelling & the clinking of rolling bags.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to rest in Key West!”
Reviews.Author: travelbugIowa
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed four nights at the Inn at Key West and had a nice stay. We arrived early in the afternoon, so we went to the pool bar and had lunch and some beverages until our room was ready. When you book, if you want a nice balcony or patio you may want to pay the extra and ask for the pool side rooms. The rooms on the street or "bay" side have very little patios and balconies. We had a room on first floor with a patio towards the pool and it was very nice. If what you see out the window is no big deal then book the regular rooms which may look into the parking lot. The beds were really comfortable and the room was clean. I never heard noise in the hallway or from the neighbors through the walls. Yes, I did see a couple ants by the bathroom sink, but in that warm climate it was not a shock. Guess what, I get them in my house sometimes too! The pool area is wonderful and they also offer drink service from your lounge chair. There were a few "spring breakers" around the pool and they were actually pretty tame. Maybe they were recooperating from the night before? Anyway, the food from the bar service was decent and the drinks were made by friendly bartenders. You are a ways from Duval Street, but we knew that when we booked. It is about a fifteen to twenty dollar taxi ride one way including tip. We actually walked downtown one morning and it is about a two mile walk. Bike rental is available also. I have to say the only problem we had was with the high speed internet, but I did not pursue the problem to hard since I was just looking at email. There are two computers available in the lobby, so I just used one of them. I hope this helps make your decision. Make sure to go to the forum for more info. I do recommend the Seven Fish restaraunt along with the Commodore.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place to stay”
Reviews.Author: kdmartin308
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went down to Key West for our anniversary and stayed at The Inn at Key West. After reading many MANY reviews on this hotel and others, I opted for The Inn at Key West. Best decision made. The hotel is very clean, the price is very reasonable and the staff is extremely helpful and knowledgeable. Now about the room- very nice and clean. Our view off the balcony was of the gulf and it was a beautiful sight. The coffee pot needed to be cleaned. When I made a pot of coffee, it tasted very bad. However, it is a regular 4 cup coffee pot, not one of those one cup pod holders. There is a small frig in the room which is perfect for holding drinks, etc. The bathroom is very clean, modern and stylish. The bed was very comfortable. We are planning another trip to Key West in May and will be staying here again. The only suggestion I would make is take a cab to the famous Duval St., The parking is very limited and the hotel is about 2 miles away. Other than the coffee pot, I (we) have no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Nice quiet place for the money”
Reviews.Author: tbirdhs
Reviews.Content: A few miles from Duval st, but we had a car and wanted a quieter area to stay. The rooms we had in the back were quiet, clean and keeped updated. The pool area looked great, but the air was to chilly that week for us to use it.

Reviews.Title: “They have a rooster??”
Reviews.Author: alex1012hearts
Reviews.Content: This place is an upscale motel. You have to keep your drapes closed from all the people walking by. The walls are quite thin, you can hear babies crying and people talking in the next room. The bedding and furniture is very nice. Bathroom - good. The place was fairly clean apart from the hair behind the toilet. There is no wireless internet, you have to sit at a desk. We were originally planning to stay here for 2 nights. Never having been to Key West before we quickly figured out that it wasn't our scene. We went out for my birthday and came back to the room fairly tired and intoxicated. I crashed at 2am and was awakened by a rooster at 5am. Starting 5 am he screamed the entire morning. We decided to check out early based on the noise and the fact that we really didn't want to hang around Key West for another day. It was windy and raining and there wasn't much to do. The front desk was very helpful and we got a refund for the second night no problem. They would have moved us to a quieter room with no rooster, but we wanted to leave anyway. We didn't have breakfast here and didn't use the pool, because it was too cold. The pool looked great though. Overall, I would recommend this place, just ask them for a quiter room, away from the rooster. They will know what you mean.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Key West Atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: sailboatgirl
Reviews.Content: The room was beautiful. The bath was very pretty with one of those big rain type shower heads and a rice screen window effect. The location is a bit far away from the action but by the second evening we began to appreciate that fact. The historic area of Key West is full of action and very noisey at night until the wee hours. Ask to stay on the pool side away from the highway. Our only problem with sleeping was when some fellow guests came home rowdy at 2:00am and woke us up(not the hotel's fault). We had a car, so it was no problem to get around. If you don't have a car I suggest renting a scooter. The weather was too cold to do that but it looks like a lot of fun.

Reviews.Title: “I loved this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: ILuvSummer64
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel purely by trip advisor recommendation and the Inn's website. We arrived in Key West by air, and we were in our room within 20 minutes! The front desk service was wonderful, and Millie at the concierge desk gave great advice on where to go and what to do in Key West . The pictures are very accurate, and the hotel was clean. The hotel is away from downtown, but rent a scooter and zip around like the locals! P.S. The pool is awesome!

Reviews.Title: “Located on a highway and too far from town.”
Reviews.Author: adventurevacation
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located on a highway and is not within walking distance from town. Your room will overlook a parking lot, a four lane highway, or an IHOP. The area is surrounded by strip malls and urban sprawl. The facility itself is nice, clean and comfortable. But, the location was simply unacceptable (especially for the price), so we cancelled our remaining nights and booked a hotel closer to town.

Reviews.Title: “Great value - Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: roaminggeorge
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at The Inn at Key West, and I found it to be an excellent hotel. I was actually late checking in, because I was stuck on the overseas highway due to a really bad traffic accident. I called the hotel to let them know I needed a late check-in. The frond desk clerk was nice enough to tell me she would happily cancel my room at no charge if I couldn't make it. That was a very nice offer, although I told her that I'm still on my way. The room was very clean and the bathrrom was huge. I also like the seperate outdoor entrance to my room (I didn't have to walk though a common corridor). The price was excellent for Key West, especially for what you're getting. I'd definitly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A clean, comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: buccasmom
Reviews.Content: We found the Inn on line and took a chance. The price was more reasonable than some of the other larger hotels downtown and we knew we'd have a rental car. The main lobby is warm and inviting. Bob at the conceirge desk was friendly and honest. His remarks were on the mark. Hotel staff were nice as well. Our room was nicely furnished and clean. Bed was very comfortable, nice soft lighting, small private patio, very nice flat screen TV. No major complaints with housekeeping although once we were left with no extra toilet paper when it was clearly running low :( and they "forgot" our request for an additional shower towel. We'd definitely go back. One major recommendation: I'd love to see a shuttle service available because finding/paying for parking in Old Town can be a nuisance. Parking cost us $10-$20 per day and some places don't let you come and go -- if you leave you have to pay again!

Reviews.Title: “Great pool”
Reviews.Author: ajnoone
Reviews.Content: After a reservation hic-cup , i enjoyed the hotel, if housekeeping was a little lax. One great bartender, kt , i think and one really poor one at the tiki bar. Great pool

Reviews.Title: “very nice and quite”
Reviews.Author: vacationfrenzy
Reviews.Content: I must say that this hotel lived up to everything we were hoping for. Location was away from the rat race downtown but just a short drive in. The only thing we woud have liked to see was a shuttle that ran on a schedule every hour or so to drop guests off. We did have a car and had no problem parking at the hotel. As far as in town, we parked every time on simonton street for 10 bucks all day. We did use meters one night which is a rip off. .25 cents for 10 minutes. We did not have the best of weather but the pool area was really pretty and very clean. Rooms are spacious and comfy except for the balcony was too small. I would stay here again my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: snowybelle
Reviews.Content: The Inn was great for us. The only negative is the distance to the "Old Town" area and having to park. With great concierge service from Bob, we found the parking ramps and understood the on street system. At first was concerned about being right on Hwy 1 but we did not hear any road noise. Facility was impeccably clean, and comfortable. TV had sound issues for some unknown reason. Pool area is lovely but unlike some hotels in the area, it is not heated. Food service is expensive for what was offered. We elected to eat out.

Reviews.Title: “"Great pool & pleasant surroundings"”
Reviews.Author: TropicalNj
Reviews.Content: We loved the pool area. Had lots of shade for my husband who tries not to get too much sun. They had a waiter who came right to your chair to take your drink & food order. They had music playing around the pool which we enjoyed. Our room was decorated very nicely with flat screen TV which was great to watch the Super Bowl! Free internet access was a plus for us. Not close to Duval St. had to take taxi back & forth.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place!”
Reviews.Author: csrikanth1
Reviews.Content: This is a must stay place in Key West. Great hotel, rooms, people and views. It is expensive though! If money is not a constraint, then you should try this....BTW, one night in Feb cost about 350$ :) (really expensive)

Reviews.Title: “Do NOT say here! MUST READ!”
Reviews.Author: cnapier
Reviews.Content: This was the worst experience with a hotel I have ever had traveling. My wife and I booked this place to spend our HONEYMOON. When we arrived we checked in only to find that we were given a room with 2 queen beds when we had booked a King size room. I immediately went to tell them of their mistake only to be told that they had no king rooms for us, it was OUR mistake. After arguing with them for a bit I told them that I would find another hotel. I wasn't about to stay there after how they treated us. I went to the Marriott and they took great care of us (I highly recommend). I went back and they charged my credit card for one night even though I checked in and checked right out. I disputed it with the credit card company and lost. I called the hotel multiple times only to not have one call returned. If you want bad service, poor accommodations, and mean people out to rip you off, this is the place.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury”
Reviews.Author: Martin_Kristian
Reviews.Content: Really nice place! Stayed there for a single night from friday to saturday. Quick check-in, rooms where big and had all the toiletries we needed. Rooms where clean, and there was free internet. The pool area was huge, nicely chilled water, and there was also a hot tub (which i didnt use since it was +40 degress) :) Drinks served at the pool where very tasteful, they really know how to make a pina colada down there! Overall, great stay, breakfast was fantastic (a bit pricey, but you really get what you pay for) 5*

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: brookerbrookman
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a smaller hotel with all the amenities, this is the one! We stayed with 2 children under the age of 5 and had a wonderful time! The pool is fabulous and the rooms are all updated and beautiful!! Very clean, quite, safe, and the staff was wonderful. If you are looking for something close to Duval street, this is not it. We had a rental car so we had no problem driving downtown. Parking is expensive so be prepaired. There is a desk in the lobby to book all your trips once you arrive. No need to leave the hotel searching for fishing, glass bottom boats, bikes, etc. I would definately stay at this hotel again, best one I have staying in for quite awhile and I have stayed in many hotels in the last 3 years!

Reviews.Title: “Worth considering for a stay in Key West”
Reviews.Author: Rags2006
Reviews.Content: This is a long review, so I'll begin by summarizing: The Inn at Key West is a clean, attractive motel in a location that will please some but is too far from Old Town for others, and which has some annoying flaws; overall we would be likely to return and recommend it to others, but in many locations outside of the Florida Keys, it would earn an "average" rating; in Key West it rates better than average. -Service is a minor problem; while the front desk staff are generally pleasant and helpful, housekeeping is inconsistent. Replenishment of supplies and towels was inconsistent. (No bath mat one day, bath soap not replenished when down to a sliver, one waste basket emptied, but another, with an orange peel and other garbage, left untouched. The carafe for the in-room coffee maker was missing when we arrived; maintainence only brought a replacement after three calls to the front desk. No spare toilet roll supplied. Ice bucket not cleaned.) -While our room (234) was an attractive blend of modern with period touches, to some extent form won out over function. (In the attractive closet unit, which provides good shelf space, the hanging rod is too low to accommodate slacks on a pants hanger. The room had a clean, modern look in part maintained by concealing the coffee maker and small refrigerator inside cabinetry; unfortunately this makes the coffee maker difficult to use, and the unvented cabinet causes the refrigerator run hot. Notes left to housekeepers requesting the refrigerator cabinet door be left open were ignored . The attractive coffee table in front of the sofa has an upholstered surface, making it useless for coffee or drinks. The bathroom has a clean, modern look, with attractive marble tiled floor and tub surround, but no hand rails in the tub/shower. The bathroom is lit with one bulb; when the bulb fails, the room will be pitch-black. Light fixtures are attractive, but lighting is uneven, with little illumination over the refrigerator and coffee-maker.) -No index to guest services or operating instructions are provided. -This two-story facility has no elevators. -Because the property is not associated with a chain, there are few discounts from the rack rate available, and no "points" are earned for future stays or upgrades; these can be significant at chain-affilated properties. -Limited meal service and no room service. -At this level most properties (Hampton Inn, Holiday Inn Express, Hilton Garden Inn,) today include all-day lobby coffee service and in-room microwaves; The Inn has neither. This property has some pluses that should be mentioned. +Towels and linens are equal to, if not better than, a well-run mid-range motor hotel. +The room contains a very large, good-quality wall-mounted flat-screen TV, well-placed for watching from bed or sofa. +The bed and mattress are very comfortable. +Our room was very quiet; despite the pool and traffic outside, little or no noise penetrated. +Unlike several near-by establishments, parking is free. (One nearby property charges $17/day for parking!) +The free broadband internet, wired in-room, wireless in pool and lobby areas, was fast and worked consistently well. While I would recommend this property to friends, I would also recommend they consider spending more to stay at a bed-and-breakfast or small hotel in Old Town, especially if this were their first visit to Key West..

Reviews.Title: “Well-appointed and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: laudy13
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at the Inn at Key West and were very pleased we did. It is about 2 miles from Old Town -- far enough out to be peaceful, but close enough to enjoy all the activity in the town. Our room was in the main building over reception, with a view of the pool. Not at all noisy (perhaps because the clientele is on the older side), very comfortable room. Only drawback is the hotel doesn't have a proper restaurant -- you can only get food until 3pm from the cafe, and the bar doesn't serve coffee. But there are other places within a few minutes walk, so that isn't a great problem. The pool is beautiful and the bar staff very friendly. Perfect place to chill after a day hitting the tourist sites. Very few families seem to find this place, but maybe that is just Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful - clean - comfortable - affordable”
Reviews.Author: Businessadvisor
Reviews.Content: We booked this place online without any referrals or knowledge before hand and we were extremely impressed. Relax by the pool with bar service or try out the hot tub we enjoyed both. Met some great people and had a wonderful vacation. Close to the main area for shopping but need to take a cab or drive not walkable. We will return Best value in the Keys!

Reviews.Title: “Great place and value”
Reviews.Author: FLAboundNj
Reviews.Content: Wonderful quiet place away from the the revelry of down town Key West. Need car to down town but parking is cheap and plentiful in public lots, compared to taxi back and forth. Ask about Trolly Tour. Can get on and off all day at different predermined locations throughout town. Great value ! Pool side very nice with excellent hot tub. Will definately return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great pool, good value, bit odd location”
Reviews.Author: FlyingFinn1973
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife stayed here for 4 nights in Mid December. The location is a bit odd, some 10 minutes by car off the city center. But parking is available free of charge and everyone arrives in a car so its not that difficult to get around. We actually took the car each night down to the city centre and had no problems finding parking there either. The front office is very welcoming, the rooms are clean and fresh and the pool is awesome. Breakfast is ok at the small cafe at the hotel, nothing special but a conveniant start. The concierge is a very nice lady, she helped us with great advice on deep sea fishing and other stuff. We would definitely go back to the Keys and The Inn!

Reviews.Title: “Great place, great rate”
Reviews.Author: TravelingDK
Reviews.Content: We took an overnight side trip to Key West between Christmas and New Years. The city was jam packed, but the hotel was a haven. easy parking, great room, comfortable beds, great rate. All in all, very comfortable. Traveling with a 16 year old, the pool was a hit. Would definitly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CristinaRiodeJaneiro
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights in December, and we really liked. The rooms are spacious, especially clean, chic and well designed. The beds were confortable, we booked two double beds. The staff was attentive and friendly. It wasnÂ´t situated in the downtown, but has a restaurant Outback in a distance walking. The pool area was nice. We would definately come back and recomended this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful pool”
Reviews.Author: CONKLO
Reviews.Content: Hotel is a few miles from Duval St but rooms were beautifully decorated and had large bathrooms. Although felt they could have provided more than a small bottle of Pert shampoo. Water pressure in shower was horrible, but bathroom was very clean. The pool area was gorgeous! Nice waterfall and lots of palms to give you the feeling you were in the tropics. Poolside bar was nice and server was prompt and readily available.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, clean ,comfortable nice staff!”
Reviews.Author: chicago1954
Reviews.Content: I was very comfortable at this hotel and would definately come back!

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Classy - great finishes and great service - good food too!”
Reviews.Author: IslandCowboy
Reviews.Content: The Inn was a great surprise - it is much nicer than 90% of all the hotels in the Keys - great finishes - clean and good quality. Great price for the accomodations! I recommend this hotel BIG TIME!!

Reviews.Title: “A very nice hotel - would return!”
Reviews.Author: BossFan1
Reviews.Content: Booked the hotel on line based on the reviews.and we were not disappointed. The check in staff was friendly and our room was available at check in time. The first room we had was close to the laundry room and a little bit too noisy for our taste. We requested a change and were moved without a hassle. The rooms are nicely appointed and clean. The flat screen tv is a nice touch. The pool is also very nice. The hotel is away from Duval Street so you will need a car or take public transportation to the hot spots on Duval and surrounding areas. However, the trade off is the hotel is a quiet place to come back to after a day of sight seeing. Overall a very pleasant stay and we would return.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel at a great price”
Reviews.Author: flukeness
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough good things about The Inn at Key West. The price was right, the room was beautiful, truly. Modern, tasteful decor, ceramic tile in the bathroom, big flat screen LCD tv, very clean. Very comfortable beds. The grounds are beautiful, the pool is amazing, especially at night when accent lights turn the lush landscaping into a scene straight from heaven. I have read some reviews that complain about the exterior of the hotel being ugly or old looking, but I did not find that to be the case at all. It was at least as nice as other high-end hotels on the island, better in some cases. The staff we interacted with were helpful, friendly and professional. The only complaints are that we couldn't work out how to open the safe, and the front desk didn't answer the first time I called. Then I forgot about it, since we found another way to secure our valuables. And the knob on the front door that the latch goes over was broken, again not a big deal. The roosters also woke us up at 4am each morning, but that's an issue for the whole island, not just the hotel. The location is quite a way from Duval St, but still close enough that we were able to ride our bicycles everywhere we wanted to go. There is a Publix grocery store (handy for grabbing an inexpensive breakfast and lunch) and a K-mart nearby (handy for purchasing a bicycle lock, which we forgot to bring). There is an IHOP right next door, and an Outback nearby. Overall, very satisfied and impressed. Will definitely be going back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Much better than Marriot”
Reviews.Author: LoveSouth
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights in December. The front desk was extremely helpful and upgraded us to a King size bed. The rooms are exceptionally clean and spacious. We had a few problems with some small ants in our room during the second night, but the hotel staff was profressional and looked after it right away. The highlight of the hotel is the pool. It does boast of being the biggest in Key West and indeed it is. Although, I do appreciate the plantation environment around, I would have hoped for a little less shade and more sunshine around the pool. The hotel is located 3 miles north of Duval Street but my wife and I were very comfortable renting bikes around and even biking at night after dinners etc. I have stayed at the Marriot Oceanside before and it's a great place to stay as well but three times the price of the Inn. Would stay at the Inn again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, excellent price, friendly staff, clean A++”
Reviews.Author: awidlak
Reviews.Content: I had never been to Key West before and felt it absolutely necessary to get away from my situation in Detroit Michigan (in December). After looking at many hotels online, I finally decided to book the Inn. Needless to say the pictures are what you get! The rooms were clean, huge TV, comfortable bed, fridge, coffee, safe etc! The highlight though is the pool area. It is huge, the landscaping is beautiful, and the tiki bar was great. The prices were fair and all of the bartenders were phenominal: fun, knowledgable, fast, and poured a nice drink. For the price this place blew my expectations out of the water and I would go there again. Lastly one thing worth mentioning is that the Inn is located a few miles from downtown. While it is quiet, it does require a car, taxi, bike or scooter to get to where the action was. While traveling alone I found it very easy to meet people to drive me to Duval and grab a taxi on the way back. It by no means was a deal breaker and I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise in Paradise”
Reviews.Author: Actionjacksn02
Reviews.Content: The Inn at Key West was one of the best memories of our trip. Gorgeous landscaping creates a relaxing atmosphere. The pool is huge and very well kept with dry towels and a tiki bar poolside. The room was beautiful with a huge flat screen TV and an extremely comfortable bed. On top of everything, the staff was always friendly and ready to help. I will stay here during my next visit to Key West and will recommend it to anyone even thinking about planning a trip there. Thank you for a relaxing and enjoyable stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Don't Be Shy,Give 'Em A Try!!”
Reviews.Author: curlgirllaurie
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the epitomy of class and laid-back Key West distinction. I was so very impressed with every aspect of our stay. beautiful and elegant design in rooms and property. I can not wait to return! I could totally ingratiate myself way too much here! Are we there yet?????? C-Ya Soon ! keerdygrl.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant place to stay, nice pool”
Reviews.Author: NNL1
Reviews.Content: It is nice and clean, nice pool, don't take room facing the front parking lot that they call "Gulf view" or you'll be staring at car headlights and the lot. A few miles away from the city center

Reviews.Title: “Great Price... great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CoorsgirlVirginia
Reviews.Content: We had a great time.. very nice hotel .. my boyfriend loved the overhead shower...staff was very friendly and nice... Little drive to Duval Street.. but the peace and quiet was also good.... will stay here again when I visit Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - best in the Keys !”
Reviews.Author: angiefinn
Reviews.Content: This was our third stay at the Inn at Key West. I really wouldnt stay anywhere else.It has the largest pool in Key West along with a separate hot jacuzzi and it is a great place to relax and enjoy the surroundings. They also have a very friendly iguana in the grounds !The room we stayed in this time was a double double which as it suggests has two double beds in. The rooms are all air conditioned which may be a little noisy but didnt stop us sleeping. There is free WiFi in your room and also at the lobby area and the bar area. There are also two computers to use to stay in touch with friends and family, We had breakfast there, which was great value for money and also had a lot of choice. You can opt for the buffet or the hot breakfast. The Gulf of Mexico is just across the road. The Inn is on the main road and just a few minutes drive to Duvall Street and Mallory Square. I wouldnt hesitate to recommend this hotel to all types of traveller.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: mathis94
Reviews.Content: Decided to try this hotel, after pricing all the others. I can say this was definately worth the money. Very clean, and updated. The beds and pillows were comfortable, also. If you are looking to be close to Duval, this isn't the hotel for you. But, if you are looking for one away from the action for a good nights sleep....this is the one to stay at!

Reviews.Title: “You won't be disappointed”
Reviews.Author: onetravellerCanada
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel. The lobby entrance is gorgeous and the desk service friendly and helpful. We arrive around 11:00 am and our room was not yet ready. We were invited to use the pool facilities until it was ready for us. We changed into our bathing suits and enjoyed the magificent pool, large freeform shaped with a rock grotto waterfall .The landscaping is spectacular, an absolute "garden of Eden", giant ferns palms and tropical flowers and a great Tiki Bar with a very helpful bartender who got out a map of Key West and immediately showed us the sites to visit. Our room was ready for us in about a half hour. What a wonderful surprise to see the quality that went into the decorating . Everything was first class, beautiful goose down duvets, wall flat screen tv, marble bathroom, the furniture and the lamps in the room were beautiful. Our room was certainly not the most expensive one, being at the back of the hotel facing the parking lot, but even that was scenic, with oversized ferns and trees in front of each room and along the perimeter of the parking lot . There was a small patio with a couple of chairs and a table where it was quite pleasant to sit and watch the salamanders and wild chickens roaming around. Yes, there are wild chickens in Key West. There was also no charge for parking. This was a great stay that more than met our expectations. We would love to go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Family Vacation Value”
Reviews.Author: braunaw
Reviews.Content: Great room, service and staff. We took the Ultimate Adventure at the recommendation of the hotel concierge. We loved it! Great time in the beautifully landscaped pool The largest one in Key West. The whole experience fit my pictures of a relaxed family vacation. We definately left with some lasting memories of joyful times together. Thank you! Inn at Key West management and staff. Ann B. Gainesville, FL

Reviews.Title: “Best of the Best!!@”
Reviews.Author: Tikilady303
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at several motels and hotels in Key West over the past several years, and this was our favorite spot yet! In fact, this the first one that we plan on returning on our next visit. We even stayed at the Doubletree once and The Inn at Key West was much better for half the price. We absolutely loved our stay. Everyone was friendly and helpful. We definitely plan on staying at The Inn again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “This is a cracking little hotel”
Reviews.Author: meeky1964
Reviews.Content: When you enter the lobby you have a staircase climbing up each side of reception "very nice" rooms are clean and spacious, pool is really tropical with a bar. We did not eat there because eating out was the decision before we went but there were plenty of people eating in the restaurant we would definately go back. last but not least the receptionist was so nice she would not have been out of place on a Disney Float at the parade

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful luxury for a great price”
Reviews.Author: carpetmanswife
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Key West on a whim. I had spent a lot of time online looking for the perfect place. The only problem I can think of, was that I was hoping to be close to water, and didn't realize that the Gulf was across the street. I had thought it was just outside. I agree that the pool and the accommodations were luxurious. I didn't eat at the restaurant. I would definitely stay here again. The conceirge service was awesome, and we really enjoyed the day out on the water!

Reviews.Title: “The single most awsome resort ever!”
Reviews.Author: vanWills
Reviews.Content: The Inn at Key West is a fabulous resort. The hotel has a four star experience with a two star price. The lush tropical setting, secluded walkways, huge warm pool complete with a waterfall are just a few of the hotels' outstanding qualities. Inside the clean rooms, are plush, down bedding, large flat screen tvs, and heavy wood dressers concealing items such as the frig and coffee maker. The restaurant and tiki bar allowed us to eat and drink by the pool if we did not wish to go in search of food. The staff are more than willing to help in any way. You will need scooters to get around, but the ride makes the sightseeing all the more fun.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, great pool, great stay”
Reviews.Author: Ricky_Bianca
Reviews.Content: We booked the Inn because it looked to be great value and the pool looked fabulous. We were in Key West for 6 nights and absolutely delighted with our choice. The rooms are spacious, well-appointed and have the most comfortable beds I've ever slept in. The pool was big, clean, quiet and there was never a shortage of sunbeds. The cocktails from the tiki bar were generous and good value. In short, bliss. If we were to go again (which we would LOVE) I would definitely hire bikes or mopeds as we ended up getting taxis to and from the centre every night, at about $15 per journey.
