We also booked a trip through the guest services desk and were delighted with their recommendation - they definitely know their stuff. The ONLY slight disappointment was breakfast, which we only had on one day. The overall spread was great and the cooked breakfast was lovely, but you would be hard pushed to eat enough to justify the $14 price tag. But overall, tremendous.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good - Not Perfect”
Reviews.Author: highdesertbadger
Reviews.Content: I agree with most of what previous posts have written about The Inn. my complaints were that the balcony we had was very tight. The pool and landscaping were very tropical and nice. The location has it's pluses and minuses. It's away from the town center which makes noise a bit less of an issue. However, it is on a busy road and getting in and out of the property during busy times (which seems to go on all day) could be a bit annoying. My biggest gripe however was the stinginess of the hotel with soap and toilet tissue. It was like there was some sort of rationing going on. Come on now one tiny flake of soap for washing hands and taking a bath, they could do better. All it all I enjoyed my stay and found the staff to be friendly and helpful when asked. Since this was my first trip to KW I have no idea what other properties are like nor what they cost. Key West certainly seems like it's one perpetual party.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury hotel with a few dissapoints”
Reviews.Author: Thijs82
Reviews.Content: This Luxury hotel has good, clean rooms (superior king/balconey) with a large LCD tv (with digital TV), good beds, great bathroom, but a verry loud airco system. For the price we paid (199USD/night) we expected a breakfast, but thas was not included. Instead we coud buy a breakfast for a minimum 9 USD(!) Food or drinks are note allowed at the pool. The website says: "Enjoy breakfast in the morning..." thats a kind of misleading people.

Reviews.Title: “paradise”
Reviews.Author: summerwind427
Reviews.Content: this hotel is beautiful. everything has been recently renovated. the rooms are spacious and georgous. we ugraded to a superior king/balconey and it was worth the money. the pool makes you feel like you are in the tropics with so many palm trees swaying in the breeze. the pool is huge and nicely shaped with different depth levels. the staff is very friendly and very attentive. it is about 3 miles from the town which is walkable or driveable. it is a very convenient location. we will come back again

Reviews.Title: “My new choice for Key West”
Reviews.Author: SavageLife
Reviews.Content: On the spur of the moment, decided to go to Key West from Miami for the day. Was having troubles locating available rooms, and took a chance with this hotel. It exceeded all of my expectations. Beautiful pool, clean room, and excellent decor. I can breathe easy, I have found a place in Key West for repeated use!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Key West”
Reviews.Author: MinnesotaOnvacation
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay in Key West for the money. After spending way too much time on the internet researching hotels and B&Bs in Key West I finally stumbled upon this. I read endless Trip Advisor reviews before deciding. My husband and I were very pleased with what we found when we arrived. The rooms were clean and beautiful. The pool was also beautiful. Can't wait to take our kids back to play in it. We would definitely stay here again. My husband stays in way too many hotels being an airline pilot. He said this one was good and complimented me on my pick! The Concierge "Bob" was great! He helped us arrange snorkeling and a jet ski tour of the island. Two great activities. He also arranged a shuttle for us and let us know about free parking spots around town. A big deal in Key West. This was my first experience with letting a Concierge arrange anything for me. I had a great experience and highly recommend this service. They know all the good spots and the good tour operators in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: dmeyer004
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Inn. The room was clean and cosy with nice decor. Coffe maker, fridge and nice TV. The patio was nice even though it was rather small, next time I will go for a balcony room. Parking was great with no charge and it was nice to get away from the hustle of downtown. We brought our bikes and never moved our vechicle once we arrived. We biked to the beach and downtown. Wonderful place to stay at a good price.

Reviews.Title: “Best place in Key West NOT at Duval or Mallory Square”
Reviews.Author: CARDHU2
Reviews.Content: Overlooking a gorgeous pool & waterfall or the Gulf, the rooms were luxurious, immaculately clean, well stocked, and quiet. Great bed & bedding; lots of towels. Fridge, coffeemaker, and huge TV. Small balcony or patio. Several miles from Duval and terrible parking (none or expensive) once you get there... Marriott's Beachside nearby with it's free shuttle might be a consideration. Free internet, no resort fee, free and plentiful parking. Online price of $119 off-season is best deal in Key West for a modern, beautifully landscaped luxury hotel. Get 2nd floor room for pool or Gulf view. (no elevator) Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Clean!”
Reviews.Author: Honliveo
Reviews.Content: My wife wasn't too thrilled that I booked this hotel. She wasn't impressed by the outside. Her mind changed as soon as we entered our room. She loved it. It was one of the cleanest hotel we've stayed at. The staff was very nice. I would stay here on my next trip to the keys.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed my stay! Others in my party did not.”
Reviews.Author: LEELEE029
Reviews.Content: I loved the decor and the night front desk person was warm and welcoming. All staff memebers that I came in contact with were pleasent - especially the wait staff at the cafe. I was satisfied with the food. And I really enjoyed the room. It was clean, remodeled and had a very comfortable bed. I would stay there again! My sister and her husband, who were also with us, did not feel welcomed and actually had some not so nice things to say about the management. She said that the frong desk person was rude and seem annoyed to be there.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money!”
Reviews.Author: greekbrit
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed this place! I chose it based on Tripadvisor reviews and the great price for a room! $130 The room was very adequate and having a fridge and free internet was great! There was a coffee maker in my room, too! Great value for money and very comfortable! The view from the balcony, overlooking the Gulf of Mexico was magnificent! The front desk were very polite and the concierge has an array of suggestions to make about excursions. When we checked out, my friend's mother left her purse in the bedroom. We discovered it about 20 minutes later and had to go back. It had been taken by the maid to the reception and was returned safely. The best of all was the pool in a tropical garden! It was so relaxing to chill there and have a drink at the bar! The hotel is quite a way from Duval Street and the cost of a taxi is $15. If you have your own transport, it's ideal or you can rent a moped or bicycle from around the corner if you're feeling adventurous! I'd recommend it, wholeheartedly to anyone unless you have a mobility problem as there were stairs to climb to get to our rooms! Great value for a 3 and a half star hotel, too! I'll be back one day!!

Reviews.Title: “4 star hotel at 3 star price! Very good resort like hotel.”
Reviews.Author: lanky111
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel. We stayed here for 2 nights with no complaints. As we entered, the hotel had a grand entrance with 2 stairways going up on both sides. There was a very fresh aroma to the hotel lobby. The rooms were smaller than I expected but was still worth it. I got the one with the balcony and had a view of the gulf. The room was very well kept, room service was great, the pool was a nice size and clean, the staff was very helpful. We were able to book 2 activities on the same day with the concierge. This hotel had a pool, a workout facility, excellent rooms, and good location. I would recommend the place to anyone looking to stay at a great place in key west without spending a huge amount of money.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing Spectaluar”
Reviews.Author: FLSunshine66
Reviews.Content: My Hubby and I stayed 2 nights September 7-9 The room is ok just to sleep but nothing like the pictures show. The pool is not very deep max was 5 ft. if you want a place to stay and its away from Duval St this is ok its right near IHOP. The room has no microwave or coffee pot. and NO free breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “The Inn At Key West :)”
Reviews.Author: Pumpkin02
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have been here two times and we loooove it. The rooms are beautiful. We've have always stayed in the rooms with the terrace and it's such a tropical feeling when you step out outside. The bathrooms are very clean, which is a huge deal for my husband and I (germ freaks). You just have to pack your clothes and everything else you need is there towels, iron etc. ( didn't notice a hair dryer though) The pool is amazing! When you first walk in to the hotel you can't even imagine what you're about to see. The service is great.Very friendly staff. We are actually going back soon. Amazing place!

Reviews.Title: “Drinks and lunch poolside was like heaven on Earth.”
Reviews.Author: LKS-travel
Reviews.Content: We have visited Key West quite a few times and this was the nicest place we have stayed for the price. Not at all like a typical beach hotel. The rooms were quiet, spacious and clean. The fitness room was well equiped with a great view of the water. Staff was attentive and helpful. The large pool with lush surrounding landscaping was even prettier than it appears in pictures. We enjoyed a great lunch there both days. It's a bit of a drive to downtown, but worth it for the savings and the peace. Our only complaint was that our room wasn't cleaned until late in the day on Sunday. Next time we will try to get a room facing the pool area. Our patio was facing the parking lot so it was not very scenic. Otherwise, it was a perfect stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very good stay”
Reviews.Author: KChopin
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at Inn of Key West and enjoyed our stay. The rooms were clean although the beds were too soft. The location is good: IHop next door, Publix and shopping center nearby. Easy drive into major attractions on Duvall and Front. Concierges recommended very good restaurants. No fee for parking and no resort fees. Across from Gulf; pool is well maintained and clean. Yes, we would stay again and recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Ask The Night Manager About A Late Night Swim”
Reviews.Author: OntarioSuncatcher
Reviews.Content: That is the best way too put it .. When you think of management, you think of having someone that "actually" knows what they are doing ... The signs around the pool were not probably written and very misleading. A few others were swimming before 11:00 pm and we decided to join after a long day in the city.. After just entering the pool for a quick late night swim, we were rudely interrupted by the "Night Manager" to ask us why we would even consider swimming so late at night, with it clearly being stated. After a few minutes of discussion, we gave up and went on our way. While walking back from the ice machine, we were delighted to see that the "Night Manager" allowed two young girls in bikini's a chance to have a late night swim .. When approached with the situation, he states .. you win .. you go ahead .. I couldn't believe it. After that experience the first night, I gave up on the hotel... After spending the day away from the hotel and visiting the sights and sounds of Key West, all you want to do is go for a quick dip in the pool and unfortunately this "Night Manager" had double standards--. Let me NOT recommend this hotel with the lack of poor management decisions. This man should not be working there !!! It is unfortunate. The lack of a coffee maker was also an upset. My suggestion, get closer to the heart of Key West and I am sure you will enjoy it more. Next time, my first choice will be a closer hotel/bed and breakfast. Other than that Key West Rocks, and The Inn at Key West "does not".

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: tgee8433
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a 3 night stay at this hotel. It was our first trip to Key West and after a 4 hour drive from Miami we were pleasantly surprised from the second we walked into the lobby. We got a beautiful room facing the pool. Enjoyed the pool and especially the live music on Saturday. The front staff was friendly and helpful, the room was very clean and the location is close to everything - all for a very reasonable rate. We enjoyed every minute of our stay and absolutely recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing...can't wait to stay again”
Reviews.Author: MarylandBeachbum52
Reviews.Content: You will not be disappointed by your stay at the inn. My boyfriend and I stayed here for two nights, our first time in Key West. We stayed in one of the rooms with a pool view. It was lovely. Clean. Great and friendly staff. Comfortable. Nice atmosphere. GREAT POOL:)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Island style ambiance”
Reviews.Author: vacationerisland
Reviews.Content: I have been to Key West many times before and have stayed all over the island. This time I was taking my son and his girlfriend and was apprehensive about a nice place to stay without breaking the bank. I found it. We were all impressed with the Inn. Great ambiance, perfect pool, good attention to every detail. Friendly staff except for the late afternoon/ evening bar keeper, she had the usual Key West attitude. But don't let this stop you from booking reservations, use the pool attendant to order drinks, nice guy. You can be assured the next time I go to Key West I will be booking into the Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from Home”
Reviews.Author: Marlin505
Reviews.Content: The service me and my three teenage girls experienced at "The Inn at Key West". It couldn't have been more inviting when we drove up to the beautiful tropical entrance to check in. The beautiful entrance with all the tropical plants and the beautiful comfortable lobby entrance was so wonderful. The check in staff was there to check us in and they were so nice and inviting and a real treat to be treated like VIP. They cater to your every needs and whims. Oh and the room was like being at home only nicer, nice and roomy with the absolute nicest bath room I've ever seen, and the biggest shower what a nice room. The location was the best spot on the island looking out at the ocean and the main road close to every thing and easy access to any thing you might need. Me and my girls thought how nice the room was then we went to the pool to swim, it was just like being on a tropical island, need less to say we spent alot of time in that gorgeous pool and enjoyed great service at the Tiki bar with any beverage of your choice and served at your convince. In closing we will always stay with The Inn at Key-West and are making plans to return soon. I will recommend this to all that I know and will tell them of the best experience and most memorable trip ever. Our greatest thanks to all the staff that made sure we were comfortable and we left with great memories of The Inn. There wasn't anything we disliked about our trip there. Do your self a big favor and check it out. You won't be sorry and you will have the best memories staying there. Thank you so much to all the staff at The Inn in Key~West. We love U.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: dArFik
Reviews.Content: We spent 6 days of our honeymoon in this very nice hotel. We stayed at few different hotels on our way to Key West and this place was gorgeous. We got room with patio. Patio is very small and looks different that they show on hotel's website, but room was very nice and romantic. Patio is not the most important think because you have very big and nice pool and you would rather stay all day in this pool than on the patio. Tiki Bar was ok. They do strong drinks, so be careful.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it, would definately stay again”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkLuvflorida
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel. The pool was very nice. Overall, extremely satisfied, only wished the room was available a little earlier. We could't check in till exactly 3:00. I would recommend it though.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible - Best Hotel On The Island!!!!”
Reviews.Author: beccarhill
Reviews.Content: Its perfect for children! The pool is amazing and very kid-friendly! The Tiki Bar is so yummy and has a wide variety of drinks, even fun "virgin" drinks for the kiddos. The rooms are so relaxing and so comfortable. The bed is comfy as well and the rooms are spacious. The restaurant is great and offers a yummy breakfast!!! Lunch by the pool is a MUST! The staff is always so friendly and helpful in so many ways. They brought us a pack-n-play in the middle of the night :) I highly recommend this hotel! Its away from all the craziness of Old Town so there is never an issue of not being able to park. And, you don't have to pay to park at the hotel! Its in the middle of everything! And, its a short ride on a scooter or bike to Old Town. Have fun!

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend”
Reviews.Author: keywestdiver
Reviews.Content: Prior to our stay, we researched the resort extensively and almost decided not to stay due to a poor review on Tripadvisor. I'm so glad we chose otherwise. The resort was beautiful...the pool and tiki bar were amazing! The room was larger than we expected for the small price we paid, bed was extremely comfortable. The fitness center was also excellent (however we did not use it often...I mean we were on vacation :) It is away from from Duval which makes it quieter than other hotels downtown. It was perfect for us and the only place we will stay next time we visit Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time at The Inn...pool and tiki bar were awesome!”
Reviews.Author: KPaganBSN
Reviews.Content: My husband and I go to the keys at least once a year and we normally stay on Duval street but this time we decided to try something different and got an awesome deal on their website. The hotel is exactly like it is pictured and described on their website...rooms are beautiful, pool was amazing! It's about a 5 min drive to duval so it was no big deal for us....We normally stay at Lateda's and absolutely love it there but they are two very different hotels. Lateda's is right on duval street, staff is awesome, has a great bar and they have the BEST complimentary breakfast but they don't have parking(which is a pain), rooms aren't as nice and the pool is small compared to The Inn. Already planning our next trip....oh, the Cafe has great sandwiches and the Tiki bar makes the best drinks! Can't wait for our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “They don't honor reservations. Don't try them.”
Reviews.Author: DanielWMiami
Reviews.Content: I booked a night with them through Expedia.com, my credit card was charged and all in advance. I show up that day at 2pm, too early to check-in, but I tell them I'm there and is it OK if I come back at 11pm, they say no problem, you have it reserved. In fact, the printout from Expedia had the phrase "reserved for late arrival". But when I came back at 11pm, they said, oh, we're sold out, booked up, no more rooms. Unbelievable. While I was being told this, another guest comes up to complain about a flood in his room, said he reported it in the afternoon and nothing done yet. Unbelievable. The lobby looks like, nice pool, I never got to see the inside of a room, no thanks to them. But the service and the way they run themselves is outrageous. Please, pass them by, and pass the world.

Reviews.Title: “Surprised & Impressed”
Reviews.Author: JacobFlorida
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice and has a very pretty pool. Our room had two queen size beds, desk, chair, refrigerator, and a nice LCD TV. The room was clean and the furniture was nice. The bathroom was also clean. My only complaint is that there wasn't a fan in the bathroom and it got a little warm. I would recommend this hotel to families. Its within walking distance to an Ihop and there's a grocery store a few miles down the road. We really enjoyed out stay and was delightfully surprised and impressed.

Reviews.Title: “Fun and Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: vtpittman07
Reviews.Content: The stay was fantastic and we really enjoyed. WE all agree that The Inn at Key West's cost was in line with the quality of the stay. The rooms were just enough space for 4 and the bathroom was great. The room was clean and the service was friendly. Thanks for a relaxing and enjoyable vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Inn.....Best Pool and Pina Colada's in Key West”
Reviews.Author: LLBeav
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel, beautiful rooms, great pool.....amazing bar...the greatest Pina Colada I have ever had! On the gulf side, great view. Must have a car or rented scooter to get to Duval Street! I would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Inviting, comfortable rooms - Perfect for my birthday”
Reviews.Author: SunLitSea
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I planned our first trip to Key West well in advance. After exhaustively researching for an affordable, yet quality hotel, we found The Inn at Key West fit our needs to a tee! We stayed 3 nights in a double queen with a balcony overlooking the ocean - the room was spacious, clean, and inviting. The bathrooms are well designed with plenty of towels tucked neatly under the counter and lots of storage space! Our evening swim in their beautiful tropical landscaped pool was a relaxing bonus - add a cocktail or iced drink from the tiki lounge, our star-studded 'pool party' was complete. Upon arrival, our room was comfortably cool and inviting after a long 9 hour drive! Our beds were very comfortable - the down comfortors are a very nice touch of class. If you don't like feather/flat pillows however, bring your own. We would definitely return to The Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: SwanPA
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Inn at Key West for 3 nights in June. We loved every minute. The room was very nice - not overly large but comfortable for 2 adults and 2 teenagers. Everything very clean and it looked relatively new or renovated. It was very hot and humid outside but the AC kept the room chilled - we couldn't wait to get back to the hotel after touring all day. The best part of the hotel is the pool. It was very tropical, the water temp was great and we enjoyed the music and service. I usually stay at "chain" hotels since they are mostly predictable but this independent hotel was exceptional. When we return to Key West, we know where to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location, room and view for the price!!”
Reviews.Author: new_aztraveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Inn for one night on the July 4th weekend.. We booked an ocean front Superior kind size bedroom, and got the same unlike most other hotels. The room was beautiful, the bed was one of the best beds I have seen in hotels so far.. the bathroom was nice too, with 2 showers.. our roon was on the first floor so we got a patio facing the ocean.. it was amazing! I absolutely loved my short stay at The Inn. Would definitely go back there again!! Oh, and I paid only about $250 for the room, which is less than what you'd pay at a Sheraton or Marriott. Highly Recommended!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice Inn”
Reviews.Author: mariacaterina
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights in June. This is a 2-story, outside entrance hotel, and I initially had misgivings, but once inside the room it's obvious they were recently remodeled, clean, very decent furniture, very nice bedding. Free internet access in the lobby, although no national newspapers. Best part of this Inn is the pool area - really very pretty, surrounded by tropical plantings and trees, even a sandy area, water temperature was perfect! We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay - well worth it”
Reviews.Author: jcitravelfan
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to the keys and we loved this hotel. It was very very clean. The hotel staff was very nice and accomodating. The pool really made the hotel the experience that much better. It made you feel that you were on a tropical island all by yourself. It was great to have floats available and towels for guests to use. The bathroom was very nice with a great shower. The bed was very comfortable with lots of nice pillows (the kind you'd have at home) and a thick coverette. By far, the best hotel we stayed at on this trip. We do plan to return.

Reviews.Title: “HOT!!!!”
Reviews.Author: morineland
Reviews.Content: The hotel was remodeled and the decor was beautiful. But it did not have central A/C which was miserable for us. It had a window unit that didnt seem to do much. We called the front desk and told us to keep the bathroom door closed at all times because the vent in the bathroom sucked all the air out of the room. On top of that, the is no air conditioning in the bathroom so it was miserable to get ready and shower... We will never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “paradise!!!”
Reviews.Author: lovebugBaltimore_Md
Reviews.Content: We visited Key West last week and the Inn at Key west was fabulous. The decor is very tropical and inviting. The pool area is what makes this place shine!! The tiki bar had good food and cocktails. We selected the generous king suite and it was very roomy. We loved the marble shower with rain water shower head We are looking forward to a second stay

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Key West!!”
Reviews.Author: kkubie
Reviews.Content: Our annual girls getaway (chick-cation) landed us at the Inn at Key West. The hotel made our trip absolutely wonderful. The hotel was very fresh and clean. Our room was plenty big enough. You aren't in the heart of Downtown Duval street, which I enjoyed. We had a car so the couple miles drive into downtown was quite pleasant. The pool is by far the best part of this hotel. Gorgeous pool with excellent poolside food, drinks and service. The front desk staff were courteous and helpful when we needed anything. The exercise room was nice with new equipment. Key West was the best trip we have taken so far. We will be back next year and will definitely be staying at The Inn!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Once again great expeirence”
Reviews.Author: ScreaminEagle69
Reviews.Content: Every autumn for the last seven years we go to the Keys for vacation and even though we have visited other accomadations and searched on line we have settled on The Inn. We fly into Miami rent a car and enjoy the leisurely ride thru the peaceful Keys. While we enjoy the atmosphere on Duval St. it is also nice to go back to this tastefully decorated hotel and enjoy the quiet beautiful palm tree enscased pool.While their is no dinner resturant in the hotel there are many within walking distance. If you are into lying on the beach Fort Taylor is beautiful, soft sand beautiful sunset with umbrellas,chairs and snack bar. But after all, you are on vacation anyway so go downtown enjoy the stores,bars,nitelife and sunset and dont worry if a few minor hotel details are not what you expected it beats being home or working. We are in our 50's and we get all excited like kids when our Key West vacation rolls around. You go around once in life everyone should visit the Keys.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice”
Reviews.Author: Maggiegmar
Reviews.Content: Stayed there 2 nights with a party of 25 (11 rooms). The Inn handled everything beautifully. Great service, great clean and roomy rooms. Fantastic pool area to relax in.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for Key West”
Reviews.Author: captmike737
Reviews.Content: The property is well maintained. The pool area is excellent. The rooms are nicely decorated with new furniture. A great value for Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Great pool/pool bar - rooms small, no restaurant”
Reviews.Author: motherofthebride1009
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Inn at Key West last October while scouting wedding locations for an October 2009 wedding. We stayed at IKW because it was the most economical for us. The rooms are a bit small for two people, but the "lotions and potions" in the bathroom will appeal to most women. The pool area is the best part of the hotel. It's got a pretty "rock" waterfall and the BEST poolside bar. There are two major problems with this hotel. It is too far from the action of Duval (a $15 cab ride for 2). Their website at the time we booked the reservation stated they had shuttle service to Old Town, but it was no longer available when we arrived. The hotel has food you can order poolside and a nice breakfast buffet/table service, but there is no dinner service. You have to leave the hotel for dinner and that was most inconvenient after a day of scouting locations in the hot sun.

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Stay at The Inn at Key West”
Reviews.Author: TarponChaser188
Reviews.Content: We have been visiting Key West for 13 consecutive years. Six years ago we stopped in to see the pool everyone had been talking about. We met with the Concierge who gave us a tour of the property and rooms. On our arrival back to Canada we immediately booked our next stay and have been staying at The Inn at Key West every year since. We have stayed in many hotels previously but none compare for quality and value. Our friends who have been with us or visited on their own have felt the same way.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Getaway Inn!”
Reviews.Author: mimers
Reviews.Content: We needed a getaway and spent two nights at the Inn at Key West. What a fabulous place. It has recently be remodeled and the rooms are so pretty and clean. The pool is fantastic, so relaxing. Service for the most part was excellent. The only complaint we had was we did not have a car and we had to take a cab into the city which was $30.00 round trip. A shuttle to town would be a great added convenience. If you want a relaxing, beautiful location away from the craziness of the city this is the place for you. It would also be great if you were staying with kids. We will go back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value & Ideal family spot for people on a budget!”
Reviews.Author: Thedon1196
Reviews.Content: No problems checking in. Unfortunately, no bell boy, but they did offer to have someone assist with the bags. It is a nice luxury hotel, minus all of the extras you would get at a Marriott. If you need pampering don't come, because it is not that type of luxury hotel, but they have a concierge who can help you get to all of the places they dont have on the property. Website & pictures were accurate. The rooms were not huge, but they were accomodating, current & clean. They have flat screens, free internet access, free parking etc.. They also had a work out facility, sauna etc..., unfortunately we did not get a chance to go. We also had two infants, in which the provided portable cribs, which were light weight & easy to move around the rooms. We had the King room with a view of the pool. Pool was always being maintained. If you are looking to be in the mix of the Duval party district, then this may not be the place for you, but if you are okay with a 10 minute cab ride downtown to save money, I would put this on the top of your list. We had a rental, so travel was not a problem . Don't let most of the bigger name brand hotels fool you talking about beach side, because most of them are just water front. The beach space is nearly non-existent anywhere along highway 1. So, if you feel you need to spend more money to watch the sea, feel free. If you have a family, IHOP is next door. They also have many eating places within 5 minutes of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel, great pool, kid friendly”
Reviews.Author: Rick9208
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from Keywest, we stayed at The INN at Key west. First off I dont know how anyone can complain about this place, dont believe the negative comments. We rented a car in Miami and drove down, it took about 3 1/2 hrs or so, it was a nice ride and beautiful scenery. The towns along the way were quaint and some a little backwoods, but still it was nice. We checked in and stayed in rm 119, it was clean and had nice furniture, the design was very nice and classic tropical. The bath room was beautiful and the shower was very nice with huge rainshower head. The service was great, they have free internet so you have to wait sometimes from other guests "hogging it", that is really my only complaint and that isnt the hotels fault. There is an Ihop next door , it is not a nice Ihop, it was a little in need of a new ceiling, but the prices are good. We ate next door to the hotel at the breakfast buffet and that was nice. It is kind of hidden in the back by the hotel. My husband decided to go fishing so I went along, early in the morning. He went through Local Peter Haydon, he was very nice and for $350 for half day, it was totally worth it for my husband, he caught alot of Tarpon and had the fight of his life and I had it all on video and the fish was spalshing and jumping and my husband was reeling it in and laughing, and then got the fish in. I set the video camera down for a second to take a picture of my husband and the fish he caught and the boat tipped to the side and when it did, the video camera slid off and into the ocean never to be seen again. I was so upset and mad all at the same time, but my husband handled it well and felt so bad for me. Even with that happening we had the best time and totally recommend him, so look him up he will show you real fishing. All in all we liked this hotel alot and have no complaints. The hotel is about 7 minutes away from like Duval street and downtown, but there is parking. We found parking downtown by the Truman Annex by Caroline street the best and one block from Duval st, the cost is $1.50 for an hour they dont take cash so have quarters ready. We would definatly go back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Tropical Getaway!”
Reviews.Author: fabmissl
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great place for a getaway! The accommodations are excellent! Comfortable rooms that are nicely appointed, the tropical pool area has a beautiful waterfall and the staff is very friendly and efficient.

Reviews.Title: “loved it there”
Reviews.Author: manollo3
Reviews.Content: Being from Ft.Lauderdale we go to Key West several times a year. We usually stay at the same hotel (another one) all the time. As the prices went up and they were more or less booked we decided to give The Inn a try. Wow, that is all I have to say. Have already stayed at about 4-5 ones before but this one beats all of them. The rooms were very very clean with flat screen TV, modern bathroom, free internet access. Seems like it was just remodeled. The pool must be one of the nicest on the Island. If you book a room make sure to get a pool view and not a ocean view. Fortunately we did that. The hotel is located on one of the main street in Key West (4 lanes). You will have to cross that street to get to the Gulf of Mexico and therefore it will be quite noisy. I would definitely recommend this hotel if you don't want to spent a fortune but still want the tropical livestyle and clean amendities

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: edina79
Reviews.Content: The hotel renovations are beautiful - rooms, lobby and pool all look great! I would definitely recommend the the buffet breakfast - also, speak to the concierge if you are looking for suggestions on things to do.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Rooms and Gorgeous Tropical Oasis Pool”
Reviews.Author: JazFlorida
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay at this hotel. The pool is the nicest in Key West. Lush tropical vegetation around a large pool and waterfall, with a real Key West feel. Also a large secluded hottub. The rooms must have been recently redone because everything was beautiful and new. The staff was super friendly. The pool bar was excellent and the beer ice cold. It's particluarly a great deal for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Im going back for more!”
Reviews.Author: Tiara10
Reviews.Content: 11 of us stayed there for our wedding. We all loved it. What a beautiful resort! I will stay there again! Hopefully soon! Good breakfast buffet!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay!”
Reviews.Author: hockeyplayer24
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Inn at Key West last year for a mini vacation from the main land and it was a great experience. Everything about this Hotel is great. When you walk through the door you and greated with a friendly hello and welcome. While you are waiting your check-in, there is the water with the fresh fruit making it a great touch to your welcome. Even though we only ate there once, the food was great. Then there was the Pina Coladas! Wow prob the best I've ever had!! That is a definate must, sitting by the really nice, clean pool with that drink your hand. The rooms were SO clean and remodeled. Flat screen T.V. with very comfortable beds. I believe it was a marriott property and it had that feel to it. Then we decided to do an activity and we went to the front desk and they have on hand an activity director that books you an excursion and knows all the locals on the island that will get you the best deal and the most fun. We did the jet ski'ing around the whole island of Key West. If you have a morning of afternoon, this is a must do. There is also a restaurant on the island that is very nice and out of the congestion of the main part of town, it's called Louies Back Yard, went there for lunch and it was one of my favorite restuarants ever, and thats saying alot, because I eat out alot. I believe its voted top 10 in Florida. When i go back down to the Keys, I will be definately staying at the Inn at Key West!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: gizmodog80
Reviews.Content: WOW! Beautiful hotel! Clean rooms! The pool is incredible and they serve the best Pina Coladas on the island! We stayed in a King Ocean View. The ocean is across the road, so you actually get a parking lot view. We weren't in our room very much so this didn't bother us. I would suggest a Pool View room. You should also realize that The Inn is about 3 miles from "the action" of Duval Street and Mallory Square. We rented a scooter for the week, which is something you MUST do while in Key West, so the distance wasn't a problem. Overall great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Resort”
Reviews.Author: friedconchfritter
Reviews.Content: I really have no complaints about this place. The minor inconvenience was that their key card machine was broken, so for the hassle of asking reception to open our door every time we entered the hotel, they gave us a room upgrade and the room was right by the front desk. The room also faced the pool with a pretty decent sized patio. We were very happy with the accommodations. The room and property was very nicely renovated and for the price we paid, we felt it was a bargain. Yes the hotel is away from the action but Key West is a very small island. It took us five minutes by car to get to Duval Street. I would stay here again and recommend this place to anyone. If you like to workout, the gym is very nice too. I must also give kudos to the Frenchman that works the front desk. He is awesome and and I kinda liked being called Madam.. :-)

Reviews.Title: “Away from Duval”
Reviews.Author: Seadreams
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from a stay at The Inn At Key West. We chose this hotel based on research online and were happy with our choice. The hotel is about 15 minutes away from Old Town and Duval street. If you are going to Key West for the action, this hotel is not for you as you will need to drive or take a cab to downtown as the hotel does not offer a free shuttle (Which they should for their guests). The grounds of the hotel are well maintained. The pool and surrounding landscape are very nice. The pool is very large and there is a hot tub as well. There is a cafe and tiki bar for food and drinks by the pool area. Grocery and liquor stores are in walking distance; if you have a fridge in your room...go there for some supplies. We stayed in a superior room with a king size bed and balcony. The room was very nice, with a view of the pool from our balcony. The pictures on their website were accurate. The only negative about the room was on a few occasions housekeeping did not get to it until after 4pm, but they likely had many check outs on those days. Vanessa at the front desk was very helpful. Millie at the conceirge desk was friendly, helpful and full of knowledge about the island. Bozena in the cafe was a wonderful waitress. I think the people that complained about this hotel, would complain no matter where they were staying. If this is your first time to Key West, take the Conch Train tour. It is well worth the $29 per person and they provide a shuttle to Mallory Square and back to the Welcome Center by the Holiday Inn which is right down the street from The Inn at Key West. You can take the tour and shop Duval street then take the shuttle back. If you go to Higgs Beach be sure to see Fran for a chair or kayak rental. He is extremely friendly and helpful. Don't miss the sunset celebration in Mallory Square! Bring small bills to tip the street performers! Take a cab from the hotel...it is worth the money. Bring plenty of money for activities and shopping, and remember you are on island time. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Remodeled Hotel Away from the main action”
Reviews.Author: nhtm5driver
Reviews.Content: Nicely remodeled hotel; large pool; bit far away from all the action on Duval Street.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but too far from the action!”
Reviews.Author: doglovingtraveler
Reviews.Content: This was my husband and my first trip to Key West. For those of you who have never been, let me tell you this: The Inn at Key West is just too far away from downtown Key West to be worth the money. That is not to say that the hotel is awful--in fact, this hotel is quite nice and has a beautiful pool. However, as they say in real estate: location, location, location. Unfortunately, this is not something The Inn at Key West has working for it. We ended up driving into town each day (approximately 15 minutes to get into town) and paying $10 for parking. The problem with this is that we wanted to be able to go back to the hotel and swim or shower or whatever....this was NOT convenient because of the hotel's location. You could walk or bike to downtown but that's taking more time out of your precious vacation. We met a couple who walked downtown (45 minute walk) and ended up taking a cab back because they couldn't imagine having to walk that distance again. My suggestion is to book a hotel closer to Duval street so that you can truly experience the Key West spirit. The front desk staff was awful, particularly Vanessa. On three separate occassions (even after I was fully checked in), she told me that she could not find me in the system nor any of my reservation information. She could not remember even having spoken to me previously that same day (an hour earlier!). The pool-side cafe only serves food during specific hours which was not convenient to our schedule. One perk is that the bar and pool stays open until 10:00 pm. The pool is beautiful and large. The hot tub was hot but the jets were not working on either of the nights we were there. There are no beaches within walking distance to this hotel. The rooms were nice. Our king-sized bed was very comfortable and our room was quite clean. The hotel provided quality shampoo/conditioner samples (Bath and Body Works) which was a nice perk. In essence, I would recommend this hotel if you are staying in Key West only for the weather and for relaxation. If you want to be in the action or if this is your first visit, I would go elsewhere. You can get another hotel closer to the action for a similar price (although the pool will probably not be as large).

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: julymalta
Reviews.Content: I was on vacation with three more friends in the USA, we did a road trip though Florida and booked this hotel through the internet, just reading the advices from people who had stayed there. We arrived a little bit early and couldn't check-in because of the time, so we went to have lunch, when we came back what a surprise!!! As you go through the back door you reach the pool area, with a water fall and a bar.. so lovely, we almost gave up going to see the sunset!! But we had little time in the city, so we went to see the sunset and came back to enjoy the pool and have some drinks. The staff was realy nice, very polite. The room was clean and very confortable. Lots of amenities, such as Body and Bath Works products and news paper in the morning. Breakfast not included, but served by the pool!!

Reviews.Title: “Good out of town hotel”
Reviews.Author: mb9099
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for five nights in March. The hotel is located quite a way out of the main centre of Key West. Rather than being close to Mallory Square and Duval Street, it's along a main road with some other hotels, fast food restaurants and strip malls. It is right next to the sea (no beach) but, like the rest of Key West, they don't make the most of it. The hotel has parking but you'd need to drive/get a taxi to the Mallory Square area and pay to park there. Reception is large and quite impressive. There's no lift so you have to carry your cases upstairs. Check in was efficient enough but we weren't made to feel at all welcome. The room was pleasant, with two double beds. We had a little balcony (just enough room for two chairs) which looked out over the main road to the sea. The room had a fridge which we stocked with drinks etc from the nearby Publix supermarket. (Go here to change travellers cheques, the bank won't do it unless you have an account). Wifi was available in the hotel but didn't work in our room. It also only seemed to work with windows so was no good for our mobile phones. There were two PCs near reception which you could use. The pool area was attractive and had plenty of sun loungers. You could borrow towels although they were a little thin. The pool was heated which was a pleasant surprise. There was an outdoor bar which served a good range of drinks (including some horrid American beer). They also offered food; I had a chicken sandwich which came with homemade coleslaw and was very tasty. If you want to go to the beach, I would recommend going to the Fort Zachary Taylor Historic Park in the west of the island.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Rooms, Great Staff, Nice Pool”
Reviews.Author: ice_harvester
Reviews.Content: Spent three nights with a pool view. Rooms have been recently remodeled. Very nice decorating. Front desk and concierge very helpful. Pool area is very nice. We did not have any children with us, but the hotel is well equipped for kids. Would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Attention to Detail!! Superb Service!! Awesome Pool!! Total Package!!”
Reviews.Author: miamilimodude
Reviews.Content: After reading other travellers reviews, my wife and I decided to stay here at The Inn at Key West!! Boy are we glad we did! We were celebrating our 1st Anniversary, and just needed to get away and relax, and I tell you there is not a more perfect place to do that than at The Inn at Key West. I arranged for Champgane, Rose Petals, and Chocolate covered strawberries in the room upon our arrival, through the concierge. It was PERFECT!! The beds are super comfortable, plenty of pillows, and a great shower with a rain head, and 100+ degree hot water! The Pool is just as advertised!! Biggest and best in the Keys!! Bar Service, Breakfast, Lunch, Etc..... All good!! Concierge made EXCELLENT dinner plans for us at "The Rusty Anchor" and at "Michaels", both I highly reccomend. Bob the concierge arranged for a sunset cruise, as well as for scooters for our stay. If you are really looking for just a great place to chill, relax, and enjoy, you MUST stay at The Inn at Key West!! We will BE BACK AGAIN!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: Jedosca
Reviews.Content: Nice room, up to date decore, nice pool. Sorda away from all the sites you want to see so you either have to drive, cab, or my recommendation get an electric mini car. Hotel Conciere was the best part about this hotel, it was either a man or woman(husband/wife) sitting in the lobby everyday. They would help you book trips and get the best deal on what you were looking for. One negative is we booked our trip on a web special listed by the hotel with"2 complementary" drinks per room per day. We had to ask upon check-in for the coupons and had a hard time getting them. We came back to the front desk the next day and we got the run around by asking if we had the print out. We did not print the info so they told us to come by in 30 minutes after they talked to the Magager and they would see. We got 2 drink coupons, not 2 per day, they said it was 2 for the entire stay. It was not the free drinks as much as the principal of the thing. There is a I-HOP next door for breakfast or you can eat at the hotel for about 15 per head. Really nice pool, but you can not bring drinks into the area, you have to buy from the Tiki bar, which is good but like everything in Key West.....expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough, but...”
Reviews.Author: IMcynthia
Reviews.Content: Although the staff was nice and the hotel was pleasant and clean enough, it was not at all what I expected after seeing the photos and reading the reviews here. We expected: nice, fancy hotel. What we found was: nicely remodeled motel. This does not even approximate a boutique hotel, which one reviewer here called it. We found the Inn filled with smokers, too. People were smoking around the pool all day and night, in the restaurant even at breakfast, and outside their rooms on patios so that the smoke came drifting into our room. Although the pool is large and pleasant and landscaped with tropical plants, it has a bar and sound system speakers which play medium-loud music even in the morning. We were uncomfortable being here, as we prefer quiet and a smoke-free environment.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but - -”
Reviews.Author: customerexp411
Reviews.Content: Summary of Stay: Nice hotel and swimming pool, good check in and check out experience. Breakfast and lunch was above average. The rooms were very nicely decorated and clean with flat screen and nice beds. Not many restaurants in the area, so expect to pay the 15 dollars to go to town. Con: It was almost impossible to eat your lunch or lay by the pool without ciggy smoke wafting its way into beach sun experience. I have nothing against smokers, and think this is a great place for smokers. From the bar maid to the staff, you can always find a drag and an ashtray. Remember smoking in the room will cost you 100 bucks, now I know why I had to initial that statement at check in!

Reviews.Title: “Just As Expected”
Reviews.Author: alexsean0
Reviews.Content: This is the first time I have left a review after staying in a hotel and I used to be a hotel executive. I did a substantial amount of research on the hotels in Key West prior to booking. I traveled with 2 young boys and DURING spring break so I wanted to try and find something nice and away from the downtown scene. This IS the hotel to stay at. The rooms are fantastic and quiet. The pool is amazing and HUGE. Yes it is on the northwestern side of the city, but it is a short cab ride or drive depending on the time you travel. I highly recommend this place. They serve breakfast and lunch onsite which we didn't see or use. Other reviews complained about the price. There is an IHOP right next door for those who wish to save money. There is also an Outback Steakhouse within a short walk from the hotel. We ate downtown once for breakfast at Blue Heaven and the reviews you read about that place are right on. Awesome food and fun atmosphere for all. We also had a dinner at the Turtle Crawl by the marina and that was wonderful as well and would recommend that also. Enjoy your time and DON'T miss the sunset at the square.

Reviews.Title: “Best pool in Key West”
Reviews.Author: packgirl77
Reviews.Content: Rooms were very nice, the perfect place to stay if you want an awesome pool and like being away from the noise of Duval Street. Beds were very comfotable, would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Suprise”
Reviews.Author: curry49ers
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Inn the last week of February. The hotel is newly remodeled with some nice little extras. The Staff was helpful and the bar/pool area excellent. It is on the busy side of the island and away from Duval Street. They did an great job landscaping so you do not feel like you are next to a strip mall or highway. There were 5 of us and taxis were $25 each way. A little pricey but the rooms were less than $175 a night compared to $225+ closer to Duval.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful relaxing pool area best we have ever had”
Reviews.Author: DLVS
Reviews.Content: Loved the pool area, beautiful relaxing tropical area,pictures don't lie. The room we had seemed alittle small for four of us. Over all the price was good but you are a long way from where all the action is. We had a rental car so it wasn't a problem. No veiw other than the pool area.

Reviews.Title: “too far from duval street”
Reviews.Author: tamistilu
Reviews.Content: loved the hotel nice pool,clean rooms, good breakfast. only downfall is paying 15$ one way into town

Reviews.Title: “They are slippery!”
Reviews.Author: Lizdoc39
Reviews.Content: The Inn at Key West did not honor our room request that was done through an agent. When we arrived the front desk was aloof and the room was not what was requested. My daughter had an infant and the room was not acceptable for what was reserved for our family. The front desk told us that we would have to move in a few days to another room. This was not O.K. since there was an infant involved, and they knew of this at time of reservation. We left the premises and went to the Doubletree whom were gracious and helpful for our week long vacation; which we all recommend!!

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay anywhere else but here.”
Reviews.Author: armandoandangeline
Reviews.Content: This hotel has to be the best value in Key West. The photos depict the property perfectly. Treat yourself and spring for the king size bed with the garden. It was worth the extra money. The pool was one of the best I've seen. As for getting around if you have a car it's no problem parking downtown on Simonton St. Half the time we parked for free and the other was not that expensive. The staff were polite and very professional. For those who had complaints it's my belief you could put them in heaven and they would still find something wrong.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, horrible reservation process”
Reviews.Author: Hugemaniac1
Reviews.Content: This is a delightful small botique hotel in a wonderful location. The grounds are lush and tropical and the rooms are very nicely appointed. My problem with this hotel is that they lost my initial reservation in their system. As I had not received any sort of e-mail confirmation I called them back to determine that had happened. They had no record of my reservation so I had to re-book the room. On receipt of my credit card invoice I found I was double charged. I placed a call to the business manager of the hotel, left a message regarding my predicament. I was never re-contacted. Huge customer service issues with this establishment. There are may fine hotels in the Key West area, I'll be staying elsewhere my next trip to Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: kaleidoscope32
Reviews.Content: My friends and I traveled to KW recently and loved our stay at the Inn at KW. The staff were unbelievably helpful and pleasant. The concierge, especially, was extremely knowledgeable about trips, restaurants, and directions. The setting is gorgeous. The plants, flowers, bananas (!) and palms around are a treat to see. It is very safe, very friendly, and we saw lots of different types of families there. We never ate at the cafe - seemed too expensive for breakfast - really, why not grab fruit/bagels and eat at the water? And sure - the location isn't in the "thick of things" and you have to drive into town. But it's not a real hardship - there's more to kw than duval, and if you drive around you realize that very quickly! I really enjoyed our stay here and will come back again.

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel but the charm factor of Key West is missing”
Reviews.Author: BulldogMatt
Reviews.Content: We had a very nice stay at the Inn at Key West for 5 nights in February. I would recommend this hotel to any traveler to Key West but with advisories. The Hotel is very cute and the rooms were spacious and comfortable. The pool area is fantastic and it seemed that the clientele was diverse and friendly. Families with kids, single travelers, couples (gay and straight) and good range of ages. The only two knocks I could mention were one of most important, this hotel is in New Key West, a couple of miles away from the charming and quaint area of Old Key West. This is an important distinction, as you will definitely miss the "charm" of Old Key West. Some families and budget minded travelers will appreciate being in the New Key West and cheaper restaurants, shops prevail. Also, I am not sure if it was a bad week but I found the service overall to be disappointing. James at the Front Desk was nice but other than that, no real standouts. One gentlemen was nice enough to take our picture by the pool. Besides these two, the other staff was underwhelming. In fact, some of the staff averted eye contact of any kind. This was surprising and unexpected.

Reviews.Title: “Pool Haven”
Reviews.Author: bucsal
Reviews.Content: This hotel probably has the best pool area we have ever experienced - the hotel web-site depicts it perfectly. It is visually stunning with plenty of sun-loungers. Whilst we were there none of the guests were guilty of the universally irritating practice of â€œreservingâ€� beds, which together with the amount of space available ensured we never felt rushed or overcrowded. This was helped by the really friendly and efficient pool attendant who also provided helpful local knowledge. However, everything was not perfect. The rooms are just OK by American standards â€“ fairly compact with noisy air-con. We had a standard pool-side room but there are others in the main building available at a premium rate which could be better â€“ I guess these were used in the web photos. Also you need a car/cab to get into town so the pool attendants tip on where to park for free was invaluable.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Place!”
Reviews.Author: TeenBathUK
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at The Inn. The room was fantastic, clean, spacious and nicely furnished and decorated, with a very comfy bed. The pool was lovely but breakfast was about average. The computers for guests' use in the lobby were free and a great extra that we used and appreciated. Staff were very helpful and polite. The only downside was its location, as it is not located near to the main life of Key West, but still just a short taxi ride away.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely Underrated”
Reviews.Author: SUENCHAZ
Reviews.Content: This place is definitely underrated. Pros: It has an awesome pool surrounded by tropical plants. The rooms are beautifully decorated and spacious. The lobby is cheerful and bright. They had complimentary computers in the lobby for general use. The tiki bar is fabulous and convenient. Staff was helpful and courteous. This was our third stay at the I@KW. I love it there. Cons: it is far from Duval Street and a cab will cost you $15 each way. The bathtub treads could have used a good scrubbing. The pool was cold. We got caught short once without toilet paper and we had to ask for an ironing board. But I think these are minor irritations compared to all the good things about it. I would highly recommend this place as long as you have a car.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely room with very thin walls”
Reviews.Author: FlaTripper75
Reviews.Content: On the whole the Inn at Key West is well worth the rate they charge. The rooms and hotel grounds are lovely and clean. My only complaint is the paper thin walls. My daughter and I stayed for two nights. The first night we were awakened at 4:00 am by Duval Street revelers and then again at 5:15 am by the garbage truck. On the second night we were awakened at 12:30 am by our snoring neighbor. I would most likely stay again but I would ask for a room on the north side of the Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, good value, clean rooms, great pool.”
Reviews.Author: SarahCoops
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay, it's a little bit further out of town than most places but quieter as a result. Costs about $15 in a taxi to town or plenty of parking if you want to drive. Friendly staff, clean everywhere and comfortable, relaxing rooms and very helpful concierge. Lovely pool, great pool bar and nice food from the poolside cafe. Overall we loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Pool”
Reviews.Author: Travel-Knights
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as part of a Florida Trip for two nights. A very quiet and relaxed hotel. Nice room, fantastic pool, great place to relax and see Key West from.

Reviews.Title: “This place rocks”
Reviews.Author: Lauren54321
Reviews.Content: This place is great, especially considering what you get for the money. At check -in, our room wasn't ready and we were immediately given 2 free drinks from the tiki bar (they were great). The front desk man, James, was super-knowledgeable and very, very helpful. The pool is GREAT although there weren't always enough lounge chairs. The outdoor cafe is GREAT (went there twice for lunch). Everything there was recently renovated, so the room was beautiful and had everything we needed. Only thing I didn't like was the location of the room. It was way in the back of the hotel and since you enter the room from outside (the room was not in the main bldg.) you kind of get a "motel-y" feeling. It didn't matter much though, because the room, pool and lobby were beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful pool, clean and quiet Key West experience...”
Reviews.Author: Linescrew
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Inn at Key West based on a recommendation by a local and the nice pictures of the pool and grounds. I stayed there December 18-23, 2008. Rooms were clean, staff were friendly, especially the Tiki bar staff. Free parking and free Wi-fi. The only concern anyone might have is that it is 2.5 miles from all the Duval street action, though you can walk it in about 45 minutes or a $14.00 cab ride. I enjoyed the quiet location and would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Ab_from_ct
Reviews.Content: Very nice facility. Recently renovated. Staff was very helpful, room was clean and spacious. The pool area is very lush and inviting. We would go back in a minute. The perfect weather didn't hurt either, although the hotel can't take too much credit for that. The only wish that I would add, would be for a shuttle to downtown. The cabs got expensive after a while, but at least we were not involved in the hubbub of the old town area.

Reviews.Title: “It really is a sanctuary!!”
Reviews.Author: natakia1108
Reviews.Content: I have to remind myself to write reviews....because I use tripadvisor for ALL of my trips. My husband & I really needed this get-a-way and it's exactly what the doctor ordered!!:-) We arrived early around 1pm, checkin is at 3pm. However, Beth who is leaving soon was so nice to us & allowed us to checkin early & got us an upgraded room. We stayed in room 116, it has a lovely private balcony. If you're sitting down you see beautiful lush trees & if you're standing you can see the pool area. The room was lovely. We especially loved the shower! I read in previous reviews that some complained of the too many trees blocking the sun...GET OVER IT. The trees are so beautiful and the their pool is the best on the island. The bar & pool close at 10pm (they have security on Fri & Sat enforce the no swimming after 10pm) but the rest of the days as long as you're quite it's no big deal! Some also complained of the hotel being too far...come on people the island is so darn small, my husband & I are renting a car now, 3 days...cute red bug for only $83 & thus far, we've had no problems parking at all. I must say that the restautrants that they will try & get you to go to are costly & I don't think are the best. Tonight we ate at 7 Fishes...small but DEVINE...the bill was $69 total included app's, 2 entrees, & wine...I'll write a reveiw...read restaurant reviews on tripadvisor, that's what I did & they've been great. Look overall this is a nice quant hotel, very relaxing & it's not in walking distance to Duvall, but it's a great stay, they have complimentary computers & a really nice 24hr gym, which I used this morning...had it all to myself. But once again, we've had absolutely no problem finding parking spaces; however, it's not extremely crowed or busy so that could change, but it's been good...it's been great not having to take taxies. Also, El Sibenyo (cuban restaurant...I'm buthering the spelling...but read the reviews...was CHEAP & GREAT!!!, we're going back tomorrow for lunch). I just wanted to make sure I wrote this review. We love Key West & this hotel...we'll be back!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: JaneSimpsonBahamas
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel. Clean large room, Newly refurbished. Helpful friendly staff. Gorgoues tropical pool and tiki bar with a good happy hour. I'd recommend it to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: BethAnnP
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel - very clean, very nicely decorated. The only problem is the food selections - (there could be more on the lunch menu). This was our second stay here & the people are friendly - especially the bar staff - Gracie gave us some great recommendations around town. I highly recommend this hotel when traveling to Key West because you are far enough from town, but close enough to get there very easily by car or cab.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms and an even better pool, shame about the distance from town”
Reviews.Author: SexyBeryl
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel in late October/early November 2008 and thought the place was fantastic. The rooms are lovely with all the amenities you would need (fridge, hairdryer , iron plus shampoo & soap etc replaced daily). Free internet access at reception. The pool was amazing, with plenty of sun loungers. The pool could possibly do with a few less palm tree's as there were not many spots which were in the sun all day. The only draw back is the distance to old town (where all the bars are). We walked it a couple of times and it takes about an hour. We also tried the local bus service, but waited over half hour! It was also easy enough to get a taxi, but it costs about $15 each way. Although the plus side of the location is that it is relatively quiet and you get a lot more for your money then you would in Old Town. I would have given the hotel a 5 star rating if they offered a free or cheap bus service onto the town (which the Doubletree resort apparently offers).

Reviews.Title: “VERY nice for the money”
Reviews.Author: Y3Kilroy
Reviews.Content: A beautiful, clean, relaxing, accomodating hotel. Definitely the nicest hotel pool on the island, which was clean, and not overcrowded. A full service tiki bar, with a server who will refresh your drinks while you relax, and charge them to your room. The cafe has the BEST cheeseburgers, and waitstaff was sooo nice and friendly. But they don't serve dinner. Our room was larger than I anticipated, with a granite countertop sink and marble floors in the bathroom. And yes, the A/C worked just fine, despite everyone complaining about it. Not a noisy hotel at all. My only complaint might be about the coffee/ housekeeping. I even left them notes, with decent tips, requesting more regular coffee packets, and to skip on the decaf. They would bring us all decaf!! The soaps/shampoo are Bath & Body Works~ very nice. Some days they would give us 2 bathmats, and not enough towels. Weird. But the front desk was very accomadating about these tiny concerns. Oh, and you don't get a fridge in your room, unless you want to pay the extra fee. But hey, this is Key West. Go out and eat!! . It is on the far side of the island, away from the Duval Street madness, but if you are looking for the best of both worlds like us, this is it. The front desk had no problems calling us a Taxi, which was there within 5 minutes, every day. And it's a 10 minute ride to party central. They have a concierge who will arrange for Scooter delivery right to the hotel, which is honestly the best, and most fun way of getting around the island. But if you hang locally, there is an IHOP right next door, a small neighborhood bar who's always grilling food outside, a liquor store, and full size grocery store all within walking distance. Despite the signs prohibiting it, we even made drinks in our room, and carried them down to the pool, where no one bothered us about it. For me, it was my 2nd trip to Key West, and the better one. It was nice to have friendly hotel staff. (Last time I stayed at the defunct Atlantic Shores, where they seemed annoyed by our patronage) Unless, I can find a better deal, I'm staying here again, but probably opting for a refridgerator, and taking my own coffee.

Reviews.Title: “Not a Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: kna85
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were married in Key Largo at the Marriott. The people were friendly, our room was wonderful, and we had great time. So perhaps our expectations were a bit too high when we arrived at the Inn at Key West. The location is the first disappointing part. Then, we received a room with two queen beds and we had thought we were getting one king. When we walked into our tiny room all I could think was that I had spent way too money on this place. In attempts to lift our spirits we made our way to the "tiki bar"...another disappointment. Neither the bartender that day nor a different bartender the next day were friendly. They unenthusiasticly threw together my mojito, which had old slimy brown mint, and served it to me as if nothing was wrong. Long story short we ended up leaving a day early to go back to Islamorada/Key Largo. WHEN WE WENT TO THE FRONT DESK AND TOLD THEM WHY WE WERE LEAVING EARLY THE WOMAN SAID SHE WAS NOT SURPRISED!! SHE SAID IT WAS NOT THE FIRST TIME , BUT PEOPLE DO NOT TAKE THE TIME TO REPORT IT!!! It is completely unbelievable to me that so many people hae been unhappy and nothing has been done. So I am taking the time to tell you, do not waste your money here! Stay in Islamorada or Key Largo.

Reviews.Title: “DON'T UNDERSTAND THE NEGATIVE REVIEWS....IT'S A GREAT PLACE TO STAY!!”
Reviews.Author: swoz
Reviews.Content: I honestly don't understand the negative reviews of this hotel! I'm glad I didn't let the negative feedback affect my decision to book this hotel. 30+ family members stayed here for my son's wedding. We stayed here 7 nights (7/15-7/22). Stayed in a Superior room, poolside with king bed and sofa bed (room 122). Room was very clean, spacious, flat panel TV, little patio (private, with fence around it) and GREAT bathroom, loved the shower!! EVERYONE had a fantastic time...the pool is magnificant. and is the largest in Key West. Tiki bar was great as were the bartenders. Never had breakfast, but had several very good lunches at the tiki bar. Never encountered any staff that were rude or unpleasant...they were very friendly. The pool was SPOTLESS and the pool and surrounding area were maintained very well (although the bathroom by the pool needed more often tending to....but with the number of "dripping wet" people going in and out I can see why the floor was always soaked). All of our guests had deluxe or superior rooms. Although a couple of guests had parking lot views, which was disappointing to one of my sisters, it wasn't a major issues as we were never in our rooms. We spent afternoons at the pool/tiki bar and had a blast!! Every one of us said we would definitely stay here again. A special "thank you" to Sandy Black, Tom the bellman (super nice man), and Esa at the front desk.....as well as the rest of the staff. I read reviews all the time and they can make your head spin with so many positive...then negative......but the choice to stay here regardless of any negative reviews was the right choice and I highly recommend this property. Our room had updated Tommy Bahama furniture. Some of our guests didn't, but their main concern was cleanliness and all of our rooms were clean and the lobby is BEAUTIFUL. BTW, they have washers and dryers on the premises which was a plus. We will DEFINITELY be back!!!!

Reviews.Title: “How can this place have great ratings?”
Reviews.Author: kuteeme
Reviews.Content: It is beyond my human comprehension as to how someone can rave about this hotel. It was barely a step above a Days Inn, and that is actually a compliment. The pictures are NOTHING like the hotel. We booked this hotel about a month before we went down there, based on the reviews. First of all, we did not know it was Lobster Fest until the day before we got there (our fault). When we booked the hotel, we had asked for 2 queens, as it was 4 of us. When we checked in, we were told we were only getting a king and a pull-out sofa. We had booked this way ahead of time! They said because we didn't book directly to the hotel, they could not accommodate our request. The hotel was full, so they could not swap our rooms (the receptionist was nice and pleasant and would've probably given us another room if they had one available). When I walked in the room (which we had paid more for the Deluxe room), it looked like my grandmother's bedroom. It was very small, the decor was cheap, undated, and the bathroom very small. It just wasn't what we paid for. I immediately called around other hotels, but there were none available. We were stuck. We called downstairs for pillows and blankets and all they had was 1 blanket. Our friends had to sleep on the sofa bed, sharing a pillow. We went down to the pool, hoping it would be as nice as the picture, and I was disappointed. Although the pool is nice (I give it that), it is much smaller than pictured and not nearly as beautiful and inviting as pictured. Please do yourselves a favor and stay somewhere else. Is not worth paying this much for an over-hyped place, unless of course you don't mind paying for platinum and getting silver instead. We will NEVER go back there.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: HollyA
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a nice hotel for a decent price and we got more than we expecetd with the Inn at Key West. Our room was gorgeous...dark woods, comfy king bed, great bathroom. The pool was huge and beautifully landscaped. Our room was in the main building so very convenient. They are remodeling the rooms so mine was one of the nicer ones that was remodeled post hurricane but my brother had one that wasn't renovated yet and was very happy as well. We had a HUGE flat screen TV and a rainshower shower head as well as a regular shower head...very nice. I got a terrible sunburn and spent the good part of a day in the room recooperating and enjoyed every minute of it! The bed and linens were nice and comfy and if it wasn't for all the amazing things we had to do I could have stayed in that bed all week!! I found the staff really accomodating and sweet. They even allowed us to stay in the pool in the evening (although the sign says dusk to dawn they seemed to allow swimming until at least 11 as long as you were quiet which was so nice and completely appreciated) The pool was beautiful with a great hidden jacuzzi area and waterfall. Pool towels are available during the day but after dusk they aren't so if you head in at night you might wish to take a towel from your room.

Reviews.Title: “Would Not Return”
Reviews.Author: louisanthony
Reviews.Content: The Inn was more like a Motel 6. The room was dark and small. The web site for the Inn gives a very false impression as to the quality and size of the room. It is also a $15.00 cab ride to town. We left after one night and booked a better room, closer to town for the same price on the beach! The Inn at Key West is not worth the money. Stay elsewhere for the same amount, closer to town and of better quality.

Reviews.Title: “We love the Inn at Key West!”
Reviews.Author: navytravelers
Reviews.Content: I'm not sure who wrote the most recent review, their standards are obviously way above ours! I can't imagine "immediately checking out" of this hotel! We LOVED the Inn at Key West. The rooms are decorated in a tropical theme without going over the top, we had a great mattress and comfy bedding, our room (a standard) had a huge flat screen TV with DVD player. The furniture was a dark teak-like wood, nice french doors opened into a bathroom with travertine tile and a marble vanity. Bath and Body works products are complimentary. There is an armoire in the bathroom with a safe, and a dresser in the main room with a fridge. We were on the second floor with a great view of the beautiful pool with lush landscaping. I was impressed with the grounds, staff, and tropical oasis the owners have created at the Inn at Key West. I'm not sure what people expect in Key West, it's not Miami, and that's exactly why we vacationed there. I guess for those whose taste is more highbrow, there is a Hyatt, which I'm sure looks just like any other Hyatt in the world. The Inn at Key West is a wonderful hotel with Key West charm without being "quirky" which often means old and not well maintained. This place is updated, full of charm, and maintained impeccably.

Reviews.Title: “Not like the website shows it to be”
Reviews.Author: bud88
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for 3 nights based on reviews and the hotel website and was very disappointed when we checked in. The room was nothing at all like the website showed it to be. I don't understand the raving reviews on this hotel. We immediately checked out and found a decent place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Five Star Stay!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: sheilaflx
Reviews.Content: I was surprised with a trip to Key West for my 50th Birthday by my Husband and Daughter! The Inn at Key West was Absolutely Wonderful. Rooms were large, clean and beautifully furnished! Beth at the front desk was extremely helpful. All the staff was overly attentive. KT at the Tiki Bar was very charming! The Mojitos were the best in Key West! I can't wait to go back to the Keys and we will stay at the Inn again! The tropical surroundings of the pool and spa were breathtaking! I will recommend this hotel to everyone who is visiting the Keys!

Reviews.Title: “the best”
Reviews.Author: toddjames
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel, great rooms the pool is very nice the grounds are very clean as is the rooms. we just got back from the Atlantis hotel in paradise island and liked this place much more .

Reviews.Title: “Great place!”
Reviews.Author: rrleisurelady
