Reviews.Content: Booked several rooms from info on website & Expedia six months in advance of 4-08 stay. Management was very accommodating on upgrading possibilities. Purpose was family and friends attending destination wedding in Key West. Pool area is beautiful. Deluxe rooms very nice, great bedding. Slight negative due to closet space for shirt/skirt length only and not much drawer/storage space. Other reviewers complaints about crowing roosters, while true, are not unique to this hotel. The free-ranging chickens are EVERYWHERE in Key West - and they don't seem to know the time of day isn't always sunrise! We were never awakened by the crowing. It isn't within walking distance of tourist areas, but that is also an advantage at times - depends on how long you're staying and what you're interested in.

Reviews.Title: “great!”
Reviews.Author: jump6
Reviews.Content: great stay, clean rooms.they even bumped us up to a suite.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: humann4
Reviews.Content: My husband, a few friends and I went down to key west for memorial day weekend. Intially we booked our stay at the Radisson but had to leave because the roaches were hogging the bed....Anyway, we walked a few hotels down to The Inn at Key West and were very fortunate to get a room. This was the best thing to happen to us all weekend. We really lucked out, this hotel is beautiful, The staff is amazing and the pool is wonderful. I have nothing bad to say about this hotel except for it may be alittle to far from all the action downtown. Not to worry there are shuttles and taxis all over this place. We will definitly be returning on our next trip to Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: FritzAtlanta
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful six night stay at The Inn. It was quiet and cozy. The staff was very attentive expecially in the cafe and pool. We booked the Wind and Wine Package thru Sandy at the hotel. This package included a) champagne, chocolate covered strawberries, rose petals and candles upon our arrival, it was very romantic; b) it also included a full breakfast at the cafe which was a really great breakfast, the fried eggs were perfect! c) the best part of this package was a sunset sail and wine tasting cruise (only 20 people were on the Danger sail boat), this was the ultimate part of our package! Our room was luxurious, with the Tommy Bahama decor it looked like something out of a magazine. There is a tiki bar at the pool with food service from the cafe for lunch along with great bartenders mixing any drink you want! We really liked staying at the hotel pool when the cruise ships were docked, which brought a lot of people into the Duval area. The only drawback from our stay is that The Inn is located in "new town" (not close to Duval Street - "old town"), we were getting into our rental car, find parking and then walk around the Duval area. I would definately recommend this hotel to anyone who wants a quiet relaxing stay in Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Good for kids”
Reviews.Author: pezVirginiaBeach
Reviews.Content: Beautiful pool for the kids. Staff very friendly. The food at the bar is very good. However, the rooms are not clean; there is no refrigerator in the room and breakfast is not included. Prices are high, but I think this is common in Key West. To go to Duval we would drive and park the car in a public parking. 10/15 minutes driving. Overall, we had a very good time. I think that the swimming made the difference. In fact, if you go to Key West to go to the beach, it is a wrong choice. Beaches are not nice and the water is nothing special; they did not meet our expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: YolandaMN
Reviews.Content: Stayed for niece's wedding. Rates were fine and Hotel was great. Did not find the fact that it was located away from Duvall street to be a minus. In fact its location is very quiet from the pool area. Kid's loved the pool and I loved the Tiki Bar. Always had easy acess to Duvall, the sunset cruise and Mallory Square, either through shuttle or taxi at night. Used rental car during day and had no problem with parking at hotel. Kids went parasailing with Fury outfit and everything went smoothly. Food at the Conch Republic was great and a nice harbor view.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: missmoeTallahassee
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for about a week and it was wonderful! We had the deluxe room which was recently renovated and it was very nice and modern. The pool was the best part of the hotel!! I would recommend any age group stay here. I would also recommend not using the shuttle as it is a waste of money and some of the shuttle guys were rude. Next time we go we will rent a car. Also make sure to keep an eye on your stuff since a couple of my boyfriends shirts he bought went missing. Overall we had a great time and will come back!

Reviews.Title: “A tropical paradise”
Reviews.Author: joemay60
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I went to Key West for the first time and definitely picked a winner staying at the Inn at Key West!! Great Hotel!! A Tropical paradise!! The hotel was beautiful and the pool was the best. Great poolside service. The bartenders (especially Bill) were very helpful suggesting places to go and things to do. The front desk and concierge were very friendly and helpful as well. We drove, took a cab and used the shuttle to get to Duval Street. Either way works for the short trip into town. The shuttle worked out best for us. We had breakfast at the Inn and it was delish!! We will definitely be back. The room was very comfortable and beautifully decorated. The shower was great and the TV was very nice. We looked at other places as we walked around and we both agree there is no need to look any further. The Inn at Key West is the place weâ€™ll be staying on our next trip to the Keys!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved This Place!”
Reviews.Author: keeree98
Reviews.Content: After an unpleasant stay in islamorada, I was HOPING the Inn at Key West was as nice as it looked online. It was GORGEOUS! The room had nice linens, a plasma TV, and was very clean! The pool area was amazing! It is a huge pool with lots of sunny seating and drinks served to you all day! There is also a hot tub (did not use). There is a nice bar and breakfast and lunch onsite. I did not use it, but they just opened a workout room. I would really recommend this hotel for a nice relaxing stay!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Trip!”
Reviews.Author: shellyscott
Reviews.Content: We were more than satisfied with our stay at the Inn at Key West. The rooms were clean, the staff were friendly and the pool was beautiful! We had the best vacation we have had in a very long time!

Reviews.Title: “Cozy Charm - Nice Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: beachygirlNC
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at The Inn at Key West back in March and it was a great experience. We were there for 3 nights and 4 days. It was our first time visiting Key West. While Key West was not quite what we expected it to be, this hotel was very nice and beautiful. The rooms (we stayed in an upgraded room) looked just like the beautiful pictures on the internet site and the pool was spectacular. Other good points to mention were the breakfast buffett - loved it!!! And the the young lady at the conceirge desk was fantastic!! She was so helpful as we spent nearly an hour trying to figure out what excursions to partake in. However, when going out on a boat adventure for the day - please be sure to make sure the weather will be warm enough. We went on a 6 hour adventure cruise and just about froze! The water was too cold to get into and the wind on the boat was down-right chilly. Another downfall was that there are pretty much NO beaches on the island!! We were not expecting this at all!! There were maybe 3 places on the entire island to actually get into the ocean - the rest is just sound. The restaurants and atmospere was great, but everything was a little more pricey (especially parking) than we had anticipated. After looking at the other hotels on the island - The Inn at Key West is definitely at the TOP of the list - if we ever head back down that way.............we will stay there again :)

Reviews.Title: “loved it !!!!”
Reviews.Author: frankofmontreal
Reviews.Content: well over the years i stayed at the fairmont princess in bermuda the fairmont pricess in Scottsdale AZ the 4 seasons in Santa Barbara the Omni Royal Orleans the Ritz Carlton in St-thomas usvi the Grand Floridian in Disney the regency Hyatt gainey ranch in Scottsdale twice the Loews Coronado bay resort in San Diego and also the Wyndham sugar bay resort in St-thomas recently why am i listing this is simply to mention that i have a base of reference and The Inn at Key West can be considered by my wife and i a great place to stay in Key west .. you can go there without an hesitation . Why other had bad experience ?? i dont know and i dont care either ! i would go back now if i could !!!! the photos on their site are real !!! no gimmick !!! what you see is what you get !!!! quote me !!!!!! francois from montreal QC

Reviews.Title: “Here for our 26th anniversary, great!!!”
Reviews.Author: mrsjetsetter
Reviews.Content: We arrived March 27,2008 -30th for our 26th anniversary and couldn't be more impressed by this hotel. From the moment we walked into the lobby,checking in at the desk, concierge service very helpful, and the room made me feel I was in Key West. I reserved a standard room online, but I think we got a much better room. Bathroom very modern, furnishings very impressive and flat screen tv on the wall. Our room was facing the parking lot.Other reviews were bothered by that , but not us since we only come back late at night to sleep anyway. Didn't hear any noise from the roadside either. Pool area very tropical feeling. We had a car and didn't mind driving into town, but beware of paying for parking at the meter lots til midnite or paying a flat fee at a parking lot. Only negative thing to say was we had to call once to replenish our towels, otherwise we will definitely come again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the large pool and atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: brianbdg
Reviews.Content: The outdoor pool here has to be the biggest in Key West. Really beautiful and well maintained. Poolside service and bar were just great. Rooms were nice, and would recommend poolside for less road noise. Recommend IHOP next door for breakfast and lunch. Shuttle to Duval St was pricey. 2 to 3 miles to downtown. Would highly recommend, but rates for '08 went thru the roof.

Reviews.Title: “Motel at Key West”
Reviews.Author: g0ngj00liz
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the "Inn" over St. Patrick's Day Weekend. The Inn is really a fluffed up Motel 6. The pictures on their website are extremely miss leading - the photographer did their job very well. The lobby was nice. The pool looked nice. I never went into the pool because everyone was smoking around the pool and the water was really warm which I did not find ideal in 90 degree weather. We were booked into a Standard room which overlooked one of the parking lots and had a rooster outside which started crowing at 5am until 8pm. The room had old furniture and the couch was so filthy we wouldn't dream of sitting on it. The bed was old and lumpy. Some of the pillow cases had odd black spots on them. The bathroom is ok but is obviously in need of an update as the tub had stains and the toilet had rust stains. Housekeeping didn't come during normal hours but stopped by at 5 in the evening and didn't wait for us to open the door but just barged in. They ended up never cleaning our room while we were there. The hotel ran out of towels (how I have no idea since the number of rooms in the hotel doesn't change). The front desk was not very helpful. They hung up on me three times in a row before I could get through to them. The food was ok if you're in a pinch. I would not recommend staying at the Inn. For what you'll end up paying you can stay closer to downtown in a much, much nicer place. The best part about the whole stay was the rooster.

Reviews.Title: “Awful! Stay away!”
Reviews.Author: surferfamily
Reviews.Content: We stayed two nights at this overpriced hotel! It looks just like a dirty motel with filthy rugs and roaches! The staff was rude and not very helpful! You can stay at lovely B&B in old town that is actually cheaper than this dump! Please stay away!

Reviews.Title: “It doesn't get much better”
Reviews.Author: Bob536
Reviews.Content: My wife and I enjoyed this hotel immensely. We had one of the recently renovated Superior Kings on the lower level. I should qualify, in case you have a phobia against lower levels, that the entrance to these first level rooms is only accessible from a Tommy Bahama decorated interior hallway that is nicer than any Hilton, Hyatt or Marriott that we have stayed in. The room also has a somewhat private and enclosed patio with a table and two chairs, weather permitting of course. As everyone else has already testified, the pool area, wonderfully landscaped grounds, hot tub, and Tiki Bar was/is the best that the island has to offer, certainly better than any of the others that we saw during the week we spent there, and we visited most of them. And a perk from having the island's largest pool with only 105 rooms, is that there is actually enough lounge chairs to accomodate everyone there. Imagine that!!! That's a first for us traveling in peak season. I personally did not consider the location of the Inn (being 3 miles away from downtown) an issue, as it was offset by the peace and quiet, free and easy parking, and convenient location to groceries, liquor stores, and restaurants. Besides, the elevation of Key West only varies by a couple of feet, so bike riding gets you anywhere you want to go without breaking much of a sweat.... well... you know....weather permitting. The Superior King room, though a tad small, was also decorated better than any Hilton, Hyatt or Marriott. In addition to all those Tommy Bahama caribbean fixtures, there were all those other little amenities such as big towels, a choice of two showerheads, a makeup mirror, a small refrigerator, a huge plasma wall mounted TV, and a pull out sofa bed. In short...the room is just decorated beautifully with all the extras. On the downside, Service and friendliness was just so- so, and maybe this is the one area that does not live up to some of the larger snob chains I mentioned. But you'll keep more cash in your wallet here. Bottom line...after 5 days at the Inn at Key West, and 3 days at the Fort Lauderdale Beach Hilton, it's not even close as to where I would return. But a word of caution folks....I understand the Superior Kings are significantly better than the other rooms, so ask for one of the renovated rooms. We'll be going back next year to the Inn at Key West, and we have never repeated the same hotel before...ever. Here we will.

Reviews.Title: “Great, but get the right room”
Reviews.Author: Sophus
Reviews.Content: This hotel is like a lot of things -- it really depends on what you want and what you like. If you want to be by the action on Duval St., this is not the place for you. If you want to be able to go to Duval St. and then leave it behind, this is the place. We traveled with our 2 kids, aged 8 and 9, which is why we wanted to be able to get away from Duval, and they loved the pool. There's a cool tiki bar, the rooms were clean and nice, there's breakfast and lunch at the hotel and a great-looking lobby. The main attraction is the pool, it's beautiful and makes you feel you are at the beach. Be aware that this side of the island doesn't have the great restaurants you'll find near Duval/Malory Square. Lastly, the room location makes a big difference; our first room was off the parking lot and we asked to change to a room near the pool, and then we really felt like we were on vacation. I am sure we'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: brown96
Reviews.Content: I will admit that I was slightly disappointed when I first drove up to the Inn at Key West - it looked like another motel on the side of the road - but I was pleasantly surprised when we checked in. The room was terrific (quiet and clean), the bathroom spacious and modern, and the pool is amazing. The Inn turned out to be the best hotel that my wife and I stayed on our trip, and one of the highlights of our Key West leg. I wish the temperature control was a little more modern (no thermostat, just a high/low AC unit), but otherwise no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: Stump_fiddle
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed a great 3 days at the Inn, except for being there when they broke an all-time record low temperature for Key West - 45 degrees! Nice pool and very friendly staff. Very good concierge service.

Reviews.Title: “Too far away and no character...”
Reviews.Author: jmink4a5
Reviews.Content: Key West is a pretty small island and all the fun stuff is centrally located. This hotel is off a main highway about 3 miles from the center of town. All of the hotels in town have a lot of character (old converted Victorian mansions, etc.) - this is just a standard hotel with decent rooms and a nice pool. 3 miles might not sound far, but given the hassle, inconvenience and cost of getting back and forth to town, it is a big issue (plus the fact that you are located next to an IHOP and Wendy's and the roosters woke us up every day at 6AM). The last day I was there with my girlfriend we were going to lay by the pool until our flight but decided to rent a scooter again and zip around town enjoying the unique fun of Key West...you can lay at a pool anywhere. Next time I book a place in town...

Reviews.Title: “Great Spot To Relax”
Reviews.Author: yeradog2
Reviews.Content: The Inn is a great little spot to relax. The room was average, but the pool, tiki bar and little outdoor restaurant were comfortable and relaxing. If you are expecting high class service, this isn't the place, but if you are looking for just an easy laid-back atmosphere, this is the spot to be. The pool is beautiful, not too crowded or crazy. The staff was attentive and helpful. It's away from the Key West action, but if that's not important, this is the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “roadside motel, but trippled prices”
Reviews.Author: The_King_of_Lake
Reviews.Content: "The Inn at Key West" has accomodations at the level of roadside motels, but charges much higher prices. Rooms are small, with uncomfortable beds, dirty rug, and worn-out furniture. The only places that look better than other motels are the lobby and pool. However, nobody sleeps in the lobby... The pool area was crowded, with many smokers wandering around, giving second-hand smoke to children cheerfully playing. I booked a room with two queen beds, but they gave me one with a king bed. Talking to the hotel staff and customer rep of Hotels.com proved to be wasting of time -- almost an hour to be exact. Did I mention that the hotle is inconveniently located outside of the old town where the attractions are? I'll never stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “gorgeous!”
Reviews.Author: SuperLekker
Reviews.Content: After a long flight to Miami and the drive to Key West I didn't much care about what the hotel was like as long as they had a bed! This place was great and I would definitely stay here again. Easy to find - right on the main road and with plenty of parking, the staff were friendly and helpful, and the little shop at reception sold snacks and drinks which were most welcome! Our room was a good size, with lovely furnishings in keeping with the Key West vibe, and it had one of the biggest bathrooms I've ever seen with lovely toiletries. Aircon was efficient and not too noisy and it was great to be able to park outside the room rather than lug our bags across the hotel. The pool is stunning - surrounded by great foliage, it gets sunlight until almost sundown and there are plenty of comfortable loungers and chairs. There is a bar right by the pool and a cafe too. We didn't have breakfast at the hotel but went to the Ihop next door. There are also drugstores and a Publix up the road if you like to keep drinks in the refrigerator, which the room also had (and it was quiet too, yay). The old town is about a 10 minute drive away and as we weren't too sure about parking we got the shuttle bus - while a bit pricey for a couple it's a great deal if there are a few of you. Nice to be able to go into town and have a few drinks and not have to worry about driving back! Great hotel - can't recommend it enough.

Reviews.Title: “Would Stay Here Everytime I Came To Key West!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Richnsht
Reviews.Content: This was my first time in Key West. I did book a Superior King room. The Room and hotel were magnificant! Very clean, comfortable, and the pool was breathtaking. My wife and I did have a car which was very convienient, as getting to Duval street you need some form of transportation. The hotel has a shuttle for $23/day per room, or there are taxis (I don't know the cost). The staff was pleasant and accommodating, and there was a concierge on site to help with your activities. The pool was a tropical oasis with palm trees surrounding, and they had a tikki bar with waiter service, and provided floating mats for the pool. The bedding was extremely comfortable, and the shower had a regular head in addition to a wide centered head above you, in a marble tiled bath. Our room also had a 42" plasma (no HD), DVD player, private terrace, and a wall AC unit which worked great. Our stay here was perfect, we didn't eat our meals at the hotel, as we went to the great restaurants for those. YOU MUST GO TO BLUE HEAVEN FOR BREAKFAST ON YOUR TRIP!!! If we go back to key west this is where we'd stay without giving it a second thought.

Reviews.Title: “Nice i you get the right room”
Reviews.Author: Oliverocks
Reviews.Content: The Inn is a nice hotel, our room was lovely inside but we booked a pool view and as we were the last room on the ground floor there was absolutely no view of the pool. Our garden was also not nice, just a concrete square with a huge wooden gate leading out to the side road. Our friends who we went away with were further down the corridor and had a great garden with plants and a lovely view of the pool (we booked identical rooms) so we ended up just sitting in their garden sipping cocktails instead! The bathrooms were amazing with great showers. The pool itself was lovely and the hotel minibus into key west was really handy.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable but away from the action”
Reviews.Author: Gungadin99
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Inn in October in a deluxe room which had a quality feel to it and the bathroom included all the usual goodies and a twin head walk in shower. Big TV, free in-room internet connection, nice lobby area, big pool and plenty of parking. The room price was good for the quality of the room but did not include breakfast or the shuttle into town, so factor another $45/night for that. The shuttle driver did give us some useful vouchers for cheap drinks and good advice about the down town area. I expect they make some money from this but we didn't know where to start anyway! My suggestion is splash out on the deluxe room and use the shuttle if you expect to finish partying by midnight. Otherwise stay at a hotel downtown and add the shuttle/breakfast price onto your comparison. However you may need to spend a lot more for such a nice room.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: myra_jean
Reviews.Content: The hotel is quite nice, located in a good area where we can grocery shop, see a movie, get our nails done, and much more without the need of a car. The pool is wonderful. Our room, however, is quite small. We decided to "splurge" and get a Deluxe room (king bed with a queen sleeper). It is a tight fit for three people. I found that the picture from the website is accurate to how our room really looks, I suppose we just expected a little more space to walk . There is no fridge and the hotel also lacks a fitness center. Don't get me wrong though, it's one of the nicer hotels in the area, and I would most likely stay here again. The city is wonderful, and it only took us about 10 minutes to drive to Old Town.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!!”
Reviews.Author: chris52leo
Reviews.Content: The Inn at Key West is a beautiful hotel with charming and friendly staff. The room was very comfortable, clean and quiet. The pool is a lovely, exoticly landscaped and relaxing escape. I really felt I was at a resort. The breakfast buffet was plentiful and the service again was friendly. The location was convenient to all the sights and happenings of Key West.

Reviews.Title: “excellent would recommend to anyone!!”
Reviews.Author: nuttytart21
Reviews.Content: the reviews looked good and actually found it cheaper than if you booked direct with the hotel. we had a standard double room, but it had two massive beds in it!! we overlooked the car park, but to be honest we only were in the room to get showered and changed and to sleep. it gave a sense of security aswell to be able to see our car. the pool was fantastic with complimentary water lilos which were fab. the pool bar was welcoming and they had news channels on in both the bar and the reception so you could keep an eye on the weather ahead. the staff was nice. you had free internet in the reception for checking emails and other sites. the value for money was good. my whole family stayed here and in all we had 3 rooms. all were without complaint. i would definitely recommend this hotel. yes you have to drive into the main town and the beaches are the other side of the island, but to be honest key west is not renowned for its beaches so nothing is missed. having seen some of the other hotels in key west this one by far had a cozy secluded feel to it, you have fast food eateries right next door, so if you dont fancy paying over the odds for breakfast, which im sure is lovely and certainly spelt nice you can visit IHOP which is next door and half the price. book it before the availability gets snapped up!!

Reviews.Title: “the best hotel in key west”
Reviews.Author: tknorr03
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time, the hotel was great! The Pool-WOW!!! It was so exotic. The employees at the pool were very gracious. Your drink glass was never left empty. They had floats for the adults to float around on. (even had swimmies for the littlest swimmer. Close enough to key west, need to rent a car. The maid service didn't speak much english at all. Our room was nice thought we were getting one by the pool, by our reservation.... still don't know what happened to that.... We will definetly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place!”
Reviews.Author: rocky270
Reviews.Content: I booked this place because it was newly redone and looked like it had great landscaping by the pool. It was Great! The room was a little cramped for a family of 2 adults and 2 teens, but we managed. It had been newly rennovated, and that was nice...but be prepared to live out of your suitcase cause the closet and drawer spaces are limited. The outside cafe was nice, but the pool is the best! Beautifully landscaped, great poolside service for food and drinks, and they even give you rafts to float in the pool when you need them!!! My family rated this place an 8 or 9, and said it would have been a 10 if the room was bigger.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome time..”
Reviews.Author: Ambercatconnecticut
Reviews.Content: Well, I think without this hotel coming to save us during a bad trip, I would say my entire trip would have been a complete disaster. The airline lost our luggage, and found ourselves in a beautiful landscaped hotel and tiki bar. The bartender, Chris - who I wish to thank over and over again - was an awesome person to me and my best friend. Since we had no luggage, basically no necessities he lent us a lot of help. Unfortunately when we came back the next day to thank him, he was shipped out to Iraq. We were unbelievably sad. The food and drinks were great. The locals who visit the bar that we met, were nice as well. I think this was the best part of our trip... Thank you!!!

Reviews.Title: “So disappointing :(”
Reviews.Author: MsValentin0410
Reviews.Content: The reason we chose to stay here for our honeymoon in July '06 was because of the pool. Unfortunately, it was broken during our whole stay. Every room was a non-smoking room, even though they give you the option of smoking or non. They didn't even try to compensate for their stupidity. Stay here, it's nice...really.

Reviews.Title: “Lucious landscaped paradise”
Reviews.Author: nadels21
Reviews.Content: I spent five days in Key West the hotel was amazing! Everything was perfect! Parking was easy and when I got there I had made a few requests on arrival, which were accomodated accordingly. Our room was clean which was nice for our long stay. But the real notion goes to the lucious landscape and beautiful pool area. The tiki bar by the pool was perfectly placed and the tenders were kind, adjacent to the small restaraunt which was okay on service and food alike. The pool and jacuzzi were always well kept and beautiful at night to relax. I applaud the staff at this hotel, for I had an amazing time at this hotel which made my vacation memorable forever.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: haysfl
Reviews.Content: The Inn at Key West is great place to stay in Key West. The atmosphere with all the tropical plants is incredible. The pool is an amazing place to relax. The rooms were well decorated. The staff was great. I brought a boat to the Inn and the staff did everything they could to accomodate my needs. I will definitely stay there the next time I am there.

Reviews.Title: “The jury is still out on this one...”
Reviews.Author: Brimin2
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival, looks nice, welcoming lobby & beautiful pool. Room was lovely, beds were comfortable & request to be close to another family traveling with us & near pool was granted. First night, our friends AC broke and they were downgraded to a standard room. As luck would have it, that afternoon, our AC broke as well. No maintenance personell on staff, they use outside contractors. We left room for 3 1/2 hrs and returned to a sauna. Come to find out front desk guy never even called mechanic!! It gets better...we, too would be downgraded to the only room left in the hotel. I requested, (because it was never even offered) to be compensated. He said there was nothing he could do. Talk about poor customer service. No mgr on duty to address problems, but after much ado & complaining, finally got a call from mgr (at home). She profusely apologized for everything. The room we'd been moved to was the only one available & she could do nothing about that, but did compensate us. She was very polite & undersatnding and seemed shocked by her employee's behavior. The next morning we went to cafe for breakfast & staff were so rude that we left & checked out. Others around us were all complaining as well. The icing on the cake!! Or so I thought...now I get home to find my credit card has been charged double the amount of my receipt! It is a great location, easy to find, & the pool was nice. Until that last night, we were actually impressed with the place!! It only took the one guy at the front desk to ruin it for us. When the AC went out, had he been polite, apologetic & offered compensation us for the inconvenience of the move I would feel differently, which is what I told the mgr. Will I return??? That depends on how quickly and efficiently refund my credit card. It is in their control as to whether they have a customer pleased by the timely response to a problematic stay, or an unhappy customer due to lack of customer service. The jury is still out...

Reviews.Title: “Great Pool”
Reviews.Author: TexasBeachbum22
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 night stay at the Inn. The pool is AMAZING. Beautiful, relaxing cool. The poolside bar also has awesome pina coladas. We stayed in a deluxe room which was nicely furnished and clean. It was a little on the small side, but since we didn't spend too much time in the room it wasn't a problem. We had no problems parking the car and making the short drive to downtown. We had the breakfast buffett at the cafe every morning and it was fantastic, a great deal too. I would reccomend this place to anyone who doesn't mind the drive/cab ride to Duval and who wants to spend some time by an incredible pool.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of Bait and Switch”
Reviews.Author: LuvVacays
Reviews.Content: The hotel lobby was pleasant. The conciergeâ€™s desk is located on the left underneath the staircase. And behind the concierge were two guest computer stations. Upon check-in, the front desk assigned us a Deluxe Room. After walking a long flight of stairs to get to the second floor (because they donâ€™t have an elevator), we walked in and saw a room with less lavish dÃ©cor, more like outdated decor. I immediately realized that they had made a mistake. We then towed our heavy luggage back down to the front desk and asked to be switched to a Deluxe room as it is what I booked. The staff behind the counter denied that the room assigned was a Standard room and insisted that it was a Deluxe room. I challenged her by leading her to one of the computer stations, logged onto their website and pointed to her that a Deluxe room should look as such. She then returned to the front desk to check something and then reassigned us to one of the actual Deluxe rooms. To wrap up our conversation, she briefly said sheâ€™s providing the room to us at no cost because their website is misleading. The Deluxe rooms advertised online were of a different category, they belong in their Superior selection. Well, I am glad I was able to help clarify their room categories for them! We felt much more comfortable once we were in the Deluxe room, the amenities are different altogether including the flat-screen TV and their beautiful bathroom. The patio area was simple, there were 2 plastic chairs which we didn't use at all. The inn has a restaurant called the Inn CafÃ©. They have pretty good food, we can't speak for dinner but lunch was pretty good. My husband had a delicious snapper salad and I had a burger, quick service and affordable prices. There's also an IHOP next door for breakfast, again, quick service and affordable. Their pool is really, really nice. It has a dramatic fountain in the middle and made it look spectacular. If you don't stay here, try to come in just to use the pool. There were float beds on the water and you could easily doze off into the afternoon. It was a relaxing experience. The inn is situated right off the exit to Key West on Northern Roosevelt Blvd so it is a little ways away from the downtown area. It didn't bother us much since we drove.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: running12
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Inn last week & had a great time. The pool was big & very refreshing after walking in the afternoon heat. The Tiki Bar was affordable and staffed well into the night. We stayed in a superior suite but it was not superior in size. It was bigger than an average room but I wouldnt call it superior. The decor of the lobby & rooms was pleasant with monkey statues placed through out the lobby & rooms. Our room had a flat panel TV which was a nice feature. The staff was friendly & they allowed us to check in early. The hotel is not close to Duval st. so if your going to attempt to do the Duval crawl have a designated driver or take a taxi. Margaritaville was a let down, but Fat Tuesdays & Sloppy Joes were worth going back to. I would recommend The Inn to anyone planning to visit Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Pool”
Reviews.Author: quiltingtraveler68
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights. The rooms were nice and clean. The pool area was very nice, and we spent much time there. We had lunch at the pool, and the food was good, and with the prices, which were average. The drinks were also very good, and priced ok. I did not like the fact that they charged 23.00 per day for a shuttle to downtown, and no shuttle to/from airport. I think with the location of the hotel, they should provide free shuttle service. The staff was most helpful and friendly. I would stay again, but if you want to be close to a beach, it is not the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Pool!”
Reviews.Author: Yonaira S
Reviews.Content: The Inn was super-easy to find...always a bonus! Check in was a breeze and the room was comfortable. If you're looking for an extravagent hotel, this is NOT it, but it's clean and there were no bugs. The pool was by far the best part of the hotel, it gorgeous, clean and there is a hot tub close by if you feel the need for a little spa action. The downside was that housekeeping took FOREVER to clean the rooms. The first morning they were knocking on the door at 8am, the other three days they didn't show up until closer to 3 or 4pm. There is a grocery store within walking distance, but no fridge in the room. Try Hemingway House, Peppers (they sell all kinds of hot sauces) and Kermit's Key Lime Shoppe...they were all well worth it! Parking is very limited, you may want to consider renting a scooter or just wearing very comfortable shoes.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: JessicaMN
Reviews.Content: We were in Key West for our honeymoon. Very nice hotel! The room was elegant and even had granite countertops which added to the luxury feel. The pool is wonderful. It is surrounded by palm trees and other nice vegetation that makes you feel secluded and not on a busy island/street. Tiki bar poolside drinks are expensive but they are normally anyways no matter where you go it seems! The only negative I can think of is the bed sunk a bit in the middle (King size), so I felt like I would roll over and it took pretty much our whole stay (4 nights) to get used to it. I wasn't pleased with the bed. Otherwise, we've been to many hotels in our travels and this one was great!

Reviews.Title: “An Oasis at the Keys”
Reviews.Author: Tafftraveller
Reviews.Content: Have just arrived back from a visit to Florida and spent three great nights at the Inn at the Keys.Key West. Had read previous reviews and the good comments were all correct. We booked a deluxe room which was on the first floor (second floor if from the USA) great with two double beds overlooking the pool area. The road side rooms could suffer from traffic noise. The pool area is a sun trap oasis the best pool in all of the five hotels we stayed in during the holiday. The breakfast ,which is not included , was good but I was a little annoyed the guy added a 20% tip for basically a self service breakfast.(in the UK we tip for good service not for saying good morning) Ideal location, park up the car (free) and catch the local bus to downtown. The hotel shuttle is $23 per night per room. The local bus which stops at the shopping centre about 300yds from the hotel is $1 each way. (Save the money and buy yourself a nice meal down at the old boardwalk after seeing the brilliant sunset)

HotelInfo.Name: The Inn at Key West
HotelInfo.Address: 3420 North Roosevelt Boulevard, Key West, FL 33040
